loans.name: Dalia Sonia

texts.es: Dalia Sonia tiene 47 años, su actividad es la venta y elaboración de refrescos. Hace más de 9 años que tiene este negocio, las ganas de salir adelante con su negocio han hecho que sus esfuerzos den resultados. Ella tiene 1 hijo de 12 años a su cargo. Ella quiere realizar todas sus metas, ya que su vida depende de este negocio para poder brindar a su hijo un medio de vida. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de bolsas, azúcar, frutas, pajillas y además desea comprar una refrigeradora.
texts.en: Dalia Sonia, is 47 years old and has a softdrink business, which she has been in for nine years.  Her strong desire to get ahead is proven by the results obtained through all her effort.  She has a 12-year-old son in her care.  She hopes to reach all her goals because her ability to provide for her son depends on this business.  The loan will be used to buy bags, sugar, fruits, straws and a refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy bags, sugar, fruits, straws and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Virgen del Pilar se formó gracias a la ayuda de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en la zona. Actualmente está integrado por 15 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de obtener mayores ingresos para ellas y para sus familiares.
Una de las miembros es la señora Inocencia, ella tiene una despensa, la cual explota desde hace ya un tiempo, por medio de este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante e ir creciendo de forma progresiva y llegar a lo que hoy tiene. En cuanto a su clientela, comenta que la tiene bien formada, ya que muchas personas van hasta su tienda.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, lácteos, panificados y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee called “Virgen del Pilar” formed thanks to help from another committee working in the same zone.  It has 15 members, all women who are friends and neighbors.  They joined together to obtain higher income for themselves and their families.

One of the members is Inocencia.  She has a grocery store that she’s been running for some time now.  Through this work she’s been able to get ahead and to progressively grow until attaining what she has to date.  Her clientele is well-established since many people come to her store.  She’s asking for the loan to buy foodstuffs, dairy products, baked goods and others to stock up and be able to satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: to buy beverages, foodstuffs and others.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda, a 34-year-old mother of one son and two daughters, is married to a carpenter who wants to improve the quality of his work by purchasing a new carpentry kit. Linda is therefore requesting a loan of $1,500 from FATEN for this purpose. The kit will enable her husband to more effectively compete with others and secure extra work to increase his income and better provide for his family.

Linda is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in his carpentry shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new carpentry kit to improve her husband's work.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora María de Jesús de 48 años es una fémina trabajadora y emprendedora. Ella inicio su pequeña venta con el comercio de chiverías y dulces (ranchitas, tortillitas, bombones, chicles, papas, paletas, gomas…etc.) poco a poco fue invirtiendo en otros productos como huevos, pan, queso, fósforos, champú...etc.
En la actualidad tiene su negocio surtido con variedad de productos y el crédito lo invertirá en granos básicos, cosméticos y verduras…etc.
texts.en:
María de Jesús is 48 years old and is a hardworking and enterprising woman.  Shes started her small business selling dairy products and candy (tortilla chips, candy, chewing gum, potato chips, Popsicles, bubble gum, etc.).  Little by little she began investing in other products such as eggs, bread, cheese, matches, shampoo, etc.  

Currently, her business is stocked with a variety of products and she will use the loan to buy staple grains, cosmetics, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, cosmetics, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Para Mejor Futuro 4 Group

texts.en:
Yohanni is a young woman with a child. She lives in a zone of little resources in the city of Santiago, which is one of the most populated in the Dominican Republic. Yohanni says her most favorites things to do are reading and watching television. She operates a nail salon where she serves her customers with manicures, pedicures, and placing artificial nails sevices.

Yohanni is receiving her first loan from Esperanza Internacional and will invest this capital to buy nail polish, acrylic nails, and others materials. She started her business 3 years ago with her own savings after she learned how to work with nails. With her business profits she will reinvest in her business. She  dreams of having a nail and beauty salon in a better location.

Yohanni and her group are going to devote themselves to various areas of work such as clothes, cosmetics, shoes, beauty salons, grocery stores etc. Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: to buy nail polish and acrylic nails

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nzadze

texts.en:
Nzadze is a married woman with four children; one attends school while three are still too young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a kiosk business, selling in this shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors. She dreams of expanding to a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour and sugar for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba has been a baker at Ayensudu near Elmina for four years now. She is a single parent with one child.  As a single parent she feeds, clothes, and pays her child's school fees with her income. Aba needs this loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar, and oil for baking. With the new profit, Aba would like to give her child the best education.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar, and oil for baking

loans.name: Naume

texts.en:
Naume is a forty-eight-year-old married lady with three children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent home. 

For the last three years, she has been running a retail shop where she specializes in selling jerrycans. Her major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However she has a goal to expand her business into new areas and move it to a more permanent location.

The purpose of this loan is to to buy jerrycans for resale.

loans.use: to buy jerrycans for resale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua produces palm kennel oil to sell in Asebu Ekroful, Ghana.  She is married and has five children.  Her husband is a fire services personnel.  Ekua has been selling palm kennel oil for fifteen years.  She helps her husband provide for their children.  She will use her loan to buy more palm kennel to produce kennel oil to sell.  She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more palm kennel to produce kennel oil to sell.

loans.name: Philip's Group

texts.en:
Philip is 50 years old, has 4 children, and lives in Kamaena A village in Kenya. Philip works as a peasant farmer for a living. His community of Kamaena A village does not have access to clean water. The water that is used for drinking and cooking is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases. Philip is a friendly member of the community, and has been elected Promoter by his village to help its members obtain safe drinking water.

As a volunteer Promoter, Philip represents the community on Kiva’s website and educates the community on how to protect their families from unsafe drinking water by using a chlorine dispenser system. Philip and another promoter in his community, named Jeniffer, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Philip wants to be a promoter because he believes that the dispenser system will prevent water-borne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Philip’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel is a Babban Gona farmer from Pegi Vilage. Ezekiel joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ezekiel will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs, such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Ezekiel would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields

loans.name: Yah'yo

texts.ru: Яхье 50 летный бизнесмен. Он из города Худжанд. Яхье на рынке города занимается торговлей деятельности. Он продает овощи. Ему помогает его жена. У Яхье двое детей. Один сын и одна дочка. Яхье 10 лет занимается торговлей деятельности. Он перевозить овощи и перепродает их на рынке. Яхье вот так зарабатывает на жизнь. Он хочет увеличить товарооборот и расширить деятельность. Яхье просит кредит для перевоза больше ассортимент товаров. Он верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.

loans.use: Для увеличения товарооборот и расширения торговлей деятельности.

loans.name: Hemid

texts.en:
Hemid was born in 1973. He is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Lachin region. He and his family settled in Absheron region Masazir village.
He borrowed a loan of $400 to buy 2 wheels and 1 accumulator.
For the first ime he borrowed a loan off $800 o repair his car. 
Now he needs a loan of $1200 o buy other lorry.

loans.use: To expand he area of his own shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lillian wants to buy 2 dryers and chemicals, and expand her salon

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en: A. Sevil has 3 members in her family. She is 27, young and smart. That’s why she decided to apply for US$ 1200  in 2002 from Aqroinvest CU for animal breeding. She is now planning to buy a cow and sell milk in the future and to purchase a calf.

loans.use: Going to purchase a cow and a calf

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia has lived in this house for eight years. She has five kids, one with a former husband. Her present husband has a small shop where he dedicates himself to iron works. When we asked her husband about who helps whom in the family, he stated that it is he who helps her, as her business is smaller than his.

Julia's business is selling clothing which she normally buys in the capital, Santo Domingo, where there is a secondary market for the Haitian packs ("pacas") of new and used clothing that are sold in the border towns, which become major trading markets between Haitians and Dominicans at the beginning and end of the week. As the majority of the Haitian people are very poor, they get donations in the form of new and used clothing. They pack these into "pacas" and bring them to the border in order to convert the goods into money they can use to buy food and other necessities. Their Dominican counterparts take this opportunity to purchase goods at discount prices, so that they can in turn use these low-cost (usually high-quality) products for sale back in their hometowns.

Julia doesn't have the opportunity to make the long trip (usually a whole day) to the Haitian border. because the trip to Haiti is expensive. The cost runs anywhere from $25 to $30 in public transportation (roundtrip). However, she needs to take the time and trouble to buy these products if she wishes to make the profit margin which hopefully will more than justify the sacrifice involved.

loans.use: Take an expensive trip to the Haitian border to buy bundled clothing

loans.name: Ma Del Rosario

texts.es:
"I need this loan to finish construction on a room. I would like to install a wood roof to better use the room, since my home is very small. I am requesting a $1000 loan to add a room and a roof"

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

“Necesito terminar la construcción de un cuarto, me gustaría poner un techo de madera para poder habitarlo ya que mi vivienda es muy reducida” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para poner un techo de madera a un cuarto.

loans.use: To build a wood roof.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Dionisio is a native of Tayy Loma in Carapegua, is 36-years-old, is single without kids, and lives alone. He makes a living by traveling and selling craftwork like handmade bedspreads and tablecloths, embroidered by the women of Carapegua, an activity that is typical in the region. Dionisio has done this since he was very young because his father did the same type of work. Dionisio would accompany him to make his sales, and this is how he learned the trade and got to know various places that now constitute his work area.

One of the most difficult experiences he has had was when it was discovered that his mother had a very serious illness and needed a very expensive treatment. Because of this, Dionisio traveled to Argentina in search of better work opportunities. He returned several years ago, and with the little savings he had, he bought merchandise to sell once again, traveling to different places and cities.

Dionisio needs this credit for the purchase of bedspreads, tablecloths, embroidered napkins, and shirts, among other things, to make wholesale sales of them, since the demand for these products had increased in the last few months.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Dionisio es oriundo de la compañía Tayy Loma de Carapeguá tiene 36 años de edad es soltero sin hijos y vive sólo.

Se dedica a la venta ambulante de artesanía como sobrecamas y manteles artesanales, bordados a mano por las mujeres de Carapegua y cuya actividad es típica de la zona. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a esta actividad ya que su padre se dedicaba a la venta de los mismos y el desde niño lo acompañaba a realizar la venta, fue así como adquirió el oficio y conoció varios lugares que hoy constituye su zona de trabajo.

Una de las experiencias más difíciles que paso fue cuando a su madre le detectaron una enfermedad muy grave y que demandaba un tratamiento muy costoso; a causa de esto, Dionisio, viajo a Argentina (país limítrofe de Paraguay) en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales. Hace unos años volvió, y con un poco de ahorro que le sobro compro mercaderías para venderlas otra vez, recorriendo diferentes lugares y ciudades.

Dionisio necesita el crédito para la compra de sobrecamas, manteles y servilletas bordadas, camisas entre otros para venderlas al por mayor, ya que en los últimos meses ha aumentado la demanda de estos productos.

loans.use: Purchase of bedspreads, tablecloths, embroidered napkins, and shirts.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline, 55, has eight children, ranging in  age from 17 to 31. She previously owned and operated a successful home improvement company and is now looking after her plantation business. She has an immaculate credit history and continues to repay current debts in full and on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maria del Socorro has 3 children, for whom she always wants to provide more. Her partner works hard but his earnings aren't enough to cover the family's expenses. Five years ago, Maria went to work in a taqueria for 4 hours every afternoon. Later, she decided to make food herself, at home, and sell it to the employees of a local company where she knew some of the workers. They recommended her food to their co-workers and, little by little, more orders for her food rolled in.

Maria del Socorro doesn't have, however, a secure way to store her deliveries and, consequently, she has to travel back and forth from home to factory in order to deliver her orders. She's applying for a US$650 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, so that she can buy a "stand" (cart?) for carrying her orders and, by speeding up her deliveries, increase her customer base. With your help, Maria can push her business ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

María del Socorro, tiene 3 hijos a los cuales desea siempre darles lo mejor, y su pareja también trabaja mucho, sin embargo lo que gana no es suficiente para poder pagar los gastos de sus hijos. Hace 5 años María ingresó a trabajar por las tardes en una taqueria por 4 horas, y después decidió preparar comidas en su domicilio y ofrecerlas a los trabajadores de una empresa, ya que ahí tiene varios conocidos y estos han sabido promover su negocio de comidas, y poco a poco más y más empleados de la empresa piden comidas.

Sin embargo María del Socorro, no cuenta con un lugar seguro para poder transportar su comida a la fábrica y esto hace que María tenga que dar más vueltas para poder entregar sus pedidos. Es por esto que María está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María del Socorro podrá tener en qué llevar sus pedidos y así obtener más clientes, porque se tardaría menos en entregarlos. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante su negocio.

loans.use: Buy a "stand" (cart?) for food deliveries.

loans.name: Abduhalim

texts.en:
Abduhalim U. lives in the Mastchokh region of Tajikistan. He is married and has three children.

Abduhalim has been a client of the MicroInvest since 2004. He started his business practically from scratch, but now he has an “oshhona” in the crowded market-place/bazaar. “Oshhona” is a small restaurant offering the national foods, but the main course is the traditional national meal called “plov”. He prepares the courses according to the traditional recipes. Now Abduhalim is applying for a loan to purchase special equipment.

loans.use: Purchase special equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
Fertilizers and seeds for his land

Fertilizantes, abono y semillas para sus tierras

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Mrs. Mariluz V. is 45 years old, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood, she is single, and has three adult sons.

Her source of work is a grocery store which she started 8 years ago and which has grown quite a bit. She will soon be able to turn it into a general store because she has prospered in her community due to her warm personality and hard work.

In spite of being a woman and alone, she has moved her sons ahead through her hard work. She is requesting a loan for working capital. She wants to supply her grocery store to attract more new customers and retain the exiting ones.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Mariluz V. tiene 45 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, su estado civil es soltera, tiene 3 hijos todos mayores de edad.

Su fuente de trabajo es una Pulpería que con gran esfuerzo hace 8 años inició y ha crecido bastante, pronto podrá ser una Miscelánea ya que ha tenido prosperidad en su comunidad como resultado de su calidez humana y esfuerzo de trabajo duro.

Como mujer sola sacó adelante a sus hijos fruto de su duro trabajo. Solicita un crédito para capital de trabajo, quiere abastecer más su pulpería para atraer más clientela y retener a la que ya tiene

loans.use: Supply inventory for her store

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is a 25 year old married woman with a ten month old daughter. She started her restaurant business two years ago. It offers typical Ugandan cooked food - beans, rice and matoke - which she serves three times a day, seven days a week, from 7am to 10pm. Hanifa employs only one worker in her restaurant. 

Hanifa is seeking a loan to purchase a saucepan, some plates, and ingredients to cook in her restaurant.

Hanifa's husband sells shoes on the side of the road in Kampala and she cares for her daughter at work each day. She would really appreciate this loan so she can continue to support her family.

loans.use: Hanifa is seeking a loan to purchase a saucepan, some plates and ingredients to cook in her restaurant.

loans.name: Villa Antofagasta Group

texts.es:
The "Villa Antofagasta" group has been part of the Pro-Mujer (Kiva partner) family for a number of years. The group comes from the city of El Alto, Bolivia, and to date have 18 members who have proven to be organized with their loans and internal activities. The majority of the members are married with children, most of whom are either in school or college, although some have had to abandon their studies due to a lack of economic resources. The goal of their parents is to work to generate more income so their children's education can be fulfilled and in this way ensure them a successful future.

There a different types of business within the group, for instance the sale of condiments and spices and the sale of casual clothing, but the principal activity of the members is the making of chompas (sweaters), chalinas (scarves) and other traditional clothing items of the area, which they sell at festival markets in La Paz. The group needs more capital to purchase the high-quality raw materials needed to make these types of articles and thus attract a better clientele and increase their earnings. The sole goal is to improve their economic situation in order to offer their children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La asociación denominada “Villa Antofagasta” forma parte de la familia de Pro-Mujer hace ya varios años, esta se encuentra en la zona de Alto Lima, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con 18 socias que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas. Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con hijos, casi todos en edad escolar y también universitarios, de los cuales muchos tuvieron que abandonar sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos. Ahora el objetivo de sus padres es el trabajar más para generar ingresos que les permita solventar los estudios académicos de sus hijos de esta forma asegurar el futuro de ellos, afirman. Existen diferentes negocios dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de condimentos y especies, de ropa casual , pero la actividad principal es tejido de chompas, matillas, chalinas y otros, que luego las venden en las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz. La asociación Villa Antofagasta” afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra materia prima de mejor calidad de esta manera sus tejidos también tendrían mejor calidad y así obtendrían mayores clientes y por consiguiente mayores ganancias con el unico objetivo de mejorar su situación económica de esta manera ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor forma de vida principalmente en su educación.

loans.use: Purchase high-quality materials to make tradition clothing items / Necesita capital para la compra de materia prima de mejor calidad.

loans.name: Liberata

texts.es:
Liberata is 60 years old and married. She never had the opportunity to study. She has six children with her husband, Cirilo U. Coarita; five of them are in neighboring Chile and one of them is studying in the university. She and Cirilo own their home which fortunately has electricity, water, and a bathroom. They live in the Patascachi neighborhood in Unicachi, Yunguyo, Peru.

For the last 20 years, Liberata has worked in the production of decorative ropes and nets which she sells in the Tinicahi and Yunguyo markets.

She also sells potato flour and potatoes in the markets. She belongs to the “San Pedro D. Unicachi” village bank.

With this $125 loan which she will repay in four months, she plans to buy wholesale nets and rope.

She counts on the help of her husband who travels to Lima to buy the ropes and nets wholesale. Her great desire is for her children to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Liberata tiene 60 años D. edad, no estudio, es casada con Cirilo U. Coarita con quien tuvo seis hijos, quienes cinco D. ellos están en el país vecino Santiago D. Chile y uno D. ellos esta estudiando en la Universidad; La casa donD. vive es propia cuanta con luz, agua, letrina y esta ubicada en la Barrio Patascachi del Distrito D. Unicachi, provincia D. Yunguyo. El negocio que tiene la señora Liberata es la elaboración D. Soga o cahuiya, también hace redes, desD. hace 20 años , que los venD. en las ferias Tinicahi y Yunguyo. Paralelamente, también venD. chuño y papa en las ferias. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Pedro D. Unicachi”. Con este crédito D. S/. 300.00, que será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará redes y soga al por mayor. Su anhelo es que sus hijos sigan trabajando, cuenta con la ayuda D. su esposo que viaja a Lima para comprar redes por mayor, esperan seguir trabajando.

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale nets and ropes

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
K. joined the TYM Fund in 1998. She has two children, both of whom are grown. Before participating in the fund, the family experienced financial hardships due to the lack of capital for their business.

She used her first loan to purchase scraps and resell them for an income of 60,000 VND per day. She now hopes to borrow capital to invest in renovating their breeding facilities to rear livestock because she does not have the physical capacity to continue the scrap retail business.

For this loan, K. hopes to raise 9,000,000 VND. Her income is 2,500,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Khánh tham gia vào quỹ từ năm 1998. Gia đình chị có 2 con đều đã trưởng thành Trước khi tham gia Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị còn khó khăn do thiếu vốn làm ăn. Sau khi vay vốn về chị dùng để đi thu mua phế liệu về bán cho thu nhập 60.000 đồng/ ngày. Đến nay do không có đủ sức khoẻ để đi thu mua phế liệu nên chị mong muốn được vay thêm vốn để sửa sang chuồng trại và đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 đ. Thu nhập 2.500.000 đ/ th áng

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Quach Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Quach Thi P. has been in TYM since 2000. After 8 years in TYM, she has borrowed VND 45 million in total to invest in raising animals and plating trees. With this loan amount, she has made obvious changes in her business. Starting with a small model, she now has a relatively big business with many kinds of fruit-trees and animals. Besides fruit-trees, her family grows ornamental plants for sale to local people. Doing this business, she is also assisted by her husband, who is a motorbike taxi driver. Strongly believing in the success of her business, she applies for VND 19 million to buy breeding trees and fertilizer. With an income of 3 million, she thinks it is easy for her family to repay the loan
texts.en:
Note: the original description was in English

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Elsa Charo

texts.es:
Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal Minka. Elsa es madre soltera, tiene 43 años y 1 hijo, Elsa se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, su taller se ubica en una calle céntrica en un local alquilado, Elsa cuenta con 2 personas que le ayudan a realizar las confecciones. Además Elsa alquila vestidos de novia, de fiesta, ternos, prendas que compra en la ciudad de Lima, actividad que realiza desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.

Elsa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de vestidos de fiesta, ternos. Los sueños de Elsa es tener una tienda de venta de telas, ampliar su taller de confecciones y que su hijo sea una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Minka communal bank. Elsa is a single mother, 43 years old and has one son. Elsa tailors dress clothing. She rents her workshop, which is located on a central road. Elsa has two people that help with the tailoring. Additionally, Elsa rents out wedding dresses, party gowns, and three-piece suits, which she buys in Lima. She runs her business between 8 in the morning and 9 at night. Elsa needs a 1000 soles loan that will be used to purchase party gowns and three-piece suits. Elsa dreams of owning her own fabric store, expanding her workshop and raising her son to be a good person.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elsa needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase party gowns and three-piece suits

loans.name: Benigna Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Benigna Amelia P. HU. tiene 50 años, pertenece al Banco comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras II y vive en la calle Desamparados 677 balneario de Buenos Aires Norte del distrito de Víctor Larco provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió primaria completa pero no pudo seguir estudiando por motivos económicos, ya que vivía en la sierra donde no había educación superior, es de Santiago de Chuco.
Benigna es madre soltera, tiene un hijo por el que tiene que trabajar y luchar para mantenerlo y darle una vida digna.
Trabajaba vendiendo  insumos para el calzado, pero actualmente se dedica a elaborar adornos para el calzado, aprendió a hacerlos y ahora es su actual negocio.  También trabaja en un taller de costura. El negocio es en su propia casa.
Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas con lo que compró materiales para los adornos.
Con este crédito de 350 que será cancelado en 4 cuotas ampliará su negocio, comprando cueros, lencería y otros materiales.
Su sueño es darle una vida cómoda a su hijo y verlo profesional.
texts.en:
Benigna Amelia P. HU. is 50 years old, is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras II community bank and lives at Desamparados 677 in the Buenos Aires Norte neighborhood in the Víctor Larco district, Trujillo Province, La Libertad department in Perú. She is from Santiago de Chuco and finished primary school but couldn't continue studying for economic reasons, since she lived in a mountainous region where there wasn't higher education. Benigna is a single mother, has a son for whom she has to work and fight to support and provide with a dignified life. She worked selling materials for shoe stores but currently works actually making decorations for shoes. She learned to make them and now it is her current business. She also works in a sewing workshop. The business is in her own home. Her first loan was for 300 Soles, repaid in 4 months with which she purchased materials for her decorations. With this loan of 350 Soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will expand her business, buying leather, linens, and other materials. Her dream is to provide a comfortable life for her son and see him become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of leather and other materials for shoe decorations

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mrs. Sin V., age 25, is a rice farmer who lives in Kopongkdey Commune in Siem Reap Province. She is the mother of two children who are both still young and go to school. Her husband, Mr. Koch Meung, 32, is a fisherman. He can catch over 20 kg of fish per day to sell for their daily income to sustaining his family's needs, especially to pay for his children's school fees. Koch hopes to purchase more fishing tools, and after discussions with his wife, they decided to apply for a loan to purchase more nets, and traps for catching fish.

loans.use: To purchase more nets, and traps

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey U. is a farmer in Trapaing Prey village in Takeo province. She owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Doem Thy, is a motorbike taxi driver. Even though they try to work hard, they do not earn enough income for the family to improve their living conditions. In addition, Mrs. Srey U. family members live in an old house which needs to be repaired.

Mrs. Srey U. is asking for a loan to buy timers to fix the house. She is 31 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, three are enrolled in the local school, and the remaining one is too young to work or study. Her husband is also shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy timers to fix the house.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi K. lives in Bhakepati Village. Bhakepati is located in Kathmandu district. Bhakepati is one of the developing villages of Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Mrs. K. lives in a nuclear family with her husband, one son and one daughter. Both her son and daughter are studying in grade 10.

Both Mrs. K. and her husband Mr. Ram K. are engaged in the same grocery shop. They opened their grocery shop 5 years ago. They sell various types of grocery items such as rice, maize, pulses, biscuits, and noodles in their shop. Their children also help them in their work. Now Mrs. K. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 20,000 to buy grocery items to meet the demand.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla O. is forty years old. She is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. The boy is currently in junior high school, and the girl is in primary school. Priscilla lives with her family in a house at Simpa, a farming community a few kilometers from Tarkwa in western Ghana. Her husband is a mason by profession in Takoradi, the regional capital.

Priscilla is a food vendor. She cooks rice and beans and sometimes serves soup. She cooks the food at home and sells it on the street in front of her house. Priscilla procures bags of rice and other ingredients she needs from nearby markets. She has been in this business for over thirteen years. She hopes to help her husband give their children the best education possible. Priscilla would use the loan to buy rice in bulk.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz U. is a rice farmer. Her farm is located in an uphill area in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She is 40 years old. She uses her harvest to raise her five children and to send them to school. Her husband, Sanny U., is also a farmer. Everyday, they go to their farm to check their crops to ensure a good harvest.

Aside from rice, they also grow vegetables in their backyard. They water their vegetable garden everyday. The profit she makes from selling vegetables is what she uses to pay for their other needs.

CEVI supports Beatriz in her business. Now, she enjoys the credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage after joining the CEVI credit program.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Miguela

texts.es:
La señora Miguela enviudó hace un año y medio, tiene dos hijas que estudian en la facultad y la ayudan en el negocio.

La señora siempre trabajó en el mercado en ventas y su marido era empleado público.  Con mucho esfuerzo lograron montar un negocio propio en su domicilio en las inmediaciones del Mercado Municipal de la ciudad de Luque.  Actualmente cuentan con varios clientes generalmente empleados de los comercios vecinos.

Le gustaría que sus hijas terminen la universidad y que administren su propio negocio.   También alquila  salones comerciales en la parte del frente de su domicilio aprovechando la zona preferencial  al mercado municipal.
texts.en:
Miguela has been a widow for a year and a half. She has 2 daughters that are university students and they help her with her business.

Miguela has always worked in the market selling items and her husband was a public servant. Ms. Miguela worked hard to start her own business which she operates in a commercial space that is attached to her home. Her home is located next to the municipal marketplace in the city of Luque. Now they have many customers who are generally employees of the surrounding businesses.

She would like her daughters to graduate from the university and start their own businesses. She also rents commercial spaces that are located in the front part of her home. These commercial spaces are very desirable since they are located in the preferred zone of the municipal marketplace.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bread, oil, flour, eggs, shoes, pants, T-shirts, dress shirts

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with three children. She makes and sells baked goods. Her kiosk is located close to the railway station. Her bakery has good quality products at affordable prices. Mariya has been in this business for 12 years.

It so happens that her husband and two sons are disabled. They can not work, can't take care of themselves. Mariay's business is the only source of income in the family. Mariya wants to help her daughter start her own business and be able to provide for herself.

Mariya would like to borrow 9,000 Ukranian Hryvnia to purchase sugar, oil and flour in bulk for her bakery. This way she would be able buy the ingredients for a lower price and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, oil, and flour in bulk

loans.name: Marvie

texts.en:
Marvie does household chores while managing a handicraft business doing cross stitch. She has good designs in cross stitch and great skill, making her ambitious to earn more income. She is 40-years old, married, and born in the province of Cagayan, in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Philippines. She has one son, named Bryan, who is 22-years old and will be graduating from nursing. Her husband is a soldier, which is why Marvie worries about his security all the time.

She is asking for a loan of 14,000 PHP. Marvie is hoping that, with this money, her business will be more productive and successful. She dreams of becoming a successful entrepreneur someday. Marvie always prays that God will guide her to be more patient in her work and in attaining all the goals in her life.

loans.use: Additional capital for a cross stich business

loans.name: Manuchehr

texts.ru: Манучехр Курбонов занимается торговлей. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 5 лет. Проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 28 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Манучехр занимается торговлей на рынке. Торгует он колесами от машины. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы поплнить свой ассортимент другими запчастями от автомашины.
texts.en:
Manuchehr K. works in sales, an area of business he has been in for over 5 years. He lives in the Vahdat district. He is 28 years old, married, and has two children. He sells auto tires at the market and is requesting a loan to expand his inventory into other auto parts.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Aminedeke Peduni Betty Group

texts.en:
Betty P. is 28-years old, married, and has four children. One of her children goes to school; the others are still too young. 

Betty has had a business selling local brew for the past 10 years. She will use this loan to purchase millet and yeast for brewing. Previous loans have improved her business and she has been able to obtain a pig and a goat. Now she is not in hardship like she used to be. 

Betty is an active member of her community where people are encouraging one another to form small groups for development. Her plan for the future is to buy a cow.

loans.use: To purchase millet and yeast for brewing

loans.name: Dondov

texts.en:
Dondov D. is 59 years old and married. She lives with her husband in Uvurhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces located 400 kilometers from the capital city. All her children are grown and live separately with their own families. In 1998, she started running a cosmetic sales business at the local market. She rents two stalls and hires a saleswoman. Once or twice she goes to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city, to purchase cosmetic items at a wholesale prices. Most of her customers are local girls and women.

She has invested her profits in her children's life. Dondov says, "My husband and I have been running our small business although we have already retired. Staying at home doing nothing is hard for us. If we work everyday, then we feel healthy and good. With the profit I'm saving small amounts to purchase second-hand car for one of my children." With this loan, she will buy more cosmetic items from the capital city to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic items for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Modinatu

texts.en: Modinatu D. is 40 years old and married with four children. She sells provisions. She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice.wheat flour.sugar and salt

loans.name: Marga Angelica

texts.es:
La señora MARGA ANGELICA A. D. G.   tiene 51 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Usquil  , provincia D. Otuzco, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
MARGA es casada y pertenece al Banco Comunal Cachanchugo II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 6to  D. primaria, porque sus padres ya no la mandaron al colegio y le enseñaron D. pequeña a trabajar en el campo, sembrando, desgranando maíz, pasteando las ovejas, alimentando a los cerdos, etc 
Está casada y tiene 3 hijos todos mayores quienes no dependen económicamente D. ella.
Cuenta con el apoyo D. ellos ya que mensualmente le dan su propina, cuando esta enferma la llevan al medico y le compran sus  medicamentos.
MARGA  se dedica a la venta D. productos alimenticios en la tienda D. comestibles que tiene en su casa en donD. venD.: arroz , azúcar, aceite, jugo, huevos, gaseosas, papel higiénico, fideos, etc
Para comprar los productos alimenticios que venD. en la tienda D. su casa ella viaja a Usquil o a Trujillo cuando compra al por mayor para que pueda obtener mayor ganancia.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles mando a hacer una pizarra para chocar afuera D. su tienda los nombres y precio D. los productos.
Este crédito D. 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá para viajar a  Trujillo a  comprar  más productos alimenticios como: arroz, aceite, jabón, pasta dental, azúcar, jugos, papel higiénico ,etc
Marga tiene como sueño ampliar su tienda y poder vender mas productos alimenticios.
texts.en:
Sra. Marga Angelica A. D. G. is 51 years old and lives in the District of Usquil, Otuzco Province, Department of La Libertad, Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Cachanchugo II”.

This entrepreneur completed her elementary school education. Her parents did not let her continue her schooling and taught her how to work the fields, plant crops, harvest corn, herd the sheep, feed the pigs, etc. She is married and has three adult children. Her husband and children proviD. her a monthly stipend so that she can visit the doctor when she is ill and buy medicines.

Marga operates a grocery store out of her home where she sells rice, sugar, oil, juice, eggs, sodas, toilet paper, noodles, etc. To purchase food products for her store, she travels from Usquil to Trujillo where she can buy products in bulk to increase her profit margin. She used her first loan of 300 soles to make a chalkboard to place outsiD. of her store listing the product names and prices.

Her current loan of 800 soles will be used to buy more products in Trujillo such as rice, oil, soap, toothpaste, sugar, juice, toilet paper, etc. Marga dreams of expanding her store and selling more products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil, soap, toothpaste, sugar, juice, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a married mother of two girls. Her family is an average Ukrainian family that works hard to ensure a safe and stable future for their kids.

Tatyana runs a small business selling women’s clothing in the marketplace of her home town, Znamenka. She has been in this business for three years. Currently, she has about 10,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her net profit is about 2,000-3,000 Grivnyas a month.

Tatyana usually builds up her stock two to three times a month. She is requesting a loan of 5,534 Grivnyas to stock her kiosk with additional seasonal merchandise. Tatyana always buys marketable inventory that sells fast and well. One of her short-term plans is to open a small covered store instead of an open kiosk. Tatyana has been very prompt with her payments. She has repaid all her previous loans without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: La señora Luz Marina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 50 años y es madre D. 04 hijos, los 04 que aun dependen D. ella.Lleva varios años dedicándose a la venta D. abarrotes. Luz Marina se inicio, con un capital D. 1,000.00. Tuvo que pasar por altas y bajas, para llegar a ser una gran empresaria, administrar su propio negocio y generar sus propios ingresos, sin dar cuentas a nadie. Con su esfuerzo y vigor, llego a implementar ahora su bodega, es muy conocida por sus clientes en el barrio donD. vive y sus ventas diarias son buenas. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su misma casa.Con este préstamo D. S/. 3000.00, comprará más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, insumos para el aseo personal, gaseosas en paquetes y productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela. Luz Marina, es una mujer con muchas ganas D. salir adelante para el bienestar D. su familia y D. ella misma, manifiesta su mas granD. agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.

loans.use: Comprará abarrotes.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Mr. Vicente P. is a resident of Northern Poblacion, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 32 years old, married and blessed with 2 children who are still going to school. He owns and operates a retail shop selling cosmetics and beuaty products. He has been engaged in his business for more than 5 years, earning 10,000.00. 
Currently, he's availing of his 2nd cycle loan amounting to 40,000.00 that will be used for additional products to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital of cosmetics products

loans.name: St. Thomas Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade, a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Beatrice is a trader of printed textiles. She is the leader of a trust bank group called St. Thomas. Most of the group members are either into trading and or farming activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Beatrice, the group leader, is seated in the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk

loans.name: C4351 Abanyamurava Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 49 years old, married with 2 children aged 19 and 23 years old. Jacqueline lives in Kimironko, which is in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.  Jacqueline is the president of a group called “Abanyamurava."  This group has successfully operated the business of selling clothes for two years. Today, Abanyamurava employs 2 people as helpers. The opening hours of the business are from 6 AM to 6 PM, every day except Sunday.

The members of this group are requesting their first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing their business in order to expand their business through purchasing a greater quantity and variety of clothes.  They expect that this will increase their monthly sales of clothing by attracting more customers.  This will (hopefully) bring them more profit. As the business grows and strengthens, they hope simply to take better care of their families.

loans.use: More quantity and variety of clothes for sale

loans.name: Walter Daniel

texts.es:
La señor Walter Daniel A. Cárdenas, es una señor de 30 años de edad emprendedor de un negocio de venta de granos básicos y otros productos como (comida para perro, embutidos, etc.)  El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$30,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 12 años. Este negocio está ubicado en el Mercado Israel lewite tercer anden de la entrada principal del mercado. 

 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de granos básico e insumo para elaborar comidas, que se vende mucho en esta época del año por la festividades.

El es casado, con 3 hijos a su cargo, en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio el trabajaba con su mama en el mercado vendiendo frutas y verduras. 
Lleva 7 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 2 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando su productos, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Walter Daniel A. Cárdenas, 30, is a merchant in the Israel Lewite market. He is located on the third aisle from the market's main entrance. He sells basic grains and other products like dog food, cured meats, etc. He began with an initial capital investment of 30,000 colones which he got as a loan 12 years ago. The financing requested now is to be used as working capital to buy basic grains and ingredients to prepare meals which are highly sought-after during the festivities this time of year. He is married and has three shool-age children under his care. He says that before having this business he worked with his mother in the market selling fruits and vegetables. He has had 7 loans with CEPRODEL over two years that he has invested in his business which have allowed it to grow and expand, diversifying his stock inventory. All this has been made possible by the loans granted by CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic ingredients for Christmas season meal preparation.

loans.name: Sabir

texts.en:
Sabir M. is an ordinary man from the small village of Imishli. He is a very responsible person who, since his youth, has been running a livestock farm with the goal of supporting his family – a wife and three children. Sabir needs to purchase calves to breed and maximize his profits by selling their milk and meat.

Once he has these products from his herd, he sells them in his neighborhood and in this manner he is able to support his family. For this reason, Sabir is turning to you for support that would permit him to continue developing his business. He applied for a loan of 1600 Azerbaijani manats to purchase three calves and fodder.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Noeun P. is 41 years old, and she lives in Trapeang Roka village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Sarun Parch, is a cow middleman. Since this business is doing well, Mrs. Noeun P. decided to ask for a loan to buy two more cows for her husband's business. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to support her field.

Mrs. Noeun Paeni is the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in the garment factory. The other one is a student in the local school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows for her husband's business and fertilizer to support her field.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 31 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. For two years, she has been running a hotel business (in Africa, a "hotel" is often a primitive restaurant) where she has employed four people. She previously owned a shop but currently relies partially on her husband’s salary.  

She appreciates Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner, for training her on business record-keeping and customer service. She requested 60,000 Kenyan shillings so as to purchase more groceries to add to her stock and for renovation of the business premises. She hopes to grow her hotel into a restaurant and also construct rooms for accommodation in future. She describes herself as hardworking and visionary.

loans.use: Add stock of groceries

loans.name: Jungie

texts.en: Jungie J. is from the village of Dimalo Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. He is 30 years old and single. To make a living, Jungie owns & operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Jungie has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Jungie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jungie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jungie is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jungie from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: El negocio de doña Rosa, es la producción de ricas rosquillas y cosa de horno, elaboradas de maíz, queso, manteca, dulce y procesadas al horno Desde hace varios años es su fuente de ingreso. Tiene 44 años de edad, con dos hermosos hijos , su esposo se dedica ala agricultura, y quien dio dinero para comenzar a trabajar, luego opto por financiamientos para invertir en mas y desplazarse al mercado. Las dificultades es que el maíz se pone a veces caro lo que tiene que subir el precio al producto y se bajan las ventas,y se desequilibra un poco, con esta solicitud comprara productos paa seguir elaborando sus productos como; maíz, manteca, dulce, queso, azúcar, leña, entre otros, así como seguir reparando el horno por que le tiene que dar mantenimiento, ya que no ha construido el otro que tiene previsto. Unos de sus objetivos es poder ayudar a sus hijos para que concluyan el ciclo de estudio y expandir las ventas para una mejor ganancia.
texts.en:
Rosa's business is making delicious rosquillas (round pastries) and other baked goods, made from corn, cheese, shortening and cane sweetener, and baked in the oven. For the past few years, this has been her source of income. She is 44 years old and has two handsome sons. Her husband works in agriculture, and he provided her with the funds to get started with her work. Later, she chose to take out loans in order to invest more in her business and travel to the market. One of the difficulties she faces is that corn sometimes becomes expensive; she has to raise the price of her product, and her sales fall, throwing her business a little off balance. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy ingredients to continue preparing her products, such as corn, shortening, cane sweetener, cheese, sugar, and firewood, among others. She will also carry out repairs to her oven, since it currently needs maintenance; she has not built another one as she had earlier planned. Her goals include helping her sons complete their level of study and expanding her sales for greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn, shortening, sugar, cane sweetener, and cheese to prepare more rosquilla pastries, and servicing her oven

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca sells groceries like toothpaste, milk, sugar and cream. She is 40 years old and married with three children who attend school. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the family. She is requesting a loan of 60,000 nairas to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She loves this business because it is profitable to her. She has a good relationship with Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Appoline Afiavi

texts.fr: G. Appoline Afiavi est née le 08 Février 1963 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Appoline Afiavi réside au quartier Agontinkon à Cotonou depuis 28 ans environs. Appoline Afiavi est mariée et a trois enfants à sa charge, tous scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Appoline Afiavi a très peu fréquenté. Pour faire face à ses différents besoins, Appoline Afiavi vend du charbon de bois à son domicile et au marché de Wologuèdè à Cotonou. Parallèlement à cette activité, Appoline Afiavi vend des calebasses. Appoline Afiavi se ravitaille à Djidja au Bénin. C'est la première fois que Appoline Afiavi sollicite un prêt de ALIDé, prêt qui lui servira à reconstituer le stock de ses produits et à mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Appoline Afiavi G. was born 6 February 1963 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has lived in the Agontinkon borough of Cotonou for the past 28 years. She is married and has three children to care for, all having attended (or still attending) school. The couple jointly shares family expenses. Appoline Afiavi had very little schooling. To meet her diverse needs, she sells charcoal from her home and at the Wologuèdè market in Cotonou. As a second activity, she also sells gourds. Her supplies come from Djidja in Benin. This is Appoline Afiavi’s first loan request from ALIDé, which will serve to replenish her stock supply and give better response to customer demand.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita C. is a 56-year-old married woman with three children who lives in Hda. Escolastica, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. Teresita has been a member of NWTF - Project Dungganon for 10 years now, and earns a living by running a ready-to-wear clothing business. She is purchasing a solar lantern with a 3,100 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan from NWTF to extend her productive hours and, at the same time, cut fuel costs and save money in the long run. About NWTF’s Green Loan Products Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit. To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save money for its clients. In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also function as charging stations for mobile phones. These families normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes. The solar lantern offers a free environmentally friendly renewable source of energy that allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs. About NWTF In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Solar Lantern

loans.name: Siimoa

texts.en:
Siimoa V. is 53 and married with 4 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Siimoa has 3 years of experience in this business.  Siimoa needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Siimoa joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Siimoa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Lialo Ole

texts.en:
Lialo Ole N. is 29 years old. He is married to Noonkuta N., and he is the father of four school-going children.

Lialo is a farmer. He farms his own piece of land. He has been doing this for the last ten years.

Lialo learned about KADET through a marketing awareness campaign conducted by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend the loan on maize farming. With the proceeds he hopes to make from this loan, he plans to lease additional land for farming in order to increase his farm production.

Lialo's dream is that he will be able to practice large-scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: maize farming

loans.name: Depend On God Group

texts.en:
Fatu F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Depend On God.  She is 47 years old, married and has three children who range from 16 to 25 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulties. She cares for two siblings. All of her children attend school.

For 20 years, she has been selling socks, underclothes, children clothes, head ties and gents wear at Waterside Market in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She says customers are attracted to her business because she talks to them in a friendly manner.

She plans to use her 10,400 Liberian dollar portion of this 52,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more socks, underclothes, children clothes, head ties and gents' wear. 
 
Her goal is to improve her business and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Georgette is inset at lower right because she was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more socks, underclothes, children clothes, head ties and gents wear.

loans.name: Jose Baldemar

texts.es:
José de 56 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, con el fin de pasar mas tiempo con su esposa y dos hijas el decidió tener su negocio de comidas rápidas, poco a poco con la ayuda de su esposa ha podido tener su propio comedor. 

Trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm, su esposa le ayuda a cocinar mientras que el reparte la comida. Venden hotdog, hamburguesas, papas con pollos y yogur. Su casa la utilizan para hacer la comida y afuera la venden. Pero para tener mas ingresos ellos quieren comprar con el préstamo una cocina, mesas y sillas . 

En el futuro el quiere tener un restaurante y poder así ayudar con el empleo a los chicos del sector de por su casa que no encuentran trabajo.
texts.en:
José, 56, lives in Las Orquídeas, Guayaquil. In order to spend more time with his wife and two daughters he decided to open a fast-food business. With his wife’s help, he gradually succeeded in having his own eatery. He works daily from 6am until 10pm. His wife helps with the cooking while he is in charge of making the deliveries. They sell hot-dogs, hamburgers, potatoes with chicken and yoghurt. They prepare the food inside their home and sell it outside. However, in order to increase income, they want to use the loan to buy a stove, tables and chairs. In the future, he wants to have a restaurant so that he can employ youngsters from the neighborhood who can’t find employment.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For a stove, table and chairs.

loans.name: Rosmery Delia

texts.es:
Rosmery es social del Banco Comunal Glorioso.
Rosmery es soltera y tiene 1 hija de 2 años, vive en casa alquilada,  Rosmery tiene una piñateria llamada Thuany en un local alquilado, en donde vende artículos para fiestas infantiles, negocio que inicio hace 4 meses y esta comenzando de poco, este negocio lo aprendió de su tía, aprendió a realizar trabajos en tecnopor y decoraciones para fiestas, pero todavía le falta implementar con mas productos. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de telas para decoración, tarjetas que adquirirá en la ciudad de Lima.
Los sueños de Rosmery es que su hija estudie en un buen colegio y comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rosmery is a member of the communal bank " Glorioso." Romery is single and has a two year old daughter; they live in a rented house. Rosmery has a pinata store called Thuany in a rented space where she sells things for children's parties. This is a business she has had for four months and is starting out bit-by-bit. She learned this business from her aunt learning to make things from Styrofoam and to make party decorations. She still needs to add more produts. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of fabrics for decoration and cards she will purchase in the city of Lima. Rosmery's dreams are for her daughter to study in a good high school and to buy some land to build a home on.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics for  decoration and cards.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat’s principal occupation is the cultivation and production of vegetables. She is an excellent and admirable farmer who learned from her father the techniques and secrets of this beautiful activity. These skills have allowed her to develop multiple agricultural capabilities. They have enabled her to take care of her loving family, especially in these times of numerous financial problems.

Sharofat requests your help in the form of a loan, which will allow her to earn greater revenues this year so she can reach her goals. She is asking for a loan of $3,000 USD in order to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. She will also use part of the loan to buy cattle.

Sharofat expresses her gratitude to everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites E. is from the village of Burgos, Naguillan. She is 29 years old. Marites is married with no children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling mobile phone credit loads in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marites is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marites from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
Silvio es  de la ciudad de Pilar, tiene 30 años y  está cursando el 4° año de la carrera de Ciencias Jurídicas en la Universidad Nacional de Pilar (UNP) en la ciudad de Pilar. El es el 2º hijo de 3 en la familia. Su madre es comerciante junto con su padre en la zona de Cerrito distante a 75 km de la ciudad de Pilar.

Silvio se encuentra trabajando en el Poder Judicial desde hace mas de 5 años, actualmente se desempeña como Ujier y a través de este trabajo que realiza le toca movilizarse por toda la zona del Departamento de Ñeembucú. Gracias a este trabajo el mismo se puede mantener y estudiar a la vez, está en los últimos años de la carrera que tiene muchos deseos de concluir. La finalidad de el mismo es el de poder contar el día de mañana de un excelente ingreso como para poder ayudar al progreso de su familia ya que son gentes de una zona muy humilde comento Silvio.

Actualmente es soltero y vive solo, pero piensa en el día de mañana poder contar con su familia propia y poder brindarle todas las comodidades.

El solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad y también para la compra de libros que está necesitando para estudiar.
texts.en:
Silvio is from the city of Pilar. He is 30 years old and is in his 4th year of a degree in Judicial Science at the National University of Pilar (UNP). He is the second of three sons in his family. Silvio's mother and father have a business, in the Cerrito area, 75km from Pilar. Silvio has been working in the Justice Service for over 5 years. At the moment he works as a court usher, and through his work he travels throughout Ñeembucú Department. Thanks to his job, he is able to continue studying. Silvio is in the last years of his degree and very much wants to complete it. He says that completing it will mean he can count on an excellent salary and be able to help his family, who are from a very humble area. He is single and lives alone, but hopes that in future he will have a family of his own and be able to offer them everything they could want. He is seeking the loan to pay his monthly University tuition and also to buy books that he needs for his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: University fees and books

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es:
La Señora Rosana M. es socia del banco comunal El Mirador, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza colonial, por los cuatro ríos que la bañan, su gastronomía y por ser la cuna de varios atletas que con el esfuerzo han brindados logros al país.

Doña Rosana  tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 22, 19 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive de manera independiente y su segundo hijo está estudiando en la universidad, su esposo trabaja como bodeguero en un reconocido centro comercial de la ciudad, la casa en la que habita no es de su propiedad por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora Rosana se dedica a pintar cerámicas, oficio que lo aprendió cuando trabajaba en una fábrica, en la actualidad trabaja independientemente,  se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, en este negocio lleva  2 años, vende recorriendo por diferentes lugares.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito con la banca comunal. El nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR  le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa, zapatos y así ir creciendo un poco mas en su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
Rosana M. is a member of the community bank named "El Mirador". She lives in the city of Cuenca. It is a city known for its colonial beauty, for the four rivers that flow across the city, and for its traditional foods. It is also the birthplace of many athletes that have brought acclaim to the country. Rosana is 39 years old, she is married, and she has 2 children aged 22 and 19 years old. Her eldest son is married and is independent but her youngest son is in university. Her husband is a stockperson at a well known store in the city. The house they live in is a rental property. Rosana paints ceramic items, a trade she learned when she worked in a factory. She works independently and she also sells clothing and shoes. She has had this business for 2 years. She sells by traveling to various locales. This is her second loan with the community bank. This new loan from Fundacion Espoir (Kiva Field Partner) will be used to invest in the purchase of clothing and shoes, to make her business grow. Her goal is to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Janett Del Socorro

texts.es: Janett del Socorro es una mujer muy responsable y emprendedora. Por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en financiamientos y en su trabajo, pues esta no es la primera vez que solicita ayuda. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que sabe que tiene familia que alimentar, pues busca la forma de generar ingresos, se levanta muy temprano para arreglar todos los productos de su local y atender a sus clientes. Este crédito es destinado para comprar ropa, calzado, cosméticos, sabanas y otras cosas.
texts.en:
Janett del Socorro is a very responsible and enterprising woman. She has a good deal of experience with finances and in her job, as this is not the first time she has asked for assistance. She sells general merchandise because she knows her family needs to eat, so she looks for ways to generate income. She gets up very early to arrange all of the products in her store and to tend to her customers. This loan is intended to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, sheets, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, sheets, and other items to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites A. is from the village of San Juan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 40 years old. Marites is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for breeding. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Brgy. San Juan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Chrouk

texts.en:
Chrouk N., age 41, and her husband, Hout Yan, age 61, earn a living by planting various crops on their own farmland. Chrouk N. also keeps ducks to produce eggs, and she sells the eggs to people who come to buy in bulk at her house. The couple has eight children, one of whom is married and seven of whom live at home. The family lives in Kompong Cham Province.

Chrouk N. has applied for a $700 loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase additional feed and ducks to raise.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and ducks to raise

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina U. sells food including daga (a type of fish), beans and mandasi (a doughnut-like bread).  She is requesting a loan to stock the same goods to sell.  Regina is 27 years old and is married.  Her husband is a watchman. She has 5 children;  3 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits resulting from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more goods to sell

loans.name: Tab

texts.en:
Tab N., 35, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat temple. 

N. is a farmer and fortune teller, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is an electrician, earning an income of about USD 5 per day.
