N. has to spend USD 30 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 40 on other necessary expenses every month. N. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase supplies for her fortune telling business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy supplies for fortune telling business

loans.name: Salohiddin

texts.en:
S. Salohiddin is 29 years old. He is married with two children. Salohiddin is dedicated to his agricultural business. Having little knowledge in the beginning, he had to learn a lot about farming. As of now, he has acquired a fair experience in agriculture.  Salohiddin is very happy, for his 2 children who are the motivation for his desire to grow his business. He approached IMON International to obtain a loan to buy more ingredients; seeds and fertilizer. This will enable him to sow for a good harvest and to take care of his children and his home.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Elle a 45 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est mariée. Elle exerce comme activité la vente de pagne en gros et en détail.  Elle s’approvisionne dans le pays voisin le Ghana à Accra et revient vendre à Lomé. Elle fait dans cette activité 8 ans déjà. Elle est née à Lomé et vit dans le quartier Klouvi-Kondji.  Elle demande un prêt pour acheter de nouveaux de pagnes.
texts.en: This woman is 45 years old and has 2 children. She is married. She runs a business selling pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African cloth) in bulk and at retail. She obtains her goods in the neighbouring country of Ghana, in Accra, and returns to sell them in Lomé. She has run this business for 8 years already. She was born in Lomé and lives in the Klouvi-Kondji area. She is seeking a loan to buy new pagnes.

loans.use: To buy and sell pagnes (a type of West African cloth)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with one boy who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

She has operated a poultry business for the past three years, selling at wholesale and at the market to food vendors and neighbours. In addition she also operates a fruit-selling business which contributes another source of income. Pauline faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to open a juice parlor in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling loan she wants to purchase a brood of chickens and repair her food sales stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a brood of chickens and repair her market stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic grains, chicken, meat, vegetables and fruit to continue increasing sales levels.

loans.name: Ayishetu

texts.en:
Married with three children and educated up to junior high school, Ayishetu A. sells secondhand clothing in Nyame Bekyere, Cape Coast. She has been in this business for seven years and her dream is to have her own shop instead of selling from a table. 
The purpose of her loan is to ramp up the volume of clothes for sale and also to expand the variety of clothes she sells. She intends to reinvest the profits into her business for further expansion. 
Her income pays for her children’s school fees and also contributes towards the household utility bills.

loans.use: To ramp up the volume of clothes for sale and also to expand the variety of clothes she sells.

loans.name: Sainte Bernadette Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SAINTE BERNADETTE est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est constitué de 11 femmes qui sont de la même communauté Ecclésiale. Elles font partie du de l'association des femmes Catholiques de Saint Thérèse. Leur principale activité est le petit commerce et l'élevage de porcs

Madame AWA S. (debout à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants en charge. 

Elle est détentrice d'une cantine à domicile. Elle y vend des produits alimentaires. Elle pratique cette activité depuis 04 ans.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son approvisionnement en marchandises afin d'accroitre ses revenus financiers pour mieux répondre aux besoins familiaux. 

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge des besoins familiaux et le payement des frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en: The ST BERNADETTE solidarity group was created on December 4, 2007. It consists of 11 women who are from the same church community. They belong to the Catholic Women's Association of St. Theresa. Their main activities are small businesses and raising pigs. The group members belong to the CEB of St. Theresa parish and are members of the Association of Catholic Women. They are engaged in small trade and raising pigs. The group was created on 04/12/2007. Mrs. AWA BA, standing at the right in the photo, is the leader of the group. She is married and the mother of seven dependent children.  She operates a canteen in her home where she sells food products. She has operated this business for 4 years. Her new loan will enable her to expand her inventory of merchandise so that she can increase her income to better meet the family's needs. Her goal is to help her husband take care of the family's needs and pay for the children's school fees.

loans.use: To stock up on merchandise for her canteen.

loans.name: Arasaty Group

texts.es:
Arasaty se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Maria G., quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 13 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 3er. ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria.
La sra. Maria vende ropas por su ciudad desde hace varios años, es un medio por el cual obtiene su ingreso de manera mensual, pudiendo mantener a su familia económicamente, pero debido a que se aproxima la época de otoño-invierno desea poder abastecerse de ropas de dicha temporada, por ello solicita el crédito, esperando contar con el apoyo de Kiva, como siempre.
texts.en:
Arasaty is the name of the excellent group of women in the city of Itá. The present general director named Maria G., who sells clothing, contacted a counselor in a weekly meeting she had in the area to find out about the type of work the Mujeres Emprendedoras [Enterprising Women] Committee has. Once she was counseled about the program, she was able to get 13 women together who are happily in their 3rd cycle now, working together and supportively. 

Maria has sold clothes in her city for several years. That is the way she makes her monthly income and is able to support her family financially. Due to the fact that the Fall-Winter seasons are coming, she wants to get supplied with clothing for those seasons. That is why she is asking for a loan, hoping to count on Kiva's support, as always.

loans.use: to buy lingerie and winter clothing

loans.name: Abdulla

texts.ru: Abdulla A. 23 qoda. On jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Abdulla ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji rassteniy. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit sajenci i semena raznix redkix rassteniy tak kak seychas sezon dlya posadki.
texts.en: Abdulla A. is 23 years old.  He lives in the  Absheron region with his family.  Abdulla is not married and does not have children.  He has been selling plants for two years.   Now he needs 2300 AZN to buy seedlings and seeds from different rare plants since this is the season for planting.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and seeds from rare plants

loans.name: Oscar De Jesús

texts.es:
Durante 16 años Oscar trabajó en Bogotá vendiendo mercancía, pero a raíz de la separación con su esposa tomó rumbo hacia la ciudad de Medellín, donde actualmente vende dulces y cigarrillos en el centro de la ciudad, Oscar se siente realmente afortunado de ser independiente, habitualmente trabaja de 9:30a.m. a 7:00p.m. Afirma que es un buen negocio pero que el invierno no le favorece las ventas. 
Él quiere adecuar su carrito de ventas para que éste se vea con mas presencia y pueda atraer mas clientela, igualmente pretende surtir su carrito para tener mas variedad de productos, sin embargo el no cuenta con el capital suficiente para lograrlo. Oscar tiene una hija la cual ha sacado adelante gracias a su negocio y quien hoy en día le ayuda a tener un ahorro fijo y programado para mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
For 16 years, Oscar worked in Bogotá selling merchandise, but in the wake of his separation from his wife he moved to the city of Medellín, where he currently sells sweets and cigarettes in the center of the city.  Oscar feels quite fortunate to be independent.  He usually works from 9:30 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  He states that it is a good business but that wintertime is not favorable to sales.

He wants to modify the cart he sells from so that it is more noticeable and can attract more customers.  In addition, he wants to stock his cart with a greater variety of products, though he doesn’t have sufficient capital to accomplish this.  

Oscar has one daughter who has gotten ahead thanks to his business.  Nowadays, the business helps him to have a steady income and plans for improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to improve his food stall and purchase snacks

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 29 years old and is married with two children, who are 2 and 5 years old. She sells food in her restaurant. She started this business three years ago and she employs four people to help her. Seraphine works from 6 am until 10 pm every day.

Seraphine has requested her first loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to buy new materials like plates, forks, and tables for her restaurant. With her profits, Seraphine will reinvest in her business and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy new materials like plates, forks, and tables  for her restaurant.

loans.name: Josef

texts.en:
Josef is a 47-year-old craftsman from village Mukhrani. He is married and lives with his wife Elsa, his father, and three children. The youngest of the children is one-year-old Anastasia. Josef works as a welder. He has his own workshop and equipment and receives orders from the villagers. Along with his main job, he is actively involved in the functioning of the family-owned small pig-farm. 

They have two pigs and five piglets. The family sells approximately 20 piglets per year. 

With the requested credit Josef plans to purchase feed for pigs and also cover expenses of maize sowing. The maize will be sown on the plot owned by the family. Harvested grain will be used for feeding pigs and piglets during the next year. 

Josef plans to reinvest the received profit in the pig-farm – he wants to sell fewer piglets and raise them in the farm. In the future more pigs will give him more piglets for sale, which means increased income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for pigs and pay for tilling the land.

loans.name: Manal

texts.ar: منال امراة متزوجة وام لولدان تعمل في بيع الألبسة والاحذية الاوروبية المستعملة هي امراة نشيطة محبة للعمل وتريد ان تساعد زوجها في تخطي الظروف الاقتصادية الصعبة والاعتماد على الذات هي امراة محبة للعمل وتريد ان تكون رأس مال جيد حتى تتمكن من تأمين العيش الجيد لأولادها وتحسين ظروف العمل تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة موسمية مستعملة واحذية تسعى الى تطوير المصلحة حتى تتمكن من تخطي الظروف المادية الصعبة كان للقرض السابق الأثر الكبير في تطوير العمل وكانت تلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة تمتلك مهارات تريد توظيفها في تحسين الظروف المادية والاقتصادية
texts.en: Manal is a married mother of 2 children. She works selling second hand European clothes and shoes. She is an active woman who loves her business. She wants to help her husband overcome financial difficulties and be independent, and to attain enough income to be able to improve her business and secure a good standard of living for her children. With this loan she wants to purchase more second hand stock. She is skillful and wants to work in better financial and economic conditions. Her previous loan helped develop her business greatly and she had the full support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more second hand clothes and shoes for her store and improve her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera de un pequeño niño. Vive en casa de sus padres  en el distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. Elizabeth es una mujer que lucha por el bienestar de su hijo y cuenta con el apoyo constante de sus padres. 

Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de comida, jugos, gaseosas y golosinas en un  kiosco instalado en su hogar. Ella atiende permanentemente a la clientela fija con la que cuenta, la mayoría de ellos son pobladores de su comunidad y la conocen por ser una mujer emprendedora y con voluntad para  ayudar. Elizabeth cuenta con este negocio desde hace 3 años y se siente muy contenta con el pues le ha traído satisfacciones.

Ella desea invertir en su negocio y ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar una fotocopiadora que instalará en su kiosco. Elizabeth sabe que  existe una gran demanda para este servicio y por lo tanto quiere contar con este.

Elizabeth es una clienta conocida para nuestra entidad y ha cancelado adecuadamente  los créditos que le hemos concedidos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 23 years old and the single mother of a small boy.  She lives in her parents' home in Tambogrande district, Piura.  Elizabeth is a woman who strives to improve the well-being of her son and has the constant support of her parents.

Elizabeth's business is selling food, juice, soda and candies from a kiosk located in her home.  She is always serving her regular customers.  Most of her customers are people who live in her community.  They know her as an entrepreneurial woman who wants to help.  Elizabeth has owned this business for three years and she feels very happy as it has brought her satisfaction.

Elizabeth would like to invest in her business and so she has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a photocopier that she will set up in her kiosk.  Elizabeth knows that there is a great demand for this service and so would like to have a machine available.

Elizabeth is an existing client of our institution who has repaid her previous loans properly.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier for her business

loans.name: Bevelyn

texts.en:
Bevelyn is 32 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 3 children.
Bevelyn works in the fish industry and catches and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested loan for 5000 to purchase more fish to sell.
Bevelyn has been a member of PMPC for this year. In the future, Bevelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase  variety of fish for sale

loans.name: Jyparkul's Group

texts.en: Jyparkul is the leader of this group. She is 27 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two children, both of preschool age. Jyparkul works as a teacher at school, but her monthly salary doesn’t cover their daily needs, so Jyparkul started to breed livestock. She earns additional money for the family budget by reselling livestock at a higher price after being fattened. With money from this loan, she wants to increase her livestock. In the future, with the profits gained from this activity, she plans to repair her house. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young and ambitious socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Resalía tiene 70  años D. edad, ella es casada, no tiene hijos dependientes, cuenta con casa propia localizada en una zona urbana marginal D. Lambayeque, Rosalía cuenta con servicios D. agua y luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado D. 200  familias.

Resalía cuenta con unn espacio muy amplio en su domicilio el cual utiliza  D. cochera brindando un servicio D. resguardo D. vehículos: Moto taxis y y  autos, cobrando por ello D. forma diaria, el lugar donD. realiza esta actividad es  muy amplio y tiene espacio disponible para 28 vehículos aproximadamente.

Resalía esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles, para que  con este dinero ella pueda invertir en la puesta D. techo y columnas (calamina y parantes) para el resguardo y una mayor seguridad tanto para ella como los vehículos, además percibe  ingresos adicionales producto del alquiler D. cuartos.

Resalía es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad D. vida. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Rosalía, age 70, is married and has no dependent children.  She has her own house in a marginal urban area of Lambayeque.  Rosalía has water and electrical services.  It is a small community with approximately 200 families.

Rosalía has quite a large space at her home that she uses as a garage providing vehicle protection service for “moto taxis” (three wheeled motorized vehicles) and cars.  She charges daily.  The place where she provides this service is very large.  She has approximately 28 spaces available.

Rosalía is requesting a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  With this money she will be able to invest in placing a roof and columns (corrugated iron and wood).  She will do this for protection and greater security as much for herself as for the vehicles.  She also gets additional income from renting rooms.

Rosalía is a hard-worker who endeavors every day to get ahead and to have a better quality of life.  The people who know her consider her to be a kind woman who is always ready to help others.

loans.use: to place a roof and columns at her garage.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 36 years old and married. She runs a food cafe, a business that has been in operation for 12 years. She has been a KADET client and this is her second loan to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase maize meal, wheat flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil and vegetables for her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to own a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase maize meal, wheat flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil and vegetables

loans.name: Carla

texts.es: Carla, tiene 22 años, es madre soltera de un niño quien vive junto a ella. Juntos habitan en casa de sus padres, con ellos y su menor hermana. El trabajo de Carla consiste en la venta de ropa a plazo, visita a sus amigos, vecinos  y familiares en busca de clientes, lleva haciendo esta actividad casi por un año. Le gusta éste trabajo, pues es independiente tanto en tiempo como en su economía. Sin embargo el tener que salir a vender en pleno sol, le resluta muy pesado y agotado. Considera rentable su negocio por que se lleva un promedio del 50 % en ganancia de acuerdo a su inversión, piensa algún día poder tener un local propio o alquilado en donde pueda seguir haciendo este trabajo. Este es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para segir trabajando. Con el monto solicitado, comprará ropa de vestir importados y nacionales para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carla is 22 years old.  She is a single mother and has a son that lives with her.  Together they live with her parents and younger sister in their house.  Carla sells clothing and her customers pay her in installments.  She visits her friends, neighbors and family looking for customers.  She has been doing this for almost a year.  She likes this work as she can work independently and manage her time and finances.  However, since she has to walk around in the sun to sell it is very hard and exhausting work.  She considers her business profitable because she makes an average of 50% in profit over her investment.  She plans to some day have her own or a rented local where she can continue her work.  

This is her second loan with MFP and she hopes that everyone's support will allow her to continue working.  With the amount requested she will buy imported and domestic clothing to meet her customer demand.

loans.use: purchase clothing to meet her customer demand.

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en:
Munhbat is 35 years old and lives with his daughter and wife in a house in Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His daughter is a high school student and his wife helps him to manage the family business. He started his business at Hangai wood trade market in 1990 and now is continuously managing the business. He buys wood that fills one truck at 600,000 MNT from wholesale market and retails smaller quantities of wood at 5,000 MNT, 15,000 MNT and 20,000 MNT.  He pays monthly rent for a commercial space of 45,000 MNT. His daily sales income is 100,000 MNT and his monthly profit is between 700,000 MNT to 800,000 MNT. 

He is planning to expand his business. He is very experienced at his field. He is a diligent and responsible man who says, "I want to fix my house with the profits I will earn from my business." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase 2 truck loads of wood.

loans.use: To purchase 2 truck loads of wood to sell

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 30-year-old man and married to Zipora, a 27-year-old lady. Samson and Zipora are blessed with four children named: Marcela, 6, who is studying in the first grade of elementary school, Marshanda, 5, studying in kindergarten; Margareth, 4, and Roy, 3. 

Samson used to run a poultry business for several years, but then this business went bankrupt because the poultry was suffered from disease and all died. In order to cover his family needs, Samson raises chickens to be sold. Currently Samson has six chickens, aged 1 to 6 months. The income from this business is insufficient to fully cover his family needs as well as his children’s educational needs. 

Samson plans to operate the poultry business again. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from TLM amounting IDR 10,000,000. He would like to purchase chicks, feed, and also to repair the cage. He is hoping that TLM is willing to assist him to start up the poultry business again.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, feed, and also to repair the cage.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 52, married and has three adult children. Her husband is a farmer and they live happily in a village where they plant and harvest rice for sale. Their common goal in life is to become successful so that they can give their children a bright future and help those who are in need of in terms of financial aspects. To achieve their goal they plan to improve their rice farming business by increasing their crop yields in every harvest season.

In this regard, Lourdes wants to ask for an additional capital of P15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost required in planting rice. They hope that they can increase their yields and income this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost required in planting rice.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Gregorio tiene 55 años, es un hombre trabajador y muy responsable, es soltero y vive solo. El tiene una casa propia, donde día a día trabajaba para brindarse una mejor calidad de vida. Su trabajo consiste en la agricultura, pues se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de dos productos que son fundamentales en la zona en donde vive, que es la palma aceitera que es vendido a un industria muy grande dedicada a la elaboración de aceite; así como la siembra de cacao que es vendido a los diversos compradores que vienen de la ciudad de Lima. Tiene  cinco años trabajando con el cultivo de cacao, y hace tres con la palma aceitera. Normalmente hace solo el trabajo, pero cuando es temporada de siembra y cosehca debe contratar peones para que lo ayuden con el trabajo. Él manifiesta que le gusta esta actividad porque esta en la naturales, lugar donde se siente muy bien, ama lo que hace, y le va bien ya que esta vendiendo su producto a un buen precio, espera mas adelante poner una empresa dedicada a la transformación del cacao de materia prima a producto elaborado. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, y expresa estar muy agradecido con la oportunidad que le darán para poder invertir en su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará sacos de abono para sus tierras, además contratará algunos peones para cuidar y fertilizar sus plantas.
texts.en:
Gregorio, 55, is a hardworking, very responsible man.  He’s single and lives alone.  He has a house of his own where he works daily to provide a better quality of life for himself.  His work consists of farming.  He plants and harvests the two products which are fundamental in the area where he lives which are palm trees producing oil that is sold to a very large firm that processes this oil as well as cocoa beans that are sold to various buyers that come from the city of Lima.  He’s been farming the cocoa beans for five years and the palm trees for three.  Normally he does the work by himself but during planting and harvesting seasons he must hire day workers to help him with the work.

He states that he likes this activity because he communes with nature where he feels very good; he loves what he does and he does well in it since he sells his products for a good price.   He hopes later on to set up a firm dedicated to transforming the cocoa beans from raw materials to finished products.

This will be his third MFP loan and he states that he’s very grateful for the opportunity he’s being given to invest in his business.  He will use the requested amount to buy sacks of manure for his fields and will hire a few day workers to care for and fertilize his plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Maryseller

texts.en:
Maryseller is 29 years old, married to Moses, and they have one child. She has operated a restaurant for the last two years, with a monthly profit of KES 15,000.  

Maryseller was introduced to KADET LTD by a group of registered clients with KADET LTD, and she is applying for her fourth loan from KADET LTD, after paying her previous loans well and in good time. She will use the loan to buy stocks of sugar, wheat flour and maize flour. 

Maryseller will save the anticipated profits and pay school fees for her child. In the future she hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 27 years old, married, and the mother of one child. 

Ahlam has been a professional tailor since 2008, making, repairing, or altering clothing such as suits, coats, and trousers for women. She has more than four years' experience in this field as well as a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. She has a good reputation, and she is well known in the surrounding area.

She decided to apply for a loan of $1800 to purchase a tailoring machine and a generator. She is aiming to earn more profits to improve her family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and a generator.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 45 años, es una  mujer luchadora, alegre con ganas de superarse. Vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos de los 6 en total que tiene, además de una sobrina, a la quiere y se esfuerza por darle lo mejor. Su casa es propia, inmueble que logró construir con el apoyo de su pareja. Luz se dedica a la venta de plátano, pescado y gaseosas, la cual está implementada en un espacio muy bien  acondicionado en su propia casa, lleva realizando ésta actividad ya hace cuatro años, que le han servido para  ser  concurrido por los vecinos y extraños, a los cuales  atiende con mucha amabilidad, alegría y  cortesía, para esto cuenta con el apoyo de su sobrina, para la atención al publico. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener un ingreso económico, además de socializarse, y gracias a ello ganó clientes. Lo que no le gusta es que los precios de los productos están que suben, lo cual hace variar sus márgenes de ganancia, pero al saber que tiene mucha demanda desea ampliar su negocio. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, le gusta mucho el grupo con el cual trabaja, porque son personas responsables. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en su negocio, comprando pescado, bebidas gaseosas  y plátanos en mayores cantidades y  a un menor precio, así podrá tener mejores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Luz is 45 years old. She is a determined and cheerful woman who wants to succeed. Luz lives with her partner and two of their six children. She also has a niece for whom she strives to provide the best. Luz lives in her own home, which she was able to build with the help of her partner. She sells bananas, fish, and soft drinks from a space in her home that is well-suited. Luz has been in business for four years and remains busy by serving her neighbors and strangers, who she greets with kindness, joy and grace. Her niece helps with attending to the customers. What she likes about her job is being able to earn an income and socializing with the customers she has gained. She does not like whenever the prices of her products increase because this creates variations in her profit margins. Luz wants to expand her business because she knows there is great demand.

This will be her third loan with MFP. Luz enjoys working with her group because the members are responsible people. The amount she requested will be invested in her business by purchasing fish, sodas, and bananas in bulk quantities at a lower price. This will help her to improve her profit margins.

loans.use: to buy fish, sodas, and bananas in bulk.

loans.name: Ariel Esneider

texts.es:
El señor Ariel a sus 22 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su propia tienda desde hace un año, en la cual vende productos como granos, frutas y verduras, snakcs, helados, productos para el aseo personal y para el hogar. El señor Ariel trabaja solo de lunes a lunes en el horario de 7:00 am a 10 pm. Esta actividad de la tienda la aprendió de manera autónoma y sin ayuda de nadie.
Actualmente el señor Ariel desea comprar más surtido para su tienda como granos, frutas y verduras, snakcs, helados y productos navideños, esto con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.  A futuro el señor Ariel desea tener su tienda más grande en la cual pueda trabajar con su familia.
texts.en:
Ariel is 22 years old and has been working in his own store for a year. He sells products such as grains, fruits and vegetables, snacks, ice cream, personal hygiene items, and supplies for the home. Ariel works alone 7 days a week from 7:00AM until 10:00PM. He learned the grocery business on his own without help from anyone.

Right now Ariel wants to buy more selections for his store such as grains, fruits and vegetables, snacks, ice cream and items for Christmas. This will increase his income and the quality of life for him and his family. In the future Ariel wants to have a larger store in which he can work with his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fruit and vegetables, snacks, ice cream, and sweets

loans.name: Sorie A.i.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni City in Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to introduce to you this group of teachers from Lunsar, a town on the highway between Makeni City and Freetown. 

Teachers within SMT’s operational areas apply for loans in order to meet their immediate financial challenges that their salaries alone cannot. At the end of each month, they use their monthly salaries to offset the loan. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions each month and repays SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

Sorie is the leader of this group of teachers. The 51 year old is a native of one of the several villages that make up Yoni Bama, located in Northern Sierra Leone. He is married and has four children who are attending schools and tertiary institutions. Sorie is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for almost 33 years now. Sorie has applied for this loan in order to buy house-building materials such as bags of cement and to pay the school fees of his children.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials and to pay the school fees of his children.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is divorced with two grown daughters. The company she had worked for downsized, and Yelena had to look for other work opportunities. That is how she decided to start her own venture. 

Today, Yelena owns a business selling athletic sportswear in the local market called “Yulana.” This is the only source of income for her family. Yelena has a nice assortment of inventory in her kiosk and has been in this trade for 12 years. Yelena is always innovative and dedicated to carrying merchandise with the newest popular brands and superior design. She always sells only the best quality sportswear that gives the right choice of comfort, fit, and style for her clients. Today Yelena is requesting a loan of 15,000 UAH to purchase additional merchandise. She’s hoping to expand her trade in the future and start selling athletic footwear too.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr:
Moustaphat habite dans la région sud sénégal,marié père de 3 enfants ,deux garçon et une fille de 11 mois.Les 2 enfants sont à l'école et la fillette reste à la maison avec sa mama qui est ménagère,avec son métier,il supporte toutes les charge de sa famille.
Moustapha a démarré son métier dans la capitale du sénégal à l'age de 16 ans.Depuis 1983,il a eu son diplome,pour revenir travailler dans sa localité.Avec ce crédit,il achète du bois à l'est de la région pour venir confectionner des meuble qui seront exposés pour la vente.
moustapha dans l'avenir,veut avior des machines de rabotage,siage ,et élargir le nombre d'employés dans son atelier de travail
texts.en:
Moustapha lives the southern region of Senegal. He is married and the father of 3 children - two boys and an 11 month old girl. The two eldest go to school, and the young girl stays at home with his mother, who is a housewife. With his craft, he covers all the expenses of the family.
Moustapha started his activity in the capital of Senegal at 16 years of age. He has had his diploma since 1983, and returned to work in his local area. With this loan, he will purchase wood in the east of the region, in order to create furniture which will be displayed for sale. In the future, Moustapha wants to have machinery for planing and sawing, and to increase the numbers of employees in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy wood for woodworking, to strengthen his workshop.

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Khorn is 46 years old and a married mother of three dependent children, two of whom work as bakers for pay while the last one is at home helping with housework. 

To support her family, she has been farming for 15 years and she supplements her income by raising chickens, ducks and pigs. She currently earns about 8 U.S. dollar per day and is able to save around 3 U.S. dollars daily. 

This is Khorn's first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy animal feed for her poultry and also to buy one cow to raise as farming labor. 

She hopes to feed her poultry to be fat and increase her crop production so as to improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and buy one additional cow for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: El señor Faustino es un cliente que viene por recomendación de su hermano que es cliente de la institución, el se dedica a la producción de ladrillos en la zona de Bajo Alpacoma, la venta la realiza en la misma fabrica como también lo lleva a la obra, el señor cuenta con un camión con el cual lleva a la obra los ladrillos que los vende, tiene 6 hijos mayores y pequeños los hijos mayores junto a su esposa le ayudan en la producción de ladrillos, como pudimos ver en la visita la familia es muy humilde pero muy trabajadora, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de material para la fabricación de ladrillos	 ya que por estas épocas de lluvia suben de precio, y el desea fabricar por cantidad, el Sr. Faustino es muy trabajador se siente muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Faustino is a customer who comes on the recommendation from his brother who is a customer of the institution. He works in the production of bricks in the Bajo Alpacoma zone. The sale is done at the same factory since he also takes it to the job site. He has a truck, which he uses to take the bricks that he sells to the job site. He has six adult and little children. The adult children, together with his wife, help him in the production of bricks. As we saw in the visit, the family is very humble but very hard working. The loan, which he is requesting, is to buy material for the manufacture of bricks since in these rainy seasons, the price increases and he would like to produce by quantity. Faustino is a hard worker, he is very grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: to buy material to produce more bricks before the rains.

loans.name: Afepeb Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AFEPEB composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même village. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Jeannette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 30 ans. Jeannette est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Emmanuel. Le couple a deux enfants, scolarisés et à leur charge. Jeannette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Jeannette vend des carottes et des feuilles de salade depuis cinq ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Jeannette s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Jeannette sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe AFEPEB, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des carottes et des feuilles de salade.

loans.name: Mariela Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Mariela Verónica, labora como docente en unos de los centros educativos de la Ciudad de León desde hace 16 años, inicia sus labores desde las 07:00 am finalizando a las 12:00 pm como este mismo horario de lunes a viernes, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su hogar y de su mamá.

Doña Mariela, solicito este crédito a Ceprodel para la compra de bloques, hierro, cemento, zinc y perlines, dichos materiales fueron implementados en la ampliación de su vivienda lo cual implicó en la construcción de un cuarto habitacional, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida junto a su mamá.

loans.use: Compra de bloques, hierro, cemento, zinc y perlines

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Pegi Village. Ayuba joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ayuba will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds, that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ayuba now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en: Kwaku is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 65 years old and married with 5 children, one is still having Senior High School education and others have completed Senior high school education. Kwaku believes Organic Oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to buy a knife to aid in harvesting and pruning of his cocoa and oil palm.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting/pruning knife

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en:
34-year-old Zafar with his 2 children settled in Sumgait city. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Gubadli region. Since 2001 Zafar has been engaged in animal sales to improve his family’s living condition. As he did not have enough funds, he could not develop his business well enough in the beginning. Having borrowed 2 loans ($500; $800;) from Normicro Zafar significantly expanded his business, bought 11 calves, achieved progress in his business and increased his family income. The loans were paid back timely.
He applies for a loan amount of $1000 to buy 15 calves.

loans.use: To buy 15 calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Vusale

texts.en: H. Vusale  is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorniy Karabakh. She is 22 and married and has 3 children. Poorness and a difficult situation made her need to purchase a milking cow and a calf. This is the reason she applied for a  $1200 loan from Aqroinvest.

loans.use: purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius M. is a 33-year-old man, married, with one child. Julius lives at Mlolongo, an informal settlement along the Nairobi – Mombassa highway. Apart from caring for his young family, Julius has the burden of taking care of his brothers and sisters after losing both of his parents.

Julius started his restaurant business in the year 2006. This was after he and the other employees he worked with were sent home after the chain of supermarkets they were working for came under receivership. Since Julius had experience in dealing with customers while at the Uchumi supermarket, his former workplace, he decided not to waste his skills. He therefore ventured into the restaurant industry, where he felt that he could make use of his skills while at the same time earning some money for the upkeep of his family and siblings.

In order to finance the start-up of his business, Julius sold one of his cows for a total of Ksh 18,000 (US$ 300) and put this amount in, together with his personal savings of Ksh 40,000.00 (US$ 670), which he had put aside while still in employment. With this, he opened his business in the year 2006. The business has since been doing very well, and Julius now feels that he wants to improve the business by adding on some kitchen equipment. This will include a cooker, a refrigerator, a French fries warmer, a juice extractor, a blender, and some cooking fat. These will enable him to give his clients quicker and better service.

The population within the Mololongo area is rapidly growing and Julius wants his business to grow with the rising number of potential customers. For this reason he is kindly requesting a loan of US$ 1000 so that he can fully equip his restaurant.

Given this loan, Julius feels that he will be able to give his customers the very best service. He will also be able to employ 2 young men to assist him in running the business, thereby benefiting the community by creating employment. The repayment period for this loan will be 8 months.

loans.use: Purchase of restaurant kitchen equipment

loans.name: Fahim

texts.en:
Fahim lives in District 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and educated. He was in Iran for about 6 years but he came back last year and started a business. He opened a small retail shop in the main bazaar of Kabul.

Now Fahim wants to enlarge his shop so he is requesting an individual loan to expand his inventory by buying sweets, crisps, bags of candies, milk, mineral water, etc. Fahim is looking forward to receiving this loan which will allow him to expand his business and make a good income to support his family.

loans.use: expand the inventory of his little store

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Mrs. Beauty EmokpaeI sells drinks to people living in her city. Through this business I support my family financially. Beauty is 35 years old, married with one child. She lives in Benin City and has 5 years experience in her business. She is a LAPO member and she is in need of $400 to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en: Rosana is a new member to the programme who wants to start a small ice cake (popsicles in a bag) business. She is a mother of 2 sons, she is unemployed and stays home looking after her children. Rosana feels happy that she has financial support for her husband who fishes all day and then walks at night in the village trying to sell fish. Her requested loan will help her start her ice cake business.

loans.use: To start her ice cake business

loans.name: Kamuli A4 (Ii) Group

texts.en:
Jessica is 32 years old and married with four children. She sells raw foods. With the extra business profits, she wants to start a piggery business. Sumayiya and Jane both sell milk and want to buy fridges with the loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to add ito their businesses.

loans.name: Kadiba South C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Lukia M.. She is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Lukia is 40 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from age 9 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Lukia makes approximately UGX 54000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and expand her business. Lukia has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 700000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Lukia is joined in her small group by Lovinsa M. and Irene M.. Lovinsa M. has a business selling new clothes and wants to increase stock. Irene M. is currently operating a business selling new clothes and wants a loan to add more working capital and boost business.

loans.use: Purchase more matooke from villages to sell

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
In her precarious but very welcoming home we find Concepción, 31 years old and the mother of 2 charming boys. Her great spirit, strong will and hard work have allowed her to improve her quality of life and that of her family. For the past 11 years, this persevering woman has been working very hard in a bakery, and on the weekends buys and sells pigs. With these two activities she has been able to raise her offspring,

She is trying to increase her capital in order to obtain greater income. They currently live at her mother-in-law's home. Her wish is to buy land and build her own dwelling, a place where she dreams that her children will live under her care and with the security that they deserve. With that goal. she will keep working tirelessly.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

En su precaria pero muy acogedora vivienda encontramos a la señora Concepción de 31 años de edad, ella es madre de 2 encantadores niños, su gran espíritu, voluntad y empeño le han permitido mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia, ésta perseverante mujer desde hace 11 años viene trabajando arduamente en una panadería, y los fines de semana se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos, con estas dos actividades esta logrando sacar adelante a sus retoños.

Pretende aumentar su capital para obtener mayores ingresos económicos.Actualmente viven en el domicilio de su suegra, el deseo que tienen es comprar un terreno y construir su propia morada, lugar donde anhela que sus hijos vivan bajo el cuidado y seguridad que se merecen, con ese propósito sigue trabajando insistentemente en su labor.

loans.use: Buy a larger quantity of pigs to sell, so that she can buy land and and build a small house.

loans.name: Mayram

texts.ru:
Mayram M. lives in Vahdat. She is 47 years old. Mayram is married with 4 children. She has a community college degree, she is a qualified child care worker. However, she does not work in this area as its pays very little. Her own children are still young, they are in middle school. So for the last 12 years Mayram has been selling groceries. She has a stall at the local Vahdat market. Locals know that she always has fresh items. She would like to expand her inventory by adding new items. This is why she needs the loan. By expanding her business Mayram will improve the quality of life of her family. She plans to repay the loan in 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Мадрахимова Майрам Урунбаевна жительница города Вахдат . Ей 47 лет. Майрам замужем , имеет 4 детей. Образование средне-техническое,по специальности воспитательница . Но по специальности Майрам не работает, так как заработная плата очень маленькая . Прожить на такие деньги очень трудно.Дети Майрам маленькие,они посещают среднюю школу. Поэтому более 12 лет клиентка занимается куплей продажей продуктов питания. Майрам имеет торговую точку на местном рынке города Вахдат. Местные жители знают,что у нее всегда можно приобрести только свежую продукцию .Клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент своей торговой точки , для чего ей и нужны деньги. Майрам решила взять кредит. Тем самым расширить свой бизнес , улучшить качество жизни своей семьи .Планирует погасить кредит в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: Add new items to the inventory

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Señorita Deysi belongs to the Communal Bank of Women with a Future, located at Jr. José Olaya Mz. Ñ Lt. 12, in the Yarina Cocha District in the Department of Ucayali. She is 23 years old, and is single. With the first loan Deysi recieved from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in clothing sales.

Now she is studying the technical career of nursing, and it is one of the reasons that she is working to sell clothing. The business permits her to pay for her studies and she has time to sell her products.

With this loan of S/.800, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy polo shirts, blouses, skirts, shorts, stockings, and underwear. Deysi is dreaming up a better future, she needs to finish this race, and to work with Manuela Ramos is a very satisfying experience because she is learning to better manage her money.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Deysi pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el Jr. José Olaya Mz. Ñ Lt. 12, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 23 años, es soltera. Deysi con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de ropas. En la actualidad ella esta estudiando la carrera técnica de enfermería, y es uno de lo motivos por los cuales se dedica a la venta de ropa, le permite pagar sus estudios y tiene tiempo para ofrecer sus productos. Con este préstamo de S/.800 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compro polos, camisas, faldas, shorts, medias, ropas interiores. Deysi esta forjándose un futuro mejor, le falta terminar su carrera, y trabajar con Manuela Ramos es una experiencia muy satisfactoria por que aprendes a administrar mejor su dinero.

loans.use: With this loan Deysi will buy more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana is a humble family mother who makes daily efforts to provide her children with the best things every day, by way of setting-up her own business. She sells orange and pineapple juice in a place near her home every morning: in the afternoons she also sells snacks. She wants to improve her business and install a work space in order to increase her earnings for the benefit of her dearly loved family.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Ana, es una humilde madre de familia que se esfuerza diariamente por brindarle a sus hijos lo mejor cada día mediante el emprendimiento de su propio negocio. Ella se dedica la venta de jugo de naranja y de piña en un lugar cercano a su casa todas las mañanas; y por las tardes se dedica también a la venta de lonches. Desea mejorar su actividad e implementar su espacio de labor a fin de acrecentar sus ganancias en beneficio de su amada familia.

loans.use: Injection of capital to rennovate her work space

loans.name: Fanny Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Fanny is 30 years old. Her husband works in refrigerator repair which helps cover household expenses. They have a young son who attends school and they live in the neighborhood called La Borgona. 6 years ago, Fanny started a clothing business with her own money. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business, offer her customers more styles and variety, and grow her sales.

Doña Fanny tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y habita en el barrio la Borgoña, tiene un hijo que esta en la primaria y su esposo trabaja como técnico en refrigeración y aporta en los gastos del hogar. La Sra. Fanny vende ropa y tiene seis años de experiencia en las ventas y comenzó con dinero propio. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para invertir más en las ventas y así ofrecer a sus clientes diversos estilos y variedades.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER CLOTHING BUSINESS

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som S., age 61, is a widow and lives in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2006, she has been selling clothes in Phnom Penh to earn a living and is able to earn up to US$5 of profit per day. She told a loan officer that she used to be a farmer before she started selling clothes.  She stopped because her children got married and no longer lived with her, so there was no one to help her farm.  Her new business uses less labor and makes more profit than farming.  Currently, she still has one child and an old mother who are under her care.

Mrs. Som is seeking a loan of US$500 to invest in her business by ordering more clothes to sell. In the future, if she has enough money, she will purchase a stand to reduce the monthly fee she pays.

loans.use: To invest in her business by ordering more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Кучарова Мавджуда жительница района Вахш. Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Возраст 26 лет. И уже 4 года она занимается бизнесом. Привозит товар из города Душанбе и реализует у себя на рынке. Торгует одеждой. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mavjuda K. lives in Vakhsh. She is married with two children. She is 26 years old, and for the last four years she has worked in business. She brings goods from the city of Dushanbe and sells them at the market. She sells clothes. She wants to take out a loan to increase sales. She can pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase sales

loans.name: Hilda Luisa

texts.en:
Hilda Luisa Q. M., a member of the community bank Virgen de Cocharas at FINCA Perú, lives in Ayacucho with her husband and her two children, ages 17 and 21. At a kiosk in a local market in Ayacucho, Hilda sells women's intimate clothing. Hilda has been saving to be able to cover her bills in case of an emergency such as her children getting sick. Additionally, Hilda has been able to purchase a car with her savings.

The loan Hilda has requested will be invested into her business in the purchase of products, including bras, underwear and socks. With the income she receives from her business, Hilda dreams of ensuring that her children remain in school to become professionals. She also has a goal of owning her own store where she will eventually be able to sell her clothing.

loans.use: To be invested into her business in the purchase of products, including bras, underwear and socks.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Ngoan Group

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn thị Ngoan năm nay 45 tuổi Ms 01030004 là một phụ nữ rất năng động, hàng ngày chị làm nghề sửa chữa xe máy và chồng chị là thợ cắt tóc. Hiện tại chị có 2 con đi làm công nhân nên mức thu nhập của gia đình chị cũng khá ổn định từ 200.000VNđ/ ngày. Chị và nhóm đã tham gia vay vốn qua 2 chu kỳ đèu trả rất tốt, chị rất thích hình thức vay trả này vì nó giúp chị được trả dần, đồng thời tiết kiệm tiền để lo cho con cái chị có công việc làm ổn định. Chu kỳ này chị đăng ký vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua phụ tùng về bán và sửa chữa xe máy. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên như sau: Chị Đặng thị N. Ms 01030001 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để kinh doanh và sửa chữa điện thoại . Chị Lê thị Quý Ms 01030003 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để kinh doanh hàng ăn sáng. Chị Đặng thị N. T. Ms 01030005 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua đồ sửa chữa máy tính. Chị Nguyễn thị H. Ms 01030035 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để kinh doanh và bán nước giải khát.

loans.use: invest in repair shops

loans.name: Seema Sultan Masih Group

texts.en:
Seema baji is a widow of S. M. and resides in a place named Ismail Nagar, which is situated in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this place for the past 25 years. She is the mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Her son is a cook by profession and makes food on order. Her daughter stays at home and makes embroidered dresses. Seema baji runs a beauty parlor at home. She started a beauty parlor after the death of her husband and became the only breadwinner of her family. She took her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and invested the amount in her beauty parlor. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more material (cosmetics, creams) for her beauty parlor. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rani baji wants a loan to buy mason tools. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy paints for her paint business. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy a furniture polisher for her furniture polish business. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy material (cosmetics and creams) for her beauty parlor. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for her beauty salon

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Mrs. Leng C. lives in Prey Chuor Village in Takeo Province.  She is 51 years old and the mother of three children.  Her children are all employed in the garment factory. She is pictured with her husband, Mr. Saom Roeurn, a construction worker who earns a small income. 

Mrs. Leng C. is a breeder who raises cow and pigs. Since the businesses is going well, she wants to expand it.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy a cow and two piglets.

loans.use: to buy a cow and two piglets

loans.name: Florecita

texts.en: Mrs. Florecita D. is 62 years old, a widow and a resident of Southwestern Poblacion, Calamba, Misamis Occidenta. She has been a member in good standing of the cooperative since August 2001. She raised her three children all by herself. Thankfully, all her children had stable jobs.  Since it is hard for her to survive without a stable job on her own, she decided to engage herself in piggery business, a business that she initially considered only a hobby.  She started her business with just one sow. To her surprise, she was able to manage it well and use it to finance her daily needs with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. She was able to avail herself of different types of loans, and paid them religiously. Now, she is applying for a loan of Php 25,000 to finance the construction of her pig cages and purchase 10 bags of animal feed. All she wants for now is to sustain her business and have a healthy life ahead.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and build pig cages

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward E. is currently in the business of selling honey at the market and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Edward is 41 years old and married. Her husband is a fisherman. She has three children, who all go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business selling honey.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda V., at 70, earns her own living. Her husband died 4 years ago, leaving her with 8 children, of whom 7 now have families of their own. Her youngest is currently working as an oversees contract worker. As a parent, she knew too well the burden of managing the family's daily expenses against the family's income. So to help her extended family, she had to find ways to earn. Through her small vegetable garden and a variety store, Yolanda was able to cope with her personal expenses and give a portion to her children. She is now applying for her eighth loan from HSPFI amounting to PHP 15,000.00 for additional capital for her current business.

loans.use: To purchase goods for a sari-sari store

loans.name: Ndidi

texts.en:
Ndidi sells foodstuffs like melon, beans, garri, etc. She has been in this business for a long.

She hopes for the loan of N70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Ndidi is 30 years old and married with a child.

Ndidi says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta V. S., 58 years old, is married and blessed with two children. She lives in Purok 9, Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte in Southern Philippines.

Loreta is engaged in the buying and selling of green bananas. Most of her customers are in her neighborhood and nearby villages. To generate more income, she wants to have a stall in the market place where she can attract more customers. She needs an amount of Php 7,000 for additional capital for her business. This will be a great help for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase more green bananas for sale

location.town: Purok 9, Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase 30 bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Курбонали Эшмуродов проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 59 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Курбонали вот уже 30 лет изготавливает окна и двери. В этом ему помогают двое сыновей. По специальности Курбонали плотник. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы закупить нужные материалы и увеличить свой товараоборот, т.к. сейчас много строят.
texts.en:
Kurbonali E. lives in the Vahdat region. He is 59 years old, married and has four children. Kurbonali has been making doors and windows for already 30 years. His two sons are helping him in this business. Kurbonali is a carpenter by profession. He is asking for a loan from us to buy the necessary materials and increase the turnaround because there's a lot of building going on now.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnaround

loans.name: Faiziniso

texts.ru: Ахмедова  Файзинисо кредитор в Микроинвест с 2005 года. Имеет бизнес продажи женской одежды. Она проживает в Костакозе, сама водит машину, поэтому без проблем приезжает торговать на рынок « Сомон». Она арендует контейнер для продажи одежды. За товаром ездит в Бишкек сама два раза в месяц. Следующий займ хочет использовать для закупа летних блузок и юбок.
texts.en:
Faiziniso A. has been borrowing from MicroInvest since 2005. She sells women's wear. She lives in Kostakoz, but she is able to drive a car herself and therefore is able to sell at the Somon market without problems. She rents the container from which she sells clothes. She goes to Bishkek twice a month to buy goods. She wants to take out her next loan to buy summer blouses and skirts.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling women's clothes

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is the simple mother of two. She believes that to be able to succeed in life she must try and try until she achieves what she dreamed of. She is married to Nolie, a farmer and they are blessed with two children: Nolie, 4 years old and Noliesa, 3 years old. Her family is happily living in the rural area of Barangay Binarzang Quirino, Isabela. 

Flordeliza operates a general store business that became her family’s alternative source of income to support their daily needs. She is borrowing an additional loan amounting to PHP 6,000 for the continuous improvement of her store.

Flordeliza wants to save more income for the future education of her children and also to assist her husband with their farming needs. She believes that God will help her provide what they need, and, hopefully, she will be able to make a way to elevate their standard of living through Kiva’s assistance and her hard work.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: processing and selling palm oil

loans.name: Linet Kadari

texts.en:
Linet, a married mother of five children, ages 13, 9, 7, 4.5, and 9 months, has been keeping poultry for about three years, having learned the practice from her brother-in-law. She says that she now has 32 chickens, and is able to sell their eggs. She also raises some of the chickens to sell for meat. The food to feed the chickens can be expensive, but she saves money by making a mixture of dried fish and maize to feed them.

Linet is requesting a very small loan to begin with, but has plans to ask for a larger one later on. One of the challenges she faces is keeping all of her chickens healthy, as they sometimes get sick, and medicine is very expensive. It is important to Linet that her business succeed since it is the main way that she provides the money for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат Шарипова проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 32 года. Вдова, имеет 3 детей. По специальности Мухаббат "педагог". По специальности работала более 6 лет. В данный момент она более 4 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном торгует национальными материалами и шторами. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Muhabbat S. lives in the Gissar region. She is 32 years old. She is a widow and has three children. Muhabbat's profession is a teacher. She has worked in her profession for more than six years. At this time she has been selling on the market for more than four years. She sells mostly traditional fabrics and curtains. She is asking for a loan to increase turnover.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 49-year-old businessman and father of five who describes himself as ambitious and innovative. He runs a salon and beauty shop in Nairobi as well as importing electronics on order. He has been in this business for the past eleven years. David hopes one day to buy his family a home in Nairobi and start importing electronics.

David is requesting a loan of Kes. 40,000 in order to add to his stock of cosmetics.

About Faulu Kenya:

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, a designation that will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to his stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes F. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to open up a bakery.  Agnes is 45-years-old and is married to a peasant. She has seven children, all of whom go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a bakery

loans.name: Merly

texts.es:
Merly tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo Nicolás y sus dos hijos menores de edad; Jesús de 7 años y Joshua de 5, en su  casa que es de material noble (cemento) y se  aprecia que  ha sido levantada con mucho esfuerzo, además tiene el orgullo de decir que es propia. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica a vender gas en su casa desde hace 4 años, pues percibió que en su barrio no había quien abasteciera de este hidrocarburo a las diversas familias, desde entonces, se desempeña en este oficio junto con su esposo. Empezó solo con 3 balones de gas y poco a poco se ha ido comprando más. Merly también se dedica a lavar ropa de otras personas durante  las mañanas, con ello también obtiene otros ingresos económicos. Y como si fuera poco, al caer la tarde se va al muelle que está cerca de su casa y ahí vende papas rellenas de carne, que por su exquisitez es uno de los platillos típicos del Perú. 
La venta de gas es un negocio, según ella,  rentable ya que no hay nadie por su casa que le haga la competencia y porque conoce a sus vecinos a quienes a veces suele darles crédito. Para el futuro, como está refaccionando partes de su casa, piensa poner  una ferretería, ya que también se ha dado cuenta que no hay alguna que cubra las necesidades de su barrio. Para esto ya tiene una vitrina, que está guardada, hasta concretar su sueño. Merly siempre se proyecta al futuro y dice “quiero poner un gran letrero, que se vea desde muy lejos y vender varios materiales en mi ferretería que por acá necesitan”.
Ya ha tenido 3 préstamos con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual; además le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal, ya que está conformado por señoras muy responsables a las que conoce desde hace mucho tiempo. Con el dinero que solicita comprara más balones de gas y también empezará a comprar mercadería para lo que será su futura ferretería.
texts.en:
Merly is 32 years old and lives with her husband, Nicolás, and their two young children, 7 year-old Jesús and 5 year-old Joshua. They live in a concrete house, which was raised with a lot of effort, and she is proud to say that is their own. She is a hard-working woman who has sold gas from her home for four years. She began the business with her husband when she realized no one in her neighborhood supplied gas to the various families there. She began with only three tanks of gas and little by little has bought more. Merly also washes clothes in the morning to gain secondary income. As if it were not enough, at dusk she goes to the pier close to her house to sell meat-filled potatoes, a typical Peruvian food. According to Merly, selling gas is profitable since there are no other businesses competing against her and she knows her neighbors to whom she sometimes occassionally loans. Since she's redoing part of her house, she is thinking about putting in a small hardware store after realizing that there is none to cover the needs of her neighborhood. She already has a glass case that she is saving to use when she realizes her dream. Merly always looks towards the future and says, "I want to put up a big sign that you can see from far away and sell various materials in my hardware store that they need around here." She has already had three loans with MFP and has always been punctual with payments. She likes to work with her community bank since it is made up of responsible women she has known for a long time. With the money requested she will buy more gas tanks and begin to buy merchandise for what her new hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing merchandise and investment for new business

loans.name: Kiganda Nanono Prosy Group

texts.en:
N. Prosy is thirty-five years old and a business lady representing her loan group. She is married with three school aged children. She deals in the hardware business, selling charcoal stoves, sauce pans, metallic boxes, etc and she has been in this business for over ten years. 

Nanonois plans on using the loan to purchase supplies of hard ware items to generate increased profits for her business. She is a hardworking business woman, cheerful and encouraging. Her dream is to purchase a plot of land and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase supplies of hardware items to earn more profits in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more vitenge and kanga in bulk

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
la sra. Luisa C. S. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad. sus tortillas las vende en diferentes casas, mercaditos y pulperias de la Aldea Tapaire, Choluteca.
sus tortillas se venden muy bien ya que tienen un buen sabor, este tipo de comida se consume bastante en estos lugares, las tortillas son el complemento ideal para todos los platos del dia.
tambien hace por encargos para reuniones.
Luisa necesita el credito para comprar mas materia prima para la fabricacion de las tortillas ya que ahora las ventas son mas grandes y no se da abasto para complacer a todos sus clientes.
Luisa en un futuro desea contratar a alguien para que le ayude en su produccion y reparticion de las tortillas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luisa C. S. makes and sells tortillas for a living, she has a lot of experience as she sells her tortillas to different establishments, markets, and general stores at the Aldea Tapaire, Choluteca. Her tortillas sell very well as they are good tasting and this type of food is very popular in those areas as the tortillas go with any kind of dish. She also makes on demand for special events.

Luisa needs the loan to buy more raw material to make the tortillas as sales are increasing and she cannot meet her customers' demands. For the future Luisa wants to hire somebody to help with the production and delivery of the tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn flour, lime, water, firewood.

loans.name: Wlaa

texts.en:
Wlaa's business is a small beauty salon located in the city of Nablus, Palestine. She stands out in the community for being very knowledgeable in the beauty field, which is why customers come to her. For this reason she is committed to serving her customers, looking for ways to better meet their needs and offer the best service possible.

Wlaa has come to Ryada to request a loan so that she can buy work materials such as combs, creams, gels and gloves, among other things.

loans.use: To purchase work materials

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia  tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 25 años se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería; mientras lleva al campo a pastear a sus animales, cuida de sus tierras de cultivo para prevenir plagas y enfermedades de sus plantaciones de maíz, papa, arveja y habas. 
Cada 2 meses sale a vender sus vacas, toros y ovejas, a las cuales ha engordado para ofrecer un buen precio por ellas. La actividad ganadera le permite a Zenobia tener los ingresos necesarios para su hogar mientras espera la cosecha de sus cultivos. 
Para el futuro, desea mejorar la raza de sus animales y aumentar la producción de sus productos.
