Esta es la 9na oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una cliente que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus cuentas. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más animales, como ovejas y un burro, además de sacos de abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Zenobia is 34 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in their own home. For the past 25 years, she has devoted her time to agriculture and raising cattle. She takes her animals to the fields to graze and takes care of her farmland in order to prevent plagues and diseases in her corn, potato, pea, and bean crops. Every 2 months she goes to sell her cows, bulls, and sheep, which she has fattened up in order to offer a good price for them. Livestock raising allows Zenobia to earn the necessary income for her home while she waits to harvest her crops. In the future, she hopes to improve the breed of her animals and increase produce production. This is the 9th opportunity for a loan that she has had with MFP. She is a client who has always demonstrated responsibility with her accounts. She would use the money that she is asking for now to buy more animals such as sheep and a donkey, in addition to bags of fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals and fertilizer

loans.name: 16.02.01 Dong Hai Group

texts.en:
"Huong B. T. Q. (117) is a 29 year-old woman who lives in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Huong is the group leader of a 7-member loan group provided by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 01 Dong Hai (16.02.01 Dong Hai).

Huong is married and has 2 infant-aged children.  To making a living, Huong owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing new clothing services to local community members.  Huong has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Huong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huong has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1.963.500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Huong plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Lê Thị Thảo  (18) is a 63 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Nguyễn Thị Hồng (69) is a 29 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Lê Thị Huệ (122) is a 39 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  Nguyễn Thị Huyền  (123) is a 51 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5.  Lê Thị Ngọc (112) is a 30 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

6.  Trần Thị Nga (120) is a 28 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & increased working capital

loans.name: Dhan Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Dhan Maiya D. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Chapagaun. She opened her grocery store two years ago to improve the economic conditions of her family. She sells different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize, different types of snacks, etc. in her shop. Now she is requesting RS 15,000 as a loan to buy grocery goods for her shop.

Mrs. D. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Nanda Lal D., is a driver. Her older son is studying in grade 9 and her younger son is studying in grade 6.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda A. is from the city of Libertad in Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Elda is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Elda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food and daily -use products in the local community. Elda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Elda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Elda's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina tiene 53 años de edad, es viuda y vive junto a cuatro de sus siete hijos en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos a raíz de la defunción de su esposo hizo que empezara a ganarse la vida ofreciendo servicio de limpieza y de lavanderia. Ofrece servicio de limpieza en algunas casas de la ciudad, sus clientes la llaman y ella acude a limpiar. En cuanto a la lavandería opera del mismo modo. Esta actividad le provee los ingresos necesarios para mantener su hogar.

Las fuertes lluvias que se han presentado en la zona en las ultimas semanas hicieron que parte de su techo quedara afectado, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que planea invertir en la refacción de la parte afectada.

Ella es una mujer humilde y que lucha por salir adelante junto a sus hijos. Su mayor anhelo es poder ahorrar el dinero suficiente para instalar una pequeña bodega en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cristina is 53 years old, widowed, and lives with four of her seven children in the District of Paiján, Province of Ascope, in the region of La Libertad. This community is located three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque.

In order to support her children after the death of her husband, Cristina began offering cleaning and laundry services. She cleans houses in the city. Her customers call her and she goes to their houses to begin cleaning. The laundry service operates in the same manner. Both activities provide the income she needs to maintain her household.

The strong rains that hit the area in recent weeks damaged part of her roof. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that she can pay for repairs.

Cristina is a humble woman who struggles in order for her children to get ahead. Her greatest wish is to save enough money so that she can open a small grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for roof repairs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth S. is a civil servant working in the health sector. She is a single parent of one child. She owns a shop on the outskirts of Makeni where she sells drinks and provisions. She employs a shop assistant and normally supervises the business in the evening.  She has secured funds from her personal savings to set up the business but not enough. As a result, she is seeking a loan to buy additional stock so that she can meet the needs of her customers.  She hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to educate her child and to build a house and expand her business for her retirement.

loans.use: To buy drinks and provisions

loans.name: Mukisa Women's Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
With hand raised in the group photo is N. Teddy, a 48-year-old married mother of eight kids who also takes care of two orphans.

Teddy operates a bar in Namataba, Lugazi, infamously known for its sale of that highly favored delicacy. Though frowned upon as an unorthodox means of earning a living by some sections of society, it is a roaring business that brings in good profits - that’s if you are taking the example of Teddy.

Teddy also sells pork to her customers which goes hand-in-hand with the beers they buy. She has been running this business for the last eight years and she cites the scarcity of pigs as a major inconvenience for her business. On a weekly basis, she makes 30,000 shillings and 50,000 shillings respectively from her businesses.

The reputation of Teddy’s business has also largely been enhanced by her hygienic operating environment. With this loan she wants to purchase more stock for her growing business.

loans.use: To buy more beers and pigs for her business expansion

loans.name: God Is With Me Group

texts.en:
Hawa B. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God Is With Me. She is 47 years old, married and has 6 children who range in age from 21 to 39 years old. She also cares for two grandchildren. She did not have the opportunity to go to school due to poverty 
For 19 years Hawa has been selling pepper at the Logan Town market, Bushrod Island, Monrovia , Liberia.
She approaches customers in a nice manner and calls customers to buy her goods.
Hawa started with a cash amount of L$ 40.00 Liberian Dollars that she acquired from working with a humanitarian organization during the civil war. 
She plans to use her 7,500 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,500.00 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more pepper, salt and seasonings. Her goal is to improve her business, and she plans to buy land and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Hawa is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more pepper, salt and seasonings.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta es una mujer muy emprendedora, tiene 45 años y vive al lado de sus dos hijos, quienes son su mayor motivo de salir adelante. Hace más de 16 años se dedica a la venta de enseres, piñatería y joyas, en un puesto que tiene dentro de un mercado de la zona en la que vive. Marta esta muy entusiasmada con su puesto, por lo que trabaja desde tempranas horas de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde vendiendo variedad de productos como joyas de reconocidas marcas, muñecas, objetos para fiestas infantiles, etc. Trata de mantener su establecimiento bien implementado, de esa manera pueda complacer a toda su clientela. Su mayor anhelo es colocar piso a su establecimiento y ampliarlo. Por ello trabajará  muy duro para concretar sus planes. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará el material necesario para instalar piso y de esa manera mejorar su infraestructura.
texts.en:
Marta, 45, is a very enterprising woman. She lives with her two children who are the motivating force behind her. For over 16 years she has sold home furnishings, piñatas and jewelry in a stall she has in a market near where she lives. Marta is very enthused with her stand so she works from very early in the morning until 6pm selling an assortment of products like well-known brand jewelry, dolls, children’s party supplies, etc. She tries to have her establishment well stocked so that she can please all her customers. Her greatest wish is to install a concrete floor and enlarge her establishment. She works hard to meet this goal. This will be her 4th loan with MFP and she pledges to be very punctual with her repayments. She will use the requested funds to buy the necessary materials to install the floor thereby improving its infrastructure.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a concrete floor in her establishment.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 22 años, vive en casa de sus padres con ellos y su hermano quien ya es independiente. Siendo aún soltera, se dedica desde hace 6 años en la venta de productos de belleza de reconocidas marcas, siendo promotora de ventas, posee un modulo donde ofrece sus cosméticos, de esa manera la clientela accede más fácilmente a estos productos. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo pues le permite realizarlo de forma muy independiente dándole tiempo para sus estudios, además el rubro de venta de estos productos siempre le ha gustado, pues es muy detallista en los colores, tonos que mejor le favorecen a las chicas, es por ello que aconseja muy bien a todas sus clientas realizar buenas ventas. Si bien el rubro de belleza le gusta mucho, desea complementarlo estudiando turismos, por ello desea en el futuro tener su agencia de viajes, es una meta que quiere alcanzar para desarrollarse como profesional. Este es su primer crédito en MFP por lo que se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería en productos de belleza para tenerlos en stock.
texts.en:
Patricia, 22, lives with her parents and a brother who is independent already. Being still single, she has sold well-known brand name beauty products for the last 6 years. She has a sales booth that makes it easier for customers to access her products. She likes her work very much because she’s free to establish her own schedule and can work while still going to school. Besides, she’s always enjoyed working in this particular line of work because she is very meticulous with the colors and shades that are most flattering to the young ladies; because of this, she gives good advice to her customers and this leads to very good sales. Even though she enjoys being in the beauty business she also wants to study tourism and hospitality so that she can have a travel agency in the future; this is her long-term goal for professional development. This is her 1st loan with MFP and she pledges to be very punctual with all her payments. She will use the requested funds to buy larger amounts of beauty products to have available in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock beauty products.

loans.name: Geronima Esperanza

texts.es: Geronima ha realizado varios financiamientos con Fundación León 2000, por lo que agradece la oportunidad que le brindaron en confiar en ella. Tiene la actividad económica de venta de tortillas. Inicio hace 42 años con muy poco capital de trabajo, como una búsqueda de fuente de ingresos alternativos, por lo que ella misma logro obtener su propia fama en sus deliciosas tortillas. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de leña, cal y maíz.
texts.en:
Geronima has had several loans with the Fundación León 2000. She is grateful for the opportunity they offered when they put their trust in her. Her economic activity is selling tortillas. She started 42 years ago with very little working capital, seeking a way to have an alternate source of income. She acheived her own fame for her delicous tortillas. The loan is for working capital to purchase firewood, lime and corn.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fausta

texts.es:
Fausta, tiene 39 años y tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal es elaborar teja de arcilla y su esposo Cirilo le ayuda. Ellos empiezan a trabajar de madrugada aproximadamente a las 3 y terminan a las 12 del medio todos los días. Ellos elaboran las tejas en su domicilio que está ubicado en la comunidad de Huayllapampa de la ciudad de Huambutio. Ya son 20 años que se dedican al negocio y les va muy bien. Sus clientes vienen de distintos lugares alejados como por ejemplo de la ciudad de Urubamba, Calca y del mismo lugar a comprar sus productos porque son baratos y de buena calidad.
 
Fausta pertenece al banco comunal aproximadamente de 2 a 3 años y ella requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo arcilla, arena y rama que sirven para la fabricación de tejas.
texts.en:
Fausta is 39 years old and has three children. Her main economic activity is making ceramic tiles. Her husband Cirilo helps her with this work. They start very early, at about 3 in the morning, and finish around noon every day. They make the tiles at their home, which is located in the Huayllapampa community in the city of Huambutio. They have worked at this business for 20 years now, and it is going very well for them. Their customers come from a range of places, such as the cities of Urubamba and Calca as well as the local community, to buy their products, because they are inexpensive and of good quality. Fausta has belonged to the communal bank for 2-3 years, and she needs the loan to buy materials necessary for making tiles. such as clay, sand and wood.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies such as clay, sand and wood

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de seis años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Casa Grande, una zona rural del distrito de La Arena de la provincia de Piura, la zona se encuentra ubicada a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la venta de carne en la zona donde vive, ella cría ganado menor en su vivienda y todos los fines de semana los sacrifica para vender su carne a los vecinos de la zona en donde vive, el negocio le ha hecho conocida en el lugar y actualmente cuenta con un grupo fijo de clientes, los cuales siempre buscan adquirir la carne que ofrece en venta.

Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de cerveza, ella cuenta con un stock de estas bebidas en su vivienda y también las ofrece en venta a sus vecinos. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades ella saca adelante a su menor hijo y ayuda a su familia con los gastos del hogar.

María Teresa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de animales para aumentar sus ventas y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a EdpymeAlternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.		

Ella es una mujer hacendosa y entregada a su trabajo, en la zona donde vive se ha sabido ganar la estima de sus conocidos y vecinos.
texts.en:
María Teresa is a 26 years old single mother with a six year old son. She lives with her family in the village of Casa Grande, which is situated in a rural area in the district of La Arena, Piura Province. This community is located more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

María Teresa has been selling meat locally for four years. She raises livestock at home and butchers the animals on the weekends so that she can sell the meat to her neighbors. Her business has been recognized in the area and currently has a group of established customers who always buy the meat that she offers for sale.

In addition María Teresa sells beer. She maintains a stock of these beverages in her home and offers them for sale to her neighbors. With the income that she earns from these activities, she able to move her son forward and help her family with the household expenses.

María Teresa wants to expand her business by acquiring more animals to increase her sales and satisfy the demand of her customers. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to help accomplish her goal.

She is an industrious woman who is dedicated to her work. In the area where she lives, María Teresa has earned the respect of her acquaintances and neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more animals for her butcher shop

loans.name: Mahmudjon

texts.en:
K. Mahmudjon is a very hard and responsible entrepreneur. He and his family live in Isfara, Tajikistan. He is married and has two children. Mahmudjon together with his son (pictured) works in the central city market selling men’s clothing and shoes. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for 5 years. Mahmudjon likes to work for himself. His business has been the main source of income for his whole family. Today Mahmudjon would like to ask for a loan of $1500 USD to purchase new inventory. We believe Mahmudjon‘s drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the new clothing for selling.

loans.name: Javzmaa

texts.en:
Javzmaa S. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband works as a policeman while their elder two children attend a local middle school.

Javzmaa operates a children's clothing retail business from a stall at Narantuul-a, the biggest and most crowded market in her town. She sells a variety of different clothing items and accessories and her wide product selection attracts many customers.

Javzmaa started her children's clothing business in 2003. After finding success and achieving stable business operations, she expanded her product line to import women’s clothing from Ereen, a city on the border with China. This product expansion has proved to be a very profitable decision. Today, she is able to hire a salesperson who helps with her business.

Javzmaa is a very open-minded and sociable woman and is well-known to her customers. For the future, she says, "I would like to save money for my sons’ future, because I really like the creating savings". She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more children's and women's clothing items for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more children's and women's clothing items for her business

loans.name: Justo Pastor

texts.es: Justo Pastor se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre responsable, que día a día se preocupa por mejorar su negocio. Su actividad económica es la venta de leña y madera, el tiene más de 18 años de trabajar con este negocio, que ha sido muy importante pues con esta actividad ha llevado el pan de cada día a familia, el tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. Este financiamiento lo realiza para la compra de materia prima como leña y madera pues actualmente tiene muchos encargos. Siempre sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Justo Pastor describes himself as a responsible man, who strives to improve his business day by day. His work is the sale of timber and firewood, which he has been doing for over 18 years and which is very important to him, as it has put bread on his family's table ech day for that time. He has 3 school-age children in his care, and so he is always looking for opportunities to boost his income. With this loan he will buy raw materials like timber nad firewood because he has a lot of orders to fill at the moment. He dreams, always, of improving his home.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina P. is from the village of Culing Centro, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 51 years old and is married with two adult children. Cristina owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling AVON products such as perfume, talc powder, lotions, and make-up kits in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seventeen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Cristina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 6th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is an entrepreneur who lives in the town of Melitopol. She is married, has a young son named Ilya and makes a living selling footwear in one of her town's marketplaces. She started her business six years ago with help from her parents. Today she makes about 20,000 Grivnyas a month, 8,000 of which is profit. 

Anna is requesting a loan for 18,000 Grivnyas to buy more footwear for the coming fall and winter seasons. She will use the additional income made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. She is eager to work hard, succeed, and generate and larger and more stable income in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
V. Nguyễn Thị is a 37-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, V. makes and sells food, primarily rice products, to the local community. V. has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2008 V. joined SEDA to gain access to its financial services. V. successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA that was used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. V. is now requesting a new loan, her fourth from SEDA, of 8,288,000 VND that will be used to purchase ingredients needed to make her food. V. plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

V. Nguyễn Thị (20213030026) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, V. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương. V. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, V. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.

Vào 2008, V. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. V. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các vật dụng mới để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. V. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase the ingredients needed to make her food for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To complete his stock.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
Don Carmelo Z. pequeño agricultor de la comarca El Banco del municipio de el Rama, es casado con la Sra. Justina Flores, tiene 4 hijos, Santos de 42 años, Abelardo de 40 y Francisca de 30, quienes ya se casaron y tienen su propia familia, unicamente habita con el el menor, Darvis de28 años quien le ayuda a trabajar la tierra y a cuidar la finca.  

Esta solicitando su 6to credito con el objetivo de comprar un semental que le permita mejorar la calidad de su ganado, y asi obtener mejores ingresos que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Cabe mencionar que anteriormente fue beneficiado con el fondo kiva, logrando establecer 3 mnz de arroz los cuales comercializo y obtuvo las ganancias que esperaba. 

Su mayor sueño es poder incrementar su inventario ganadero y dar mejores condiciones a sus hijos y esposa, pues son su razon de ser.
texts.en:
Mr. Carmelo Z., a small-time farmer in the El Banco region of the municipality of Rama, is married to Mrs. Justina Flores. They have four children: 42 year old Santos, 40 year old Abelardo, and 30 year old Francisca, who are already married and have families of their own. They still live with the youngest child, Darvis, who is 28 years old. He helps them to work the land and to care for the farm. 

He is asking for his 6th loan with the objective of buying a stud bull, which will allow him to better the quality of his cattle, and allow him to obtain better earnings, which in turn will allow him to better his family’s quality of life. It should be mentioned that he has previously been a beneficiary of Kiva funds. With those funds he succeeded in establishing 3 “manzanas” (land units of 7000 square meters each) of rice, which he has harvested and sold and obtained the earnings he was hoping for. 

His greatest dream is to be able to increase his livestock inventory and to provide his family with better living conditions, since they mean the world to him.

loans.use: To buy a stud bull

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married lady who is blessed with one child, age 30.  She is a hardworking lady who does dressmaking and knits sweaters. Her business is located in a very busy environment.  She has been running her business for fourteen years and has employed two people.  She appreciates Faulu Kenya because she has managed to save her money and stabilize her business.  She has requested 30,000 KES to buy fabric, zippers, canvas and buttons.

loans.use: To buy fabric, zippers, canvas and buttons

loans.name: Hadji

texts.en:
Hadji is 25 years old and a married lady. She has been in the hawking business, selling goods door-to-door or by calling out from the street, for six years. She is applying for her  third loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh), which she intends to use to purchase more stock of home products and to pay council levies. She repaid her previous two loans successfully.

There is clear indication that her business is doing well; her monthly profit is Ksh 15,000. She plans to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to rent a structure where she could establish her business. She hopes and dreams of getting settled with a well-stocked shop.

loans.use: To purchase stock and pay council levies

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad from Marka, Amman, is 46 years old and a father of seven.

Imad has his own dry clean shop where he works hard to improve the living conditions of the family.

Imad is requesting a loan of 2000 JD to develop his project by making new decorations and he is looking to open a new shop in west Amman.

loans.use: To develop his project by making new decorations

loans.name: Mabel Yudy

texts.es: La señora Mabel Yudy R. FigueR. es una emprendedora mujer de 40 años que vive en el barrio Universal de la ciudad de Barranquilla en compañía de sus tres hijas y un nieto. Tiene una venta de comidas rápidas en la cual ofrece perros calientes, hamburguesas, bandejas de papitas fritas con salchichas y arepas rellenas con queso, pollo y carne molida. El negocio funciona en su casa los viernes, sábados, domingos y festivos. Su jornada laboral comienza a las 4 P.M. y se extiende hasta la media noche. En la preparación de los alimentos y la atención al público le colaboran sus dos hijas mayores. El negocio nació hace 3 años por sugerencia de algunos vecinos quienes conocen sus aptitudes culinarias. Además del negocio de comidas, ella tiene una máquina de coser familiar en la que elabora cubre lechos y cortinas por encargo. Este es el primer crédito que ella tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en comprar varios juegos de sillas y mesas plásticas al igual que ingredientes para sus productos. El promedio de ventas semanales es de $400.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 40%. El esposo de la microempresaria está en Europa y a pesar que le colabora en los gastos de la casa, siente la ausencia de la figura paterna en la educación de sus hijas. En un futuro, la señora Mabel piensa alquilar un local para independizar el negocio del hogar y también para vender almuerzos diariamente. Si éste proyecto llega a concretarse, piensa utilizar la misma estrategia empleada hasta ahora: excelentes productos al mejor precio de la plaza.
texts.en:
Mabel Yudy R. FigueR. is an enterprising, 40 year-old woman who lives in Universal neighborhood, in the city of Barranquilla, together with her three daughters and a grandchild.  Mabel's business is selling fast food.  She sells hot dogs, burgers, trays of French fries with sausages and rolls filled with cheese, chicken and ground meat.  She runs her business from her home on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.  Her work day starts at 4.00pm and lasts until midnight.  Mabel's two eldest daughters help her in preparing the food and serving customers.  She started her business 3 years ago on the recommendation of some of her neighbors who know how good she is at cooking.

As well as running her food business, Mabel also has a family sewing machine with which she sews bedclothes and drapes to order.  This is her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest it in buying several sets of plastic tables and chairs as well as ingredients for making her food.  

Mabel's average weekly sales amount to 400,000 Colombian pesos and her profit margin is 40%.  This small businesswoman's husband is in Europe and although he helps with the household expenses, the absence of a father figure is felt in the education of her daughters.  In the future, Mabel is planning to hire premises so that she can separate her business from her home and also so that she can sell meals every day.  If this project becomes a reality, she is planning to use the same strategy she has used up to now: offer excellent products at the best price.

loans.use: To buy several sets of plastic tables and chairs as well as ingredients for making her food

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 38 years old, is a married man with three children. They live in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a family goal of building a permanent residence.

George is into growing tea and he hires land to do so. He started as one of the workers on an estate but later decided to become an outgrower. [Synonymous with contract farming, the outgrower system provides for private and public firms to purchase the harvests of individual farmers.]

George is requesting a loan to hire land for growing tea.

loans.use: To rent land for growing tea.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen R. is opening a food stand where she will sell snacks to passing motorists and pedestrians. The stand, which she already owns, is located near a major intersection adjacent to her property. Her ideal location offers great growth opportunity in her community, which has a population of 980. Carmen has considerable experience in the service industry, having managed a grocery store she owned with her ex-husband for 19 years. After leaving the grocery store, she worked with other service-oriented businesses but says she missed owning her own business. Just like her grocery store, Carmen plans to make Chacho’s Campestre Center a family owned and operated business. She has recruited her current husband and two grown daughters to help her with Chacho’s operations. Recent illness prevented Carmen from working and depleted the financial resources needed to launch her business. She says finding a lender was the biggest obstacle in trying to open Chacho’s Campestre Center. She was directed to ACCION and Kiva through her local Hispanic Chamber of Commerce. Carmen is grateful to ACCION Texas-Louisiana for recognizing her business’ potential and giving her the funds needed to get started. She says without ACCION Texas-Louisiana’s help, she doesn’t believe her business would be possible. Down the road, Carmen would like to expand the size of her stand as well as the products it carries. Carmen believes this is an attainable goal because of her property’s size and says that when the time comes it can be done cost effectively. Reflecting back on her time as a grocery store owner, she attributes the success she had to the personal relationships she developed with clients. When asked the secrets to success for a customer service-oriented business, Carmen lists creating a friendly, comfortable atmosphere where each customer is treated as an individual.

loans.use: To buy equipment for making and keeping food warm, e.g., hot dogs, etc.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua H. is a widow supporting seven children. For the past seven years, she has run dual businesses of selling footwear and banku (a Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize/cassava dough, usually served with soup, stew or a pepper sauce with fish). 
Her dream is to build and run her own chop bar (local street side restaurant selling a variety of local dishes). She intends to use the loan to purchase more slippers/shoes for sale to increase her revenue. The added profits will go towards building her chop bar.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers for sale to increase her revenue.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maribel; La socia tiene 33 años de edad, la socia es casada,  la socia tiene 1 hijo de 5 años de edad; la socia es representante de ventas, trabaja en la empresa Henkel Peruana, La socia en esta ocasión invertirá el préstamo en mejorar su vivienda, ella desea comprar algunos muebles y también nos comenta que le gusta formar parte de este grupo y tiene grandes amigos y amigas dentro de este y es un grupo bien organizado y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y crecer. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su vivienda.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the community bank "Patron San Sebastian", located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco.  She is 33 years old, married, and has one child who is five years old.  She works as a sales representative at Henkel Peruana.  

She will invest this loan in improving her home.  She would like to purchase more furniture.  She also commented that she likes to be part of this group because she has many good friends and it is a well organized group that is interested in getting ahead and growing.  Maribel is asking for this loan to invest in her home.

Maribel is happy with the loan provided and promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase furniture to improve her home

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 42-year-old married man with six children. He lives in a permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

He has a retail shop and he desires to become a wholesale trader. 

Moses intends to use the loan to buy sugar and maize flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar and maize flour for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four bales of second-hand shoes

loans.name: Estrellas De Plan Autopista Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento ESTRELLAS D. PLAN AUTOPISTA es un banco que ya esta en su segundo ciclo, esta conformado por 8 integrantes 7 mujeres y 1 varón, todas las socias se dedican a distintas actividades y se conocen entre ellos,  la Sra. ARMINDA Tiene a su cargo la presidencia, ella se dedica a la venta comida en una parada D. minibús cerca D. su casa, ella se levanta desD. tempranas horas D. la madrugada para la elaboración D. sus distintos platos, ella es muy conocida por el buen sazón D. sus comidas y ya tiene mucha clientela, y  con el prestamos comprara abarrotes por mayor como fideo, arroz, para no ir al mercado a diario y así tener al alcance D. sus manos  y mejorando así sus ingresos económicos, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The Estrellas D. Plan Autopista enterprising bank is in its 2nd cycle and maD. up of 8 members; 7 women and 1 male.  All of the members know each other and have their own distinctive activities they are dedicated to.  Arminda is president and sells food at a bus stop near her house.  She wakes up early in the morning to prepare her elaborate dishes and is well known for the great seasoning in her foods and has a lot of clients.  With the loan, she will purchase groceries in bulk such as noodles, and rice so that they are readily available and so she doesn't have to go to the market daily and this way increasing her income.  She is very thankful to the institution for the provided support.

loans.use: to purchase groceries in bulk such as noodles and rice

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva, tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos. Se dedica a la siembra y venta de F. y verduras, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de semillas para la siembra. Paulina siembra F. y verduras en Uchuypampa y los vende a sus caceras por mayor. Los días domingos vende en la Feria del Mercado de las Américas.
Está en FINCA Perú hace 2 años, ingreso por la invitación de la promotora, le gusta porque le facilitan los créditos para trabajar y puede ahorrar con sus ahorros compró artefactos para su casa. Su sueño es que su negocio siga prosperando y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Communal Bank Agua Viva, she is 40 years old, married, and has 6 children. She dedicates herself to planting and selling flowers and vegetables. The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of seeds for planting. Paulina plants flowers and vegetables in Uchuypampa and sells them wholesale to neighborhood stores. On Sundays she sells at the las Américas Market.

She has been with FINCA Perú for 2 years after being invited to join by the loan officer. She likes FINCA Perú because it facilitates loans so that she can work and save; with her savings she has bought household items. Her dream is that her business continues to prosper and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: purchase seeds to plant flowers.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 40 years old.  She is single and has three children.  She runs a green grocery store to earn a living.  Previously, she operated a retail shop.  

Through Faulu Kenya, Peninah has grown her business and hence improved her living standards.  This is because she used her previous loans to boost her business.  She hopes to have a stable business in five years.  Peninah requested a loan for 40,000 Kes to buy vegetables, carrots and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, carrots and tomatoes

loans.name: Okari

texts.en:
Okari has a mixed farm in the outskirts of Kitale town in western Kenya. He has been in the farming business for 6 years now and sells his milk and eggs to the local market. Farming has been his only source of income.

Okari has requested a loan of 35,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to buy additional stock of chickens and chicken feeds. He believes that this will increase his production and he will be able to earn more income. The extra income from this project will enable him to pay school fees for his three children who are in school now. He plans to have 3000 chickens in the next 5 years and be the main supplier of eggs to the local market.

Okari is 34 years old, married, and has 4 children between 2 and 8 years old.

loans.use: buy chickens and chicken feeds

loans.name: Santos Remigio

texts.es:
Santos tiene 32 años de edad esta casado y vive con su esposa y dos hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. Esta es una zona rural cuya actividad principal es la ganadería y agricultura.

Santos se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de ganado ovino, teniendo actualmente 25 ovejas a su cargo, las cuales comercializa a los pobladores de su zona y en el mercado local, una vez que estas alcancen tamaño y peso ideal. Adicionalmente Santos se dedica a la agricultura, posee terreno agrícola en el cual siembra limón  y mango. Ambas cosechas están en producción, el limón lo cultiva semanalmente mientras que el mango sale por campaña.

Santos cuenta con clientela establecida a la cual quiere seguir satisfaciendo con sus productos, es por ello que desea invertir en el bienestar de su ganado y cultivos. Santos solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles para comprarle alimento balanceado a sus ovejas y fertilizantes para sus cultivos de mango y limón. Esto le garantizará una buena producción en ambos sectores y las ganancias obtenidas por Santos le serán de suma utilidad para el bienestar de su familia.

Santo ya ha trabajado con nuestra entidad y cuenta con buenas referencias crediticias.
texts.en:
Santos is 32 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children in Tambogrande district, Piura.  This is a rural area whose main business activities are livestock raising and farming.

For several years, Santos has been raising sheep.  He currently cares for 25 sheep which he sells to the residents of his area and in the local market once they have reached an ideal size and weight.  Santos also farms.  He owns farmland where he grows lemons and mangos.  He is currently growing both these products.  He grows the lemons weekly and the mangos seasonally.

Santos has regular customers who he would like to continue satisfying with his products.  For this reason, he would like to invest in the care of his cattle and crops.  Santos is requesting a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed for his sheep and also fertilizers for his mango and lemon crops.  This will guarantee him good production in both areas and the profits he makes will be extremely important in improving his family's well-being.  Santos has worked with our institution before and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and also fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Naranchimeg

texts.en:
Naranchimeg is 34 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in the Hentii province of Mongolia. Her older son, aged 10, goes to a local secondary school while her second son is in kindergarten. Her husband manages a car wash service with his friend. She conducts a clothing trading business at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2010 and has gained much experience. She contributes all her earnings to her family's needs. 

She is a polite and kind woman who is planning to expand her business in the future. She says, "I want to have a plot of land where I can build a house for my family. I hope my dream will come true some day." She is requesting a 3,400,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Adjowa Dite Judith

texts.fr:
Mariée, Judith est  mère de 5 enfants, tous à sa charge. Elle habite chez ses parents avec ses enfants. Elle développe cette activité afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Judith est sur son 7e cycle de prêt et sollicite un montant de 500,000 FCFA.
Judith est vendeuse de condiments, des produits alimentaires, des céréales et autres au marché Mènontin, un marché de la capitale économique du Bénin. Son étalage se situe dans une zone très favorable à son activité. Ses clients sont constitués des usagers du marché et de ses environs. Elle effectue ses approvisionnements au moins 3 fois par semaine chez les grossistes du marché international du Bénin, Tokpa. Elle pourra donc tirer de revenus subséquents pouvant l'aider à assurer la survie de ses enfants et à offrir un confort plus agréable à sa famille. 
Son plus grand projet est d'avoir d'autres stands dans le marché afin de diversifier ses articles.
texts.en: Judith is married and the mother of five children, all still in her care. She lives at her parents’ home with her children. She launched this business in order to provide for her children. Judith is on her 7th loan and is seeking a new loan of 500,000 Francs. Judith sells condiments, food products, cereals, and so on, at the Mènontin market, one of the market of the economic capital of Benin. Her stand has a very advantageous location. Her clients are shoppers coming to the market and the nearby area. She stocks up at least three times a week from the wholesalers at Tokpa, the international market of Benin. This will then allow her to have important income in order to provide for her children and improve her family’s quality of life. Her biggest ambition is to have additional market stands in order to diversify her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy 25 bags of corn at 100 kg each

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Martha; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también tiene una combi que hace servicio urbano en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco y el negocio de tienda de abarrotes lo realiza desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,fideos,aceite,galletas entre otros productos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y mejorar el negocio de transporte. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos y leche al por mayor para la tienda de abarrotes.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the “PUNTUALITO” communal bank, located in the Cusco district, province, and department.

She is 39 years old, is married, and has three children.  Martha has a grocery store and also a van that she uses to provide transportation service along different streets in Cusco.  She works her grocery store business from 5:00am to 10:00pm, and sells primary needs products, such as rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, and cookies, among other things.  She wants to expand her business and improve the service in her store, as well as her transportation business.   She is asking for this loan in order to buy primary needs products for her grocery store.

She is happy about this loan and is committed to repaying it.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Luis Marcelino

texts.es:
Luis Marcelino tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Chillanes, Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVE DE ABRIL, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao.

Luis se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abonos para sus cultivos. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad de sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es trabajar con capital propio.

Le gusta jugar vóley.
texts.en:
Luis Marcelino, 28, is single.  He lives with his parents in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Nueve de Abril” (April 9) communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish belonging to Chillanes Canton.  Its members are primarily corn and cocoa bean farmers.

Luis is a corn and cocoa bean farmer.  His purchases and sales take place in the San José del Tambo market.

He requests the loan to buy seeds and manure for his crops.  The loan will serve as support to meet his economic needs and to improve the quality of his farming activities.  He faces challenges like the drop in price of products he sells as well as middlemen.  His dream is to work with his own capital.  He enjoys playing volleyball.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure for his crops.

loans.name: Cecilia Celia

texts.es: La señora  Cecilia es un cliente antiguo que ingreso el año 2006 con el grupo LLallagua y después se armo el grupo las Sorias trabajando en ese grupo como cuatro secuencias y posteriormente se le otorgo el crédito individual que ya esta en su  cuarta secuencia demostrando puntualidad en sus La Sra. Cecilia se dedica a la venta D. envases D. plásticos,  El crédito  invertirá en la compra D. plásticos, tapers, baldes, tazas y platos. La cliente vive en la zona la portada La Sra. Cecilia es viuda tiene tres hijos y actualmente están en edad escolar. La Sra. Cecilia  trabaja sacrificadamente  para salir adelante con su negocio en la venta D.  plásticos.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a long-time client who joined the "Llallagua" group in 2006.  Later, when the "Las Sorias" group was set up, she worked with that group for four loans. Afterwards, she was granted loans on an individual basis. She is now on her fourth loan, and is making her payments on time.

Cecilia sells plastic containers. She will use the loan to buy plastic containers, tupperware, pails, cups and plates. This client lives in the La Portada neighborhood. Cecilia is a widow with three school-age children.  Cecilia works in a self-sacrificing way to get ahead in her plastic container business.

loans.use: To buy plastic containers of all types.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 29 years old and married to Christine.  They have one child.   John has been manufacturing candles for the last year, making a monthly profit of KES.6,000.  He is requesting a loan of KES.30,000,  with which he plans to purchase raw materials for making candles.

With the anticipated profit, he plans to purchase another machine for making candles.

loans.use: Purchase raw material for making candles,

loans.name: Tserendolgor

texts.en: Tserendolgor is 40 years old and lives with her children and husband in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her husband helps the family business during his work off-season. Her eldest son works in Ulaanbaatar city, and two other children are high school students. Her youngest son attends kindergarten. She started her business in 2004 by selling hot meals and foods at the local train station. She purchased a small cart with a loan she took from XacBank in March 2011. She sells foods and drinks that equal from 30,000 (Mongolian tugriks) MNT to 40,000 MNT. She sells her hot meals during the times when the international train passes. She says that, "The local train station is under construction and if the commercial space rent is reasonable, I plan to rent one of them and sell foods and drinks." She plans to expand her business. She is requesting a 725,000 MNT loan to purchase a refrigerator and TV for her daughter who is just married.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and TV.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a lady married to a businessman; they have no children yet. She runs a clothing sales business at Tena estate in Nairobi. She has been in this business for three years now. She says the business is profitable and the only challenge she has is financial constraints and harassment from the local government. However, she works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure her business is doing well. 

She is using her loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy stock of inner wear to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. She describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, tiene 52 años, es un hombre trabajador y muy responsable, convive con su pareja, pero es madre de seis hijos, de los cuales vive con 4 de ellos, de 13, 09, 04 años y uno de 02 meses; a quienes le brinda educación y alimentación. Por tanto trabaja mucho para darle una mejor calidad de vida, el vive en su casa propia en el distrito de Irazola a unos 60 km de la ciudad. Su trabajo consiste en la siembra y cosecha de maíz, plátanos, piñas, limones, productos regionales, por lo que tiene una chacra muy cerca de su casa. Toda su vida ha trabajado con la tierra sembrando, cuidando, fertilizando y cosechando. Él trabaja a lado de su pareja cuando es tiempo de cuidar las plantas, pero cuando se trata de siembra o cosecha, debe contratar los servicios de los peones que lo ayudan a hacer el trabajo más rápido. Manifiesta que le gsuta trabajar en este ambiente natural, pues es el lugar donde creció y aprendió de ella para valerse ahora por si mismo. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, y esta muy emocionado de poder acceder a su colaboración para poder invertir en sus tierras. Con el monto solicitado,  comprará semillas, sacoa de abono, tierra, y contratará peones para empezar con la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
José, 52, is a hardworking, very responsible man.  He lives with his spouse who is the mother of six children.  Four of them still live with them.  They are 13, 9 and 4 years old and one is 2 months old.  He provides food and schooling for them so works very hard to provide them with a better quality of life.  He lives in his own house in Irazola District about 60 kilometers from the city.

His work consists in farming corn, bananas, pineapples, and lemons-regional products.  He has a field very near his house.  He’s worked in farming his entire life caring for his plants, fertilizing and harvesting.  He works alongside his spouse but when it’s planting and harvesting time he has to hire day workers to help him do the work faster. He states that he likes to work out in the natural environment because it’s the place where he grew up and he leaned from it how to fend for himself.

This will be his third MFP loan and he’s very excited to be able to access your collaboration to invest in his land.  He will use the requested amount to buy seeds, sacks of manure, soil and will hire day workers to start the next planting.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, lemons, sacks of manure, soil and to hire day workers.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  She is 25 years old, married to Jacob, and they have three children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by existing clients and this is her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy a cow to boost her farming.

In future, Ruth hopes to expand her farming business and make more profits.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Tseyenhorloo

texts.en: Tseyenhorloo is 67 years old and lives with her husband and son in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is a taxi driver and her son works in a mining company. She was a cook in a power plant for 20 years and when she retired, recently, she opened her own cafe in a rented workspace. She enjoys her job and her dishes are known as the tastiest and cheapest. She is a sharp and diligent woman who says: "It makes me happy when people enjoy my food". She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy food supplies for her fresh start.

loans.use: To buy food supplies.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
Jose santos, tiene, 38 años de edad, casado desde hace 14 años, tiene 5 hijos de 9 meses, 5, 7, 11 y 12 años de edad, tres de ellos están en la escuela, vive en una aldea Agua Sarca de San Jose, Lempira.
Este señor tiene 5 años de dedicarse al cultivo de café y cultivo de granos básicos como maíz, frijoles y plátano en una finca de 1 manzana de terreno que le heredo su padre. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos y actualmente la cosecha de café esta dejando buenas ganancias. Trabaja todos los días y todo el día.
El préstamo que ha solicitado es para darle un mejor mantenimiento a la finca en cuanto a limpieza y herbicidas, para sacar buen producto y obtener buenas ganancias. De esta fuente de ingresos va lograr que sus hijos terminen su estudio.
texts.en:
Jose Santos is 38 years old and has been married for 14 years. He has five children (ages 9 months, 5, 7, 11, and 12 years). Three of them are in school. He lives in the neighborhood of Agua Sarca de San Jose, Lempira.

Sr. Jose has been growing coffee and basic crops (corn, beans, and bananas) for five years. His farm consists of one plot of land that he inherited from his father. This business is his source of income. At the moment, his coffee crop is generating good earnings. He works all day, every day.

The loan he is requesting will be used to better maintain his farm by clearing the land and applying herbicides so that he can achieve a good product and obtain good profits. With his income, Jose wants to see his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to pay the costs associated with clearing and maintaining his land.

loans.name: Cristo Es La Esperanza 3, 5 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Yolanda is the coordinator of Cristo es la Esperanza 3, 4 & 5 (Christ is the hope). She lives with her long-term partner and their four children in a simple structure, located in a rural community in the city of La Romana. Specifically, the community is a batey (company town) founded for sugar cane workers where she, her family and the other 14 micro-entrepreneur women in this group reside.

Yolanda says that her most important challenge is to have a house in the main city and to raise, educate and support her children in all they may need. She operates a colmado, a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily food. Normally colmados are in the same neighborhood, just a short walk from any home. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy sugar, rice, vegetables, canned food, cooking oil, flour, etc. 

Part of this group for almost a year, Yolanda is excited to receive her third loan with Esperanza, each one helping her to improve her business. With her profits, she will reinvest in her business and save. Yolanda thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, vegetables, canned food, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 26-year-old man, the father of two children. He has worked in manufacturing metal for nine years. This business is unique since he makes all the non-available requested hardware for cars, engines and constructors.
 
Mohamad is a hard worker and liked by most of his customers. He is a man with a very good reputation.

Mohamad is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. This loan will be invested in his business, in order to buy new updated machines.

loans.use: To buy new updated machines to improve his business.

loans.name: David Maina

texts.en:
David is married and has a two-year-old son. He describes himself as a determined and God-fearing man. He has been a mason for the last six years. In addition, he also sells shoes to add another source of income. His business of masonry is risky as he says and he has been faced with the problem of inadequate funds to get insurance covering the masonry products and himself. 

David will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more building blocks. In the future, David hopes to employ sub-contractors.

loans.use: To buy building blocks.

loans.name: Rosalina Alejandra

texts.es: Rosalina Alejandra es una emprendedora que ha tenido éxitos, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general , no es la primera vez que la señora Rosalina  tiene crédito con Fundación León 2000, ella nos explica que gracias  al apoyo que se le brindado ha aumentado su inventario ofreciéndole a sus clientes variedad de productos. Rosalinda está solicitando actualmente crédito para comprar mercadería como sandalias, zapatos deportivos, zapatilla, shorts entre otros productos que sus clientes les solicitan.
texts.en: Rosalina Alejandra is an entrepreneur who has been successful.  Her business is selling general merchandise.  This is not the first time that Rosalina has received a loan from Fundación León 2000.  She tells us that, thanks to the support she has received, she has increased her stock and is able to offer her customers a variety of products.  Rosalinda is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as sandals, sports shoes, sneakers, shorts and other products that her customers are requesting.

loans.use: to buy sandals, sports shoes, sneakers, shorts and other products

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah used her previous loan to buy craft items to sell. However, she still faces the business challenges of price fluctuations, inflation, and customers not paying on time. Sarah's personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent house. Her business goal is to own an art gallery. 

Sarah is requesting a loan to buy more craft items to sell.

loans.use: to buy crafts to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort  sells charcoal, oranges and sweet potatoes at Asebu Ekroful. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. Comfort has been selling charcoal, oranges and sweet potatoes for three years. She assists her husband as to the welfare of the children. Her loan will be used to buy bags of charcoal, oranges and sweet potatoes for sale. With the new profit she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: buy bags of charcoal, oranges and sweet potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Berlinda

texts.en:
Berlinda is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 8 children. 

Berlinda has a vulcanizing shop that provides motor repairs & tire repairs, with her husband as the repairman. She has had this business for 10 years.

Berlinda requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the electricity for her business.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Berlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy tools & pay for electricity

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph still runs his general store business, and he now supports a family of three. He has borrowed another loan of KES 50,000, after having successfully repaid his previous loan. He intends to use the loan to purchase more stock for his retail shop.

He anticipates earning profit, part of which he will use to pay school fees for his children. The rest he will plow back into the business.

loans.use: To expand the business by buying inventory in larger quantity, like sugar, flour, cooking fat, tea leaves and salt.

loans.name: Ldyia

texts.en: Lydia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children all attending school. She sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 700,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. Her major challenge includes defaulters and seasonality. She joined MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans. Lydia aspires to build a residential house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Sulejman

texts.en: Sulejman needs your financial help to buy almond and walnuts seedlings with all the money that he is asking from you. " the soil and the weather is very supportive of such protein based nuts and they are so much in demand in our country and the selling/buying price is not cheap either. I think this would be a good investment to my agricultural activity in the long run," said Sulejman to the loan officer and branch assistant when he stopped by the institution's office in his region.

loans.use: to buy almond and walnut seedlings for planting

loans.name: Finè

texts.en:
Mrs. Finè D. was born in 1962 in Lomé (P/Golfe). She is married and mother to three (03) children, with two (02) other children under her care. Her husband, a police officer who has been retired for 5 years, no longer makes any real contribution to the household's needs. The family's costs are becoming more and more difficult to bear, because Mrs. D. lacks the funds to develop her business of selling poultry, which should be able to earn her a substantial income. Very determined although she is illiterate, Mrs. D. has a sharp business sense, which helped her greatly in managing the first credits she received and paid off without incident. She is building her confidence, and deserves once again to receive financial support. She is asking for a credit of $850 to be able to go to farms herself and buy poultry. This credit will increase the size of her business and improve her socio-economic standing.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame D. Finè est née en 1962 à Lomé (P/Golfe). Mariée et mère de trois enfants (03) et deux (02) autres enfants à sa charge. Son mari, un gendarme admis à la retraite depuis 5 ans, ne contribue plus réellement aux besoins du foyer. Les charges du ménage deviennent de plus en plus lourdes car elle manque de fonds de commerce pour développer ses activités de vents de volailles qui devraient bien lui procurer des revenus substantiels. Très déterminée et malgré qu’elle soit analphabète, Madame D. a un sens aigu de gestion des affaires, Cela l’a beaucoup dans la gestion de ses premiers obtenus et remboursés sans incident. Elle nourrit confiance et mérite d’être à nouveau soutenue financièrement. Elle sollicite un crédit de $850 pour pouvoir aller elle-même dans les fermes pour l’achat des volailles. Ce crédit augmentera la taille de son activité et améliorera son niveau de vie socio économique.

loans.use: Buying and selling poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tureto wants to build four rental rooms in Olturoto trading centre

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en: M. Kamala is 40 and she is dislocated person (IDP) from Nagorniy Karabakh since 1993. She is married and has 3 children. She successfully keeps two cows and one calf. Mrs. M. plan to improve her small business and enlarge it. To reach the goal she hopes borrowed 1200 USD loan from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Munavar

texts.en:
Munavar has a small shop selling women's garments in the Panjshanbe market. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is dead. Her elder son is old enough to help his mother to arrange her goods in her trading place. She currently brings her goods from Bishkek, Kirgizistan.

She became a client of Micro Invest in March, 2007. Her first loan was 100USD. The loan permitted her to expand her assortment and attract more clients. Now she wants to buy her goods from Turkey. The garments from Turkey have good demand among clients. She plans to spend her future loan for purchasing seasonal garments from there. She is requesting 800USD for this purpose.

loans.use: Purchase of garments

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Mrs. O. Dy was married in 1997 and has 1 son. She started her grocery store at home in 2005. Her business is doing well. People in the village can buy many groceries at her store, so they don't have to go to the market. Her husband is a security bodyguard in Phnom Penh.

This is Mrs Dy's first request for a loan from MAXIMA. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy more groceries. She wants to increase the inventory for the store so that the neighbors can afford the food and other things for their daily needs, and avoid spending a lot of time traveling to the market. She will not have any problem paying back the loan because she and her husband have good incomes.

loans.use: Purchasing grocery items in increase the inventory in the store.

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: A successful businesswoman, who has the ambition to increase the worth of her business, Mrs. Kemi B. is a fashion designer and also sells clothes to her customer. She is 42 years of age and has three children. She hopes to expand her business with the loan that can hopefully be given to her. She has 14 years of experience in business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and tailoring materials

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a very persistent woman who has learned to strive for a better life since her youth. She has been in turns a saleswoman in a store and cook in a cafeteria. She had also owned a clothing store for a long time. Nilda is a single mother of two children, a boy and a girl.

Currently, Nilda runs a cafeteria. She had taken cuisine classes in a professional center of culinary art. She says her customers are very satisfied with the quality of her dishes. Now she wants to run her own business and, as she puts it: “I am working hard to achieve that goal."

With her loan, Nilda will purchase of raw materials to continuen producing food for her cafeteria. She hopes she can earn sufficient money to realise her dreams to run her own small business before long.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to start a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria, age 32, is married with 2 children (ages 7 and 10). She has a business of selling clothes - underwear, fabrics, and sarongs - from 10am to 2pm daily, which she started in 2006. From this business, she can make a monthly profit of about $30. She hopes for a loan to increase her sales. She is a member of a loan group called Thimaini, which totals 27 members who ensure that they all pay back their loans.

loans.use: To buy clothing inventory

loans.name: Shahlo.

texts.ru:
Shahlo H. lives in the Rudaki region. She is married, is 31 years old and does not have children. Shahlo works in agriculture, planting potatoes and other vegetables. She will use her loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer. She has been in this business for 10 years, supporting her family and providing local markets with ecologically clean vegetables. Shahlo plans to pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хасанова Шахло проживает в районе Рудаки.Замужем детей не имеет. Возраст 31 год .Занимается сельским хозяйством. Посадкой картофеля и других овощей. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить семена картофеля и удобрений.Занимается этим бизнесом клиентка уже 10 лет, тем самым обеспечивая свою семью , а также рынки города экологически чистыми овощами.Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and potato seeds

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Tình, 43 years old, lives with her husband and 4 children in Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Three of the children are still in school so the education budget is quite a concern. She farms rice, raises livestock and sells grocery, vegetable items at the open market for living. She uses half of the funds from the loan to buy young pigs and cows, the other half to invest in her grocery stand.
