The steady income from the grocery stand is used to make payments; income from selling livestock to finance her children’s education and buy major household items. The family’s economy improves every year. She is applying for a loan of 575USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Tình, 43 tuổi, sống tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An cùng chồng và 4 con. Trong số con của chị 3 cháu vẫn đang học phổ thông nên chi phí khá tốn kém. Để có tiền cho các con ăn học, ngoài làm ruộng, chị Tình còn chăn nuôi kết hợp với việc buôn bán. Tiền vay từ Quỹ được chị chia làm hai phần, một phần mua lợn bò, một phần dùng cho việc bán rau quả, hàng khô ngoài chợ. Nhờ sử dụng vốn vay hợp lý nên việc trả tiền tuần của chị Tình luôn thuận lợi. Số tiền bán lợn, bò được dùng đóng học phí cho các con hoặc sắm sửa vật dụng trong nhà. Kinh tế qua các năm có nhiều thay đổi, chị Tình tiếp tục xin vay 575USD để mua lợn và hàng bán.

loans.use: Buy pigs and goods

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru:
Shahlo H. lives in Vahdat. She is married and has 3 children. She has a community college degree. She does not have a job. She helps her husband provide for the family by selling milk. Shahlo has steady clients from whom she buys milk at low prices and then travels out of the area to re-sell it. This is a profitable business. Shahlo has her own cow, but the cow does not give any milk. If she had a milk cow, her profits would nearly double and she would also be able to lower her prices. This would make the milk she sells more affordable for the local people. This is why she is seeking a loan of $1025 to buy a good dairy cow. She plans to repay her loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Хабибуллоева шахло проживает в городе Вахдат . Замужем и имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Нигде не работает. Но не смотря на это помогает мужу обеспечивать семью. Занимается торговлей молока. Имеет клиентов у которых скупает молоко по низким ценам и вывозит за приделы района. Продает оптом , а затем возвращается домой. Этот бизнес приносит доход.У нее есть корова , но она не дает молока. Но если бы у нее была корова, которая давала бы молоко, то ее доход увеличился бы почти в два раза, и кроме того цены на продаваемое ею молока были бы ниже. Это позволило бы населению покупать молоко по более низким и доступным ценам. Поэтому Шахло решила обратится к нам за кредитом . Ей нужна сумма в размере 1025 долларов США, на которые она сможет купить хорошую дойную корову. А погасить кредит планируетв течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Saidullo

texts.en: K. Saidullo was born in 1962 in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. As many his fellow villagers, he is engaged in the livestock business. Mr. K. Saidullo has 25 years experience in livestock. He has the large flock. His business includes meat and milk-sour products making. He is married and has 5 children so he has to work hard to ensure a good standard of living for his family. He also works as the tractor driver in the collective farm. Now Mr. K. Saidullo applies to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to open a trade outlet to sell meat.

loans.use: Opening a trade outlet to sell meat.

loans.name: Albina's Group

texts.en:
Victoria, Maximiliana, and Albina are members of the Village Bank Covadonga.

Albina is married, 36 years old, and has three children. Albina sells groceries in the Ayacuchan jungle, and distributes mainly to the stores, bringing peanuts and coco from the jungle and selling them in the city of Ayacucho.

Victoria is married, 40 years old, and has four children. Victoria sells vegetables at a stand that she rents in the Nery Garcia Market – a business she does every afternoon.

Maximiliana is a widow, 55 years old and has six children. Maximiliana sells food at the bridge in the city of Ayacucho, which she does every afternoon.

Victoria, Maximiliana and Albina need loans of 300 soles, 600 soles and 1500 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of onions, lemons, meat, pans, plates, coffee and peanuts.

Victoria, Maximiliana, and Albina's dreams are to build their businesses and to offer a good education to their children.

loans.use: To buy onions, lemons, meat, pans, plates, coffee and peanuts.

loans.name: Sehllyn Lisseth

texts.es:
Sehllyn is 28 years old, lives in the Casmilo Ortega neighbor, and is married. Her husband is and architect and supports her economically. She has one young son. Together they try to improve their living conditions. Sehllyn has a small store where she sells clothing, cosmetics, and home electronics. She has 5 years experience and started the business with S. of used clothing. She wishes to improve her business, and this loan will be used as investment capital in order to achieve better income.

Sehllyn tiene 28 años de edad, habita en el barrio Casimilo Ortega, es casada, su esposo es Arquitecto y le apoya económicamente. Tiene un hijo que es menor de edad. Junto a su familia pretenden mejorar las condiciones de vida. Sehllyn tiene una pequeña tienda donde ofrece ropa, cosméticos y electrodomésticos, tiene 5 años de experiencia e inició el negocio con venta de ropa usada. Desea ampliar más el negocio, el préstamo será usado en inversión de capital para lograr mayores ingresos.

loans.use: Investment capital for her business.

loans.name: Hidjran

texts.en: Hidjran is the mother of one child. She lives in Baku city. She was born in 1983. Hidjran has been in the cafe business for 3 years. Now she needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy the necessary things for her cafe so she can provide her customers with the best service.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for cafe to provide her customers with the best service

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: This is the third time that Mrs. Chan N. has asked for a loan to improve her business. She owns a small restaurant where she sells food in Trapaing Chi Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Sun Saroeurn, sells vegetables in the local market. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it so his wife decided to ask for a loan to purchase more vegetables in order to meet the needs of consumers. Mrs. Chan N. is 49 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending school. Mrs. Chan N. had previously obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business. She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Santos Maria

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Santos G., me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo varios años de dedicarme a esta actividad con la que he podido criar y educar a mis hijas, las cuales tienen 18 y 16 años de edad, en estos momentos necesito un credito para comprar mas materia prima para la produccion de mis tortillas y asi tener una mayor venta y mayores ingresos y de esta forma cubrir los gastos de mi hogar.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Santos G. and I have dedicated myself to the production and sales of tortillas (made from corn). A number of years ago I began this activity which has allowed me to raise and education my daughters, who are now 18 and 15 years old. At this moment I need a loan in order to purchase larger quantities of prime materials for the production of tortillas and in this was increase my sales and profits and thus cover the costs of my home.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing corn, firewood, lime, phosphorus, water

loans.name: Tofig

texts.en:
Tofig has been in sheep breeding business for three years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Fuzuli region, Bala Bahmanli village. Tofig was born in 1975. He is married and has two children.

Tofig needs a loan of 800 AZN (US$1,000) to buy 12 sheep for improving his sheep breeding business.

loans.use: To buy 12 sheep

loans.name: Mrs. Phal Saing Villag Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people who all live in Pun Phnum Village in Takeo Province make up the village bank loan.  All the members will use the loan which they obtain for different purposes.  

Mrs. Phal S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members.  She and her husband, Mr. On Hol, own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for livI..  They have seven children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is at the age of five years old.  

Although Mrs. Phal S. and her family have different businesses, they still cannot provide better conditions for the family.  In order to improve these livI. conditions, Mrs. Phal S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to bU. a motorbike for her husband to start a motorbike taxi drivI. business.  She hopes to improve her livI. conditions with this new loan. 

This is a village bank loan consistI. of mainly end-of-term loans.  Nine members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.  These nine are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a motorbike taxi driving business.

loans.name: Khursanoy

texts.en:
Khursanoy is married and has one son. Her husband has no fixed work. To meet their everyday needs, Khursanoy decided to start her own business 5 years ago. She offered her services as a seamstress, and her love of her work has helped her to go far. She started making a traditional raincoat, called a “chapan,” for men and women. Fortunately she has a lot of clients and her business is doing well. Through hard work, Khursanoy has expanded her business, and the demand for her chapans is growing. She is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni ($ 750 USD), which she will use to buy materials. She will repay the amount over a period of 12 months. Today you can help someone who really needs it. Khursanoy and her family sincerely thank you.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan has a rich and varied history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and an outpost of Alexander the Great's domain. From this region sprang great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex amalgam of Islamic, Soviet, and modern Western influences as well as Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan's independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fabric for the manufacture of raincoats

loans.name: Kheang

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheang T. was born in 1958 and she now lives in Sduk Thom village in Kampong Cham province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Tho Thok, is a farmer who owns a plot to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he faces some problems because his field is infertile and she does not have enough money to buy fuel for a pump to irrigate the field.

To deal with these problems, Mrs. Kheang T. decided to ask for a loan. She hopes to increase income and improve the family's living conditions. She is the mother of seven children, one of whom helps her husband with his plantation. The other two are employed in a garment factory. Three of are enrolled in the local school and the remaining is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fuel for a pump to irrigate the field.

loans.name: Elmik

texts.en:
Elmik H. is 53 years old and married with 2 children.  He runs his own store where he sells confectioneries such as candies, cookies and other food stuffs. 

Elmik is an agronomist, but since this profession is not in demand, he decided to open his own business in 1996.  His main purpose of living is to provide excellent education to his children and improve their lives.  This is why he tries very hard to keep his business running well. 

To increase his income, Elmik applied for $1200.  This loan will be used for purchasing more food stuffs.  Elmik is counting on your helping hand.

loans.use: Purchase food products

loans.name: Arcel

texts.en:
Arcel B. is a cook and owns a small eatery in her village. She is 38 years old and has only one child. Her husband, Aristarco helps her manage the business. Together, they work very hard to provide a good future for their child. Prior to this business, she sold dry goods. But she wound up with a food business because she thinks that it is a better and more profitable business.

She is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional stock and to renovate her eatery. The loan will help Arcel attract more customers and earn more income for her family.

CEVI is helping people start and run their own business. They don't just provide loans to people; they also give training and insurance coverage to help their clients succeed in their business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock and renovate the eatery

loans.name: Ramona Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Ramona T. es una persona muy humilde el cual se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en su propio establecimiento en el mercado Central de la ciudad de León.

Ella se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora y por eso lleva el sustento a su casa de habitación. Una de las necesidades que la señora Ramona atraviesa es que requiere de un crédito para la compra de las frutas y verduras y por este motivo ha acudido a Ceprodel esperando ser beneficiada y así salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ramona T. is a very humble person who sels fruits and vegetables at her own establishment in the central market in León. She stands out because she is a very hard worker which enables her to support her household. Ramona needs a loan to purchase fruit and vegetables and has therfore come to Ceprodel hoping to receive assistance and get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam A. is a 40-year-old mother of five children aged 23, 21, 19, 17 and 12. One is still in school but the first four have finished.

Miriam is single and lives in the Nymasaria slum where she runs a small hotel (restaurant). She sells Kenyan dishes like chapatti, ugali and fish. Typically, she will see 20 customers a day. Each item costs around 20 Kenyan Shillings and if you want a whole plate, it is 100 shillings. She is asking for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings so she can purchase chairs for her hotel.

loans.use: Chairs

loans.name: Edroze Ndeezo Grace Group

texts.en: Grace N. is a professional nurse. She is forty-four years old and has six children who are all in school. She has owned a drugstore for over eight years. She is using the loan to purchase various medicines to add to her inventory. She is happy because she is rendering a service to the people in her community. Grace's dream is to build a better house for herself and to build up her business.

loans.use: To buy various medicines to increase inventory.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.pt:
Verónica Panguene é natural de Maputo, tem 43 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 6 filhos sendo três a viver nas suas casas e três ainda na sua responsabilidade.

Verónica estudou até 4ªclasse e parou por falta de condições, nasceu e cresceu num dos bairros periféricos da cidade de Maputo, casou em 1979,  aos 13 anos inicia actividade comercial qual desenvolve até data hoje.

Verónica solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva no valor de 10000,00mt com qual pretende aumentar o seu volume de negocio, dado que neste momento tem um rendimento mensal de 11000,00mt a 12000,00mt.  Futuramente sonha comprar uma viatura e conta com o credito.
texts.en:
Verónica Panguene is a native of Maptu. She is 43 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. Three live in their own homes and three are still her responsibility.

Verónica was in school through 4th grade and stopped due to cirumstances. She was born and grew up on the outskirts of the city of Maputo. She married in 1979. At age 13, she started her business which she still works in.

Verónica has requested a loan from Hluvuku and Kiva in the amount of 10,000 meticais, with which she plans to increase her business volume. At this time, she has a monthly revenue of 11,000 to 12,000 meticais. In the future, she dreams of buying a vehicle with a loan.

Translated from Portuguese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell clothes

loans.name: Muiddinhoja

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Муиддинходжа мужчина , который кредитуется на расширение бизнеса мужской обуви. Он за товаром ездит сам раз в месяц в Бишкек. Продаёт на обувном рынке Худжанда.
За время кредитования он ни разу не нарушал условий Фонда. Для увеличения летней обуви , он планирует получив кредит съездить и привезти мужские сланцы. Как всем известно Худжанд город солнечный и сдесь очень жарко, поэтому сейчас сезон сланц.
 Поэтому Муидинходжа хочет пополнить товарооборот.
texts.en:
Muiddinhoja is a man who has used credit to expand his men's shoe business. Once a month he makes a buying trip to Bishkek, and sells his goods at the Khujand shoe market. Over the course of his credit history, he has always abided by the terms of his loans. To increase his inventory of summer shoes, he is planning to take out a loan to bring in men's flip flops. As Khujand is a town that is very sunny and hot, and it is now the season for flip flops, Muiddinhoja wants to increase his turnover.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoe sales

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita M. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 48 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. Merlita owns and operates a service-based business providing general equipment rental to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2000, Merlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 15th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Joaquim Xavier

texts.pt:
Joaquim Xavier J. nasceu em Inhambane tem 30 anos de idade vive maritalmente e estudou ate a 10ª classe é pai de 3 filhos, a mais velha de 11 anos a penúltima de 5 anos e a mais nova de apenas 3mêses de idade. Somente as duas mais velhas e que vão à escola.

J. sai de Inhambane para Município da vila de Namaacha na fronteira da suazilândia com sua irmã quando concluiu a 8ª classe, pois onde ele estudava só tinha aquele nível de ensino. chegado a Namaacha continua com os seus estudos tendo conseguido a vaga de noite.No período de manhã a irmã arranja lhe um emprego na mata num contrato que era renovável de 3 em 3 meses durante 2 anos. Anos depois candidata-se voluntariamente como membro  numa organização denominada (OJM) Organização da Juventude Moçambicana e é afecto como assistente de departamento de administração e finanças ate então. E trabalhador a mais de 5 anos auferindo mensalmente um valor de 3.300.00MT trabalhando das 7h às 17h e nos sábados das 5h às 18h caso houver visita dos chefes do aparelho do estado com um subsidio de 1.500.00MT valor este que não satisfaz as suas necessidades e então aproxima se a hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo para dar inicio da sua obra e pede este de 12.000.00MT para o mesmo fim. Consegue por mês poupar 500.00MT, pois vive numa casa de aluguer onde paga em cada mês um valor de 800.00MT.

Este e o terceiro empréstimo de J. na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. Estes 12.000.00MT serão usados para comprar material de construção para fazer a cobertura da sua casa, esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e provavelmente nos final deste ano ira morar em sua própria casa.
texts.en:
Joaquim Xavier Joao was born in Inhambane, he is 30 years old, studied until the 10th grade and lives with his wife and 3 sons the oldest is 11 years old, the next is 5 years old and the youngest is 3 months old. The two oldest go to school. Joaquim left Inhambane and went to the municipality of Vila de Namaacha at the frontier with Suazilandia to live with his sister when he finished the 8th grade, because where he was living they didn't have the next level. When he arrived to Namaacha he continued with his studies during the night. During the morning his sister got him a job in the jungle with a renewable contract every 3 months for 2 years. Years later he was a volunteer member of the organization called (OJM) Organization of Mozambique Youth and was entrusted as assistant of the administration and finances department. Since then he has been working for the past 5 years earning a monthly salary of 3,300.00MT working from 7am to 5pm and Saturdays from 5am to 6pm when there are visits from the chiefs of the state department, he receives a subside of 1,500.00MT but it doesn't fulfill his necessities so he came to Hluvuku to request a loan to start building his house and receives 12,000,00MT. He is able to save 500.00MT a month because he rents the place where he lives at 800.00MT monthly. This is the third loan Joaquim is requesting to Hluvuku and first with Kiva. The 12,000MT will be used to buy material for construction to build the ceiling of his house, he is confident he will pay before the due date and probably by the end of the year he will be living in his own house.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: For the past two years, Esther has been trading in the local market of Kasoa in Ghana. She is a married 43-year-old with five children, all of whom are in school. She is very busy selling palm oil, rice, vegetable oil, tinned tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish, etc. at her local market. Esther is convinced, however, that her business will grow better with increased capital and she therefore wants a loan for $350 USD (500 GHS) to buy more yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize, and beans to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of the proceeds to finance her children's education and dreams of saving major parts of the income from her store for their continued schooling.

loans.use: To buy stock to sell in her local food market

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлюба Сулаймонова проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 55 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Матлюба более 18 лет проработала "доктором". В данный момент занимается животноводством. Она откармливает крупный и мелкий рогатый скот, потом  продает. Муж занимается предоставлением услуги "такси". Кредит просит для для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Matluba S. lives in the Gissar region. She is 55 years old. She is married and has four children. Matluba has been working as a doctor for more than eighteen years. At this time she does animal husbandry. She feeds large and small cattle and then sells it. Her husband works as a taxi driver. She is asking for a loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is engaged in vegetable vending business. She is already 30 years of age and is married to Larry E., a driver of vegetable truck and was task to travel in some places to deliver vegetables. They have 2 children namely; Dharence - 8 years of age, grade 3, and Lerry Mae - 4 years old, studying in kinder garten. With her parent in-law, her family happily lives in their rural area of Nungnungan Cauayan City. 

	She wanted to borrow loan amounting to PHP4, 000 from the lenders to able develop her vending stall business where she sell vegetables, and some other vending products that were sailable. She hopes to improve her vending with the amount she hoping to avail. Cynthia said, patience will make her successful someday and she hardly prays for it.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana G. is among the many people relocated from a shanty town in Manila City in the late '70s. Fifteen years ago, she ventured into a business selling charcoal for household fuel. Her business grew gradually until she was able to establish a general merchandise store selling grocery items and rice. Later she added commercial feed for livestock. She is now earning 30,000 PHP per month. Susana is a hardworking entrepreneur living along the rolling hills of Camarin in Caloocan City with her husband, Reynaldo, 42, a driver by profession.

In 2006, Susana got to know about the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative from a longtime member and became a member herself. She is now on her twelfth loan cycle and has applied for a new loan of 30,000 PHP to be used for the expansion of her businesses. Susana dreams of owning a taxicab for her husband soon.

About CCT: The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response to poverty and social injustice. It is carried out through a fusion of social development initiatives and an evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. CCT serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy es una mujer muy dinámica de 27 años, es madre de un hijo y está separada. Como sus padres son netamente agricultores, desde niña aprendió las técnicas de cómo cultivar cada uno de los productos. Es por ello que con mucha facilidad y sola, siembra café, maíz y fréjoles, sólo busca operarios para las temporadas de siega de los fréjoles, ya que cada  tres meses cosecha dicho producto, es por ello que le resulta mucho más rentable. Cuando comercializa sus frijoles logra obtener hasta 1500 soles, los cuales guarda para sus provisiones de tres meses mientras espera la próxima recolección de sus otros productos. Lucy se siente muy feliz de sostenerse mediante sus cultivos y sobre todo que a su hijo no le falte nada. 
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, ella menciona que se siente muy cómoda y acostumbrada  con todos los integrantes de su banco comunal, además está muy agradecida por la confianza en la obtención de créditos consecutivos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus diversos cultivos.
texts.en:
Lucy is a dynamic, 27 year-old woman who is separated and is the mother of a son. Since her parents are farmers, she learned the techniques of growing each one of their products when she was young. For this reason she is able to grow crops of coffee, rice and beans on her own, only using workers temporarily during the times of harvesting beans. Every three months she harvests her produce; this way it is much more profitable. When she sells her beans she is able to earn 1500 soles; this sum is used to pay for her supplies for three months while she waits for the next harvest of her other products. Lucy is happy that through her farming she is able to sustain herself and ensure that her son does not want for anything. This is her third loan with MFP; she mentions that she feels very comfortable and accustomed to all of the members of her communal bank. In addition, she is very grateful for the trust that she has been given in obtaining consecutive loans. The money that she requests now will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers for her diverse crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian is 26 years old and single but he has three dependents that he cares for aged 10, 12 and 15.

Christian’s shop is relatively new - only 7 months old, but so far the business is doing quite well. He employs two other people as helpers in his store. He works long days and is trying to establish his business as a leading provider of general and sundry merchandise in his community.

This is Christian’s first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders and he hopes to use the proceeds to help his cash flow and working capital situation. He will also use the loan to buy new items for this shop that he thinks his customers will want to purchase. At the same time, by purchasing in larger quantities he will be able to garner lower prices for his products which will give him more profit at the end of the day.

Christian wants this business to succeed to provide a secure future for himself and his dependents.

loans.use: To help his cash flow and working capital situation and to buy new items for this shop

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata S. est une femme de 37 ans, elle est marié et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE NORD" dans lequel elle s'est bien comportée, depuis un an et demi. Avec son crédit elle a monté un mini restaurant où elle vend le petit déjeuné et des œufs bouillis. cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Aminata S. is a 37-year-old woman who is married and the mother of one child. For 1½ years, she has been a member Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE NORD" in which she has a good performance record. With her loan, she has established a mini-restaurant, where she sells breakfast and boiled eggs. This business brings in profits allowing her to help meet family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Persevérance Plus Group

texts.fr:
La banque communautaire « Persévérance Plus » est un groupe constitué solidairement de 26 membres dont Georgette est dirigeante. Ces micro entrwepreneurs sont déterminés à développer leurs activités avec le soutien financier des prêteurs du monde à travers Kiva et l’IMF HOPE RDC.
Georgette K., 55 ans, est dans le monde de micro entreprise depuis 1982. Elle a consacré presque toute sa vie au petit commerce et elle en a acquit une solide expérience. Son affaire actuelle consiste à la vente des épices et de la boisson sucrée. Elle est cliente fidèle qui obtenu 3 fois les crédits de l’IMF HOPE RDC et a tout remboursé à temps. Le prochain prêt lui servira d’acheter des épices pour satisfaire le besoin de ses clients et acheter 4 casiers de sucré à revendre dans le but d’accroitre le revenu. Georgette est mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 21 et 42 ans. Deux seulement d’entre eux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
The community bank "Persévérance Plus" is a group established in solidarity and composed of 26 members, including the leader, Georgette. These micro-entrepreneurs are determined to develop their businesses with the financial support of the lenders of the world via Kiva and the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC. Georgette K., aged 55, has been in the micro-enterprise world since 1982. She has committed nearly her entire life to small businesses, and she has acquired solid experience in it. Her current work involves selling spices and soft drinks. She is a loyal HOPE RDC client, who has obtained a loan three times and repaid them on time. The next loan will be used to buy spices to satisfy the needs of her customers and to buy four cases of soft drinks to sell with the goal of growing her revenues. Georgette is married and the mother of ten children, ranging from 21 to 42 years of age. Just two of them are attending school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spices and four cases of soft drinks to sell for boosting her profits

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 25 years old and married with a 2-year-old daughter. He runs a small retail business selling sugar, flour, and cooking fat. He's been in this business for three years and has two employees. He also earns some income from selling charcoal and running a kinyozi (barbershop). He says that his business is competitive. He requested this loan from Faulu for Kes. 20,000 to buy more sugar (Kes. 10,000) and cooking fat (Kes. 10,000). 

He describes himself as hardworking and says that since he became a member of Faulu he has received business training. In the future, he hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine B. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Cristine is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Cristine sells fish in the local community. Cristine has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $22 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Cristine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Cristine is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her small business. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to provide for the education of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her small business

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn D. is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 31 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rovelyn owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. Rovelyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Rovelyn joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rovelyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Wanyonyi

texts.en: V., 39 years old, is a single lady with one daughter, who is in school.  She has been running a cafe named Shalom Chips Poiny, where she sells mainly chips and beverages. She has two employees. She appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her save money. She hopes to succeed in her business, which is why she requested the Kes.40,000 loan to increase her stock. V.'s dream is to buy a car and own a house in the future.  She describes herself as a humble and hardworking lady.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Odina

texts.ru: Шеров Одина проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 57 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Двое сыновей в России на заработках. Сам Одина более 20 занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупно- рогатый скот. Одина закупает молодых бычков, откармливает и продает их по высокой цене. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Odina S. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 57 years old, married and has 6 children. His wife is a homemaker. Two of their sons are working in Russia. Odina has been involved in animal husbandry for over 20 years. He breeds cattle. Odina buys young bulls, raises them and sells them at a higher price. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando tiene 27 años de edad vive con su esposa hace mas de 7 años tiene un hijo de 5 años vive en casa de sus padres juntamente con su esposo es propietario de una mototaxi donde trabaja todos los dias  se dedica a esta actividad hace mas de 4 años, tiene buenas referencias personales experiencia crediticia, solicita dicho credito para mentenimiento de su movilidad se propone por contar con capacidad y sobre todo voluntad de pago.
texts.en:
Rolando is 27 years old and has been married to his wife for more than seven years. They have a five year old son and live in the home of his parents. Rolando and his wife own a motorcycle taxi that he has been driving for more than four years. He has excellent personal references and previous credit experience. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for maintenance to his vehicle. He intends to sign up for the training classes and make all of his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Oulèye

texts.fr: Madame Oulèye Sène veuve  et mère de 9 enfants s’active depuis 20 ans dans la vente de mil, dérivés du mil (araw, sankhal,  couscous….), bissap, pain de singe et…etc.  Elle  est très connue dans ce domaine et reçoit même des commandes  des Etats Unis et de l’Europe.  Née en 1953, Madame Oulèye S. est une dame de fer  très dynamique et compte sur son commerce pour aider ses enfants et régler les besoins quotidiens familiaux. Cependant, elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 FCFA  pour s’approvisionner dans les grands marchés afin de renouveler son stock pour mieux répondre à ses commandes très intéressantes.
texts.en:
Oulèye Sène, widow and mother of nine children, has for 20 years sold millet and derivatives of millet (araw, sankhal, couscous), hibiscus flowers, “monkey bread,” [the fruit of a baobab tree], and more. She is well known in this area and welcomes orders from the United States and Europe. Born in 1953, Oulèye S. is a dynamic iron lady and counts on her business to help her children and to provide for the family’s daily needs. She seeks a loan of 300,000 FCFA however, to stock up in major markets so that she can update her stock to meet her very interesting orders.

Translated from French by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on merchandise to fulfill customer orders.

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
La señora Flor de María D. S. es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como Colectora de Impuestos, es soltera habita en el barrio Ayapal.

La señora Flor de María D. S. solicito el crédito para cubrir gastos de su matrícula en su Universidad ya está estudiando contabilidad pública y para comprar materiales de estudios.
texts.en:
Flor de María D. S. works for the Chinandega town hall as a tax collecter. She is single and lives in the Ayapal neighborhood. She is requesting a loan to cover her university tuition and course materials, since she is enrolled and is studying public accounting.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay university tuition and for school supplies

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es: Saturnino tiene 45 años, casado y tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales 5 son mayores de edad y los 2 últimos aún en etapa escolar. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicado en un centro poblado de Ayacucho. A los 9 años, ayudaba a sus padres a vender frutas, pero cuando alcanzó la mayoría de edad emprendió un proyecto independiente, específicamente a la actividad agrícola; es por ello que en el presente y con una familia establecida, se dedica al cultivo y comercialización de Cacao y Frutas Cítricas, negocio al cual le va muy bien. A menudo recibe la ayuda su esposa e hijos, pero por lo general necesita de sus peones para realizar el trabajo de cosecha, en donde son comercializados en los centros de acopio de su comunidad. En el futuro piensa emprender el negocio en la venta de reses, para que así pueda extender su comercio y aumentar sus ingresos. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir de manera puntual sus respectivos pagos, además se siente satisfecho por los beneficios que recibe dentro de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la ampliación de su terreno de cultivo para que así pueda producir en grandes proporciones y de calidad total.
texts.en:
Saturnino is 45 years old, married, and has seven children. The five older ones are adults and the two younger ones attend school. They live together in their own house located in a neighbourhood of Ayacucho. When he was 9 years old, he used to help his parents sell fruit, but when he was older he learned a new trade and became a farmer. For that reason and because he now has a family, his job is growing and selling cocoa and citrus fruits. His business is doing well. His wife and children often help out, but generally he needs assistance from farm labourers to bring in the harvest. The produce is then sold in local warehouses. A future project for Saturnino is to learn about the sale of cattle so that he can expand his business and increase his income. This is his fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he promises to make his repayments puncutally. He is pleased with the benefits received via the community group. With this loan he will buy more farmland so he can produce larger quantities of quality fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more farmland

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is involved in a hog-raising business. She is 66 years old, married and has eight children. Her older children don’t live with them anymore. She said that she works hard to provide for the needs of her household. She has been raising hogs for more than a few years now and she is happy that it gives her income. She also opened a small store where she sells vinegar, sugar and other merchandise. She said that the store helps provide for some of their daily needs. She hopes to improve her family’s living condition and she does her best to achieve that. She applied for a loan of PHP15,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., where she is a member. If granted, she will use the loan to buy feed for her hogs and she will also purchase additional merchandise for her store.

loans.use: To purchase hogfeed and merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Sonia Margarita

texts.es: Sonia Margarita A. D. G. D. 56 años D. edad, es una madre soltera, quien vive junto a su hijo D. 9 años D. edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar, así mismo vive junto a su madre D. 77 años D. edad. Sonia posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, el cual es el único modo D. ganarse la vida, y con cuyas  ganancias deben salir adelante. La tienda esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, en Ilopango,  en el departamento D. San Salvador. Sonia es una mujer muy trabajadora quien desea poder salir adelante con su familia, así brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida sobre todo para su pequeño hijo. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio comprando productos alimenticios como sopas instantáneas, sodas, pan, café, y así mismo productos D. primera necesidad como detergentes, jabones y otros más. Este negocio es muy importante para el sostenimiento del hogar D. Sonia por lo que es D. mucha importancia poder mejorarlo con todo lo necesario para percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sonia Margarita A. D. G. is 56 years old and is a single mother. She lives together with her 9 year old son, who studies, and also with her 77 year old mother. Sonia has a store where she sells grocery items, which her is only way of earning a living and improving her situation. Her shop is located in her house, in Ilopango, in the San Salvador department. Sonia is a very hard-working woman who wants to improve her family's situation, and give them a better quality of life, especially to her little son. She is seeking a loan to stock her business with items such as instant soups, sodas, bread, coffee, and other necessary household goods such as detergents, soaps, etc. This business is very important in maintaining Sonia's home and for this reason she puts great importance on improving it in every way necessary to obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery items

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariana de 55 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, tiene tres hijos y su esposa vende pollos. El tiene una papelería (llamada en Ecuador “bazar”) con cuadernos, laminas, plumas, y todo tipo de papelería. Esta papelería ya la tiene hace mucho tiempo con la ayuda de su esposa ha podido incrementarla y salir de la crisis que estaba su familia.

Su esposa le ayuda en la papelería y también le ayuda en los gastos del hogar vendiendo pollos, trabajan desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm. Los cuadernos los venden a $ 1.20, plumas a $ 0.40, laminas a $ 0.15. Para poder incrementar la mercadería de su negocio el quiere comprar cuadernos, libros y plumas para la papelería.  

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y sabe que sus hijos han terminados sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mariana is 55 years old, lives in the suburban zone of Fortín de Guayaquil, and has 3 children. His wife sells chickens and he has a stationary store (in Ecuador called a "bazar") with notebooks, prints, pens, and every type of stationary. He's had the store for a long time and with the help of his wife has been able to expand the business and get out of the crisis that his family was in. His wife helps him in the stationary store and also helps with the household expenses by selling chickens. They work from 7:00 A.M. until 10:00 P.M. The notebooks sell for $1.20, pens for $.40, and the prints for $.15. To increase the merchandise the business has, he wants to buy notebooks, books, and pens for the store. In the future he wants to finish constructing his house and know that his children have completed their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy notebooks, books, and pens

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys, tiene 54 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos  y esposo Juan es profesor. Su actividad económica principal es vender comida, Su restaurante está ubicado en la calle Tarapaca del distrito de San Jerónimo del departamento del Cusco.  Gladys pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio” y ella es la presidenta del banco comunal. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplos papa, carne, fideos y muchas cosas más.   
        
Gladys se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gladis is 54 years old. She is married, has two children, and her husband, Juan, is a teacher. Her main business is selling food. Her restaurant is located on Tarapaca street, in the district of San Jerónimo, in the department of Cusco. Gladys belongs to the “Vírgen del Carmen de Huambutio” communal bank and she is the president. She needs the loan to buy more ingredients, such as potatoes, meat, noodles, and many other things. Gladys is grateful for the opportunity granted her through this program and she promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more ingredients, such as potatoes, meat, noodles, and many other things

loans.name: Paterna's Group

texts.en: Paterna B. is from the village of Lawis. She is 55 years old and married. Paterna is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. To make a living, Paterna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store business running a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Paterna has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2007, Paterna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paterna has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Paterna is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Paterna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy goods and other products

loans.name: Ebenezer #5 Group

texts.en:
Samuel P., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Ebenezer #5.

He is 32 years old, single and has one child who is 14 years old. He was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to financial difficulty.   

For 8 years, he has been selling phone cards on Broad Street in Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 17,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 77,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more phone cards. 

He describes himself as an easy-going man. His goal is to grow his business and continue his education.

loans.use: To buy more phone cards.

loans.name: Bunneang

texts.en:
Mrs. Bunneang K. (pictured here), is 46 years old and her husband, Mr. Ngoun Men, also 48 years old, live in a village along National Road Number two approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1985 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. Two of them have full time employment and other two children are in school. 

Bunneang sells roast beef, and sandwiches on baguettes from her home. Her husband is a taxi driver. She is requesting a loan in the amount of US $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Susan Gabriela

texts.es:
Susan pertenece al Banco Comunal Obreras hace 1 año y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro y la responsabilidad.
Susan es casada y tiene 2 hijas pequeñas, vive en la casa de sus suegros, Susan y su esposo tienen un taller de Metal Mecánica en un local alquilado, tiene además personal que trabaja con ellos, Susan se encarga de la administración del negocio, como cobranzas, compra de materiales.
Susan solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de fierros.
Los sueños de Susan son tener una casa propia y un local propio para el taller.
texts.en:
Susan joined the Communal Bank “Obreras” (Workers) a year ago and what she likes most about being a member is having the incentive to save and be responsible. She is married, has two young daughters, and lives at the house of her in-laws. Susan and her husband operate a metal workshop from a rented location. They also have a staff that works for them. Susan is in charge of managing the business. Her duties include collecting payments and buying materials.

Susan is requesting a loan for 2000 PEN to buy iron. She dreams of having her own home and acquiring her own space for her workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase iron

loans.name: Loun

texts.en:
Loun S. is a local farmer who raises pigs and rice to earn a living. She is 34 years of age and is a resident of Kompong Tom Province, where she lives with other family members. Loun S. has a life partner in her husband who is a professional teacher in the public secondary school. The couple has given birth to two kids, both of whom are enrolled in school.

In view of the coming farming season, Loun S. wants to buy a cultivating machine to provide a plowing service for other farmers. As she lacks money to buy one, Loun S. has decided to request a loan from Kiva. She will use these funds to buy a machine to begin providing her service.

loans.use: To buy a cultivating machine to provide a plowing service.

loans.name: Muhammed

texts.en: Muhammed  is a 42-year-old man married to a businesswoman with six children aged 22, 18, 16, 14, 11, and 9 years. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda with his family in his own house. He is a taxi driver meaning he is into the transport business. He has been in it for the last 18 years, having started as a conductor. He says it is a challenging business but says he sees himself progressing in the near future for better transport business deals. This is Muhammed‘s first loan from HOFOKAM and he intends to buy material like cement and iron sheets for construction of his commercial house intended for rentals.

loans.use: To buy cement and iron sheets for construction of his commercial house for rentals.

loans.name: Ria

texts.en:
Ria L. is from the village of Brgy. Villaros, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 30 years old. Ria is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Ria owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Ria is just starting this business.

In 2010, Ria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for cooked food for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20 year old single woman who lives with her parents. She is still attending university to get her certificate in accounting. And, at the same time, she runs a home business; she works as an accountant presenting accounting reports to members of her community and local companies. She is thankful for her business income; it allows her to cooperate with her family to satisfy the heavy expenses.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new laptop instead of her used one, to be able to provide faster reports. In the future, she plans to finish her education, get her certificate, and then develop her business by opening an accounting office.

loans.use: To purchase a new laptop.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom lives in Chichawatni which is a small city located in Punjab Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a 3 room brick house with her family in the area named Gulistan Colony. She moved here a few years ago. She is married with M. A. and has 4 children.  

Her son operates a donkey cart for a transportation business. He provides loading services to his customers and earns income. Her 3 daughters stay at home and help her in her domestic chores. Kalsoom couldn’t provide them an education due to poor financial conditions. She is a very supportive lady, always ready to help her family in difficult time. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s loading business. He will invest the loan by purchasing of a new donkey cart because the old cart has become worn and rotted in different areas.  The new cart will carry more load on it and provide better services to his customers. 

Kalsoom is confident that through this investment her son will keep continue his business and improves his earning. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.  

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kalsoom.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for a transport business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca B., from the village of Rizaluna Cordon, is 58 years old, married and has six grown children. To make a living, Francisca owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over four years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Francisca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 8000 PHP to be used for the same purpose. Francisca plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 57-year-old married man and a father of five children. He sells sweets and has 40 years of experience in this field. Since 1986 he has also owned a grocery store. Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary raw materials for making sweets in his factory. Ali’s sweets are famous in his region, and requested by customers. Ali is happy with what he has achieved and hopes to keep on.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for making sweets

loans.name: Rwentobo Tukore Women's Group

texts.en: Rwentobo is the group that B. Constance belongs to. She is 35 years old and married with one child. She has a salon business selling cosmetics, hair treatments, plaiting and so on. Constance is able to make 70,000/= as profit per week. Her salon is situated in Rwentobo Trading Centre and she serves the local people in her area. She has been operating her salon for over 10 years using personal savings from the retail shop that she owned before. She needs a loan to buy more cosmetics and stock more weaves for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and stock more weaves for sale

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El señor Jaime Sánchez Q. tiene 51 años y vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos en la ciudad de Bogotá. Posee un puesto estacionario en el cual vende galletas, confites, chocolates, cigarrillos, gaseosas y jugos; además, presta el servicio de llamadas a teléfonos celulares.  El negocio está ubicado en el barrio Chapinero cerca al teatro nacional Fanny Mickey, famoso por realizar las mejores funciones teatrales y musicales del país. El microempresario tiene 26 años de estar ubicado en el mismo sitio donde es ampliamente conocido por los empleados y transeúntes frecuentes del sector.  Es amigo de casi todos sus clientes con quienes  comenta las noticias del día mientras les vende un refresco o les regala un fósforo para que enciendan un cigarrillo. Cuando observa vehículos o personas sospechosas no duda en informarle a los vigilantes privados de los edificios cercanos para que estos le reporten a la policía. Su jornada laboral comienza a las 8 A.M. y termina a las 7 P.M. Su inclinación por el comercio la heredó de su padre quien fue lotero en un principio y luego tuvo un puesto similar al suyo en el mismo sector de Chapinero. Otros 6 hermanos del señor Jaime también son comerciantes. Este es el tercer crédito que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra al por mayor de cigarrillos, chocolates y galletas. De ésta forma obtiene importantes descuentos por pago en efectivo y volumen de compra. El promedio de ventas diarias es de $ 150.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 35%. En un futuro, el señor Jaime desea alquilar un local para seguir con su negocio y vender, además,  desayunos y almuerzos. Este proyecto le permitiría incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus condiciones de trabajo, porque a veces sufre por la inclemencia del tiempo como en la reciente temporada invernal. En todo caso, el microempresario se declara un hombre feliz y junto a su negocio hace parte del paisaje Bogotano.
texts.en:
Jaime Sánchez Q., age 51, lives with his wife and their four children in the city of Bogotá.  He has a stationary stand where he sells cookies, sweets, cigarettes, soft drinks, and juice.  He also provides cell phone call service.  The business is located in the Chapinero neighborhood close to the Fanny Mickey National Theater.  The theater is famous for putting on the best theatrical shows and musicals in the country.

This small businessman has been located in the same site for 26 years.  He is widely known by the workers and people who frequently pass by the area.  He is friends with almost all of his customers.  He chats with them about the day’s news while he sells them refreshments or gives them a match to light a cigarette.  When he sees a suspicious car or person, he does not hesitate to tell the private watchmen in the buildings that are nearby.  He does this so that the watchmen can report it to the police.

His work day starts at 8:00 a.m., and it ends at 7:00 p.m.  He got his propensity for business from his father.  In the beginning his father sold lottery tickets.  Later, his father had a stand similar to the Jaime’s stand in the same area of Chapinero.  Six siblings of Jaime are also merchants.

This is his third loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He plans to use the loan to buy wholesale cigarettes, chocolates, and cookies.  This way he gets important discounts for paying in cash and buying in volume.  His average daily sales are 150,000 COP; and his profit margin is 35%.

In the future Jaime wants to rent a place to continue his business and to sell breakfast and lunch.  This project will allow him to increase his sales and improve his work conditions.  He sometimes suffers due to inclement weather like the recent winter season.

In any case, this small businessman says that he is a happy man.  Together with his business, he is part of the landscape in Bogota.

loans.use: To buy wholesale cigarettes, chocolates, and cookies

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
Elvis vive en alquiler en la zona de Villa Dolores, de la ciudad de  El Alto, tiene dos hijos, el señor es chofer taxista, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantienen; en anterior crédito realizó el mantenimiento de su movilidad. Ahora necesita otro crédito para  comprar un motor a medio uso y transformar su movilidad de gasolina a gas licuado, para ahorrar el costo de combustible. El señor se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Elvis lives in a rented space in the community of Villa Dolores in the city of El Alto. He has two children and he works as a taxi driver. He is able to support his children with his earnings. The previous loan was use to carry out maintenance repairs to his car. Currently he requires a new loan to purchase a new engine and to convert his car from using gasoline to propane, in order to save on fuel expenses. He is very happy with the loans that he has received. 

His personal history qualifies him to access a new loan and he is considered to be a good client.

loans.use: To purchase an engine for his car.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok N. is a 50-year-old woman from Phnom Penh City.  She works at a factory as a worker.  She has been in her job since 2002 and has a formal salary. She has no life partner because she has been divorced from her husband for many years.   Mrs. Sok N. has one child who works as a security guard in the factory.  

Mrs. Sok N. is seeking a loan to buy a cow to rent out to farmers to earn additional income. The cow can also be used for breeding purposes so she can raise its offsprings.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren A. is 44 years old and lives in Sevkar village, Ijevan area. He is married and has three children: two sons and a daughter. Suren works as a bus driver and is also busy in animal husbandry. He says it is very hard work. His family helps him to raise cows and calves to support their family.
This is Suren’s sixth loan from Nor Horizon and now he is asking for $1800 to buy a lot of fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy a lot of fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Eulalia; La socia tiene 41 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 3 hijos (22,15,9); la socia trabaja realizando manualidades en el barrio de magisterio, el pertenece a  una casa taller en la cual realizan trabajos en base a tejidos en palitos y crochet, la socia también realiza trabajos en macramé, específicamente todo tipo de adornos y carteras. La socia desea comprar materiales y vender sus trabajos, ella desea a futuro independizarse y mostrar sus trabajos en ferias y que sus ingresos sean mayores para seguir apoyando a su familia. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar trabajos en macramé y tejidos.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Patrón San Sebastian", which is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

The member is Eulalia, who is 41 years old and married with 3 children, who are 9, 15, and 22 years old.  She works making handcrafts in the Magisterio neighborhood.  She belongs to a workshop in which she makes items that are knitted on small sticks or crocheted.  She also does macramé work, specifically all kinds of decorations and bags.  She wants to buy materials and sell her items.  She wants to become independent in the future and show her items in fairs, and she wants her income to increase in order to continue supporting the family.  She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of materials to make macramé and knitted items.

She is happy with the loan granted to her and she is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make macramé and knitted items.

loans.name: Lidia Maritza

texts.es: La señora Lidia Maritza García T. se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas en el centro comercial polvos azules tiene su negocio desde mayo del dos mil diez y de esa forma genera ingresos para cubrir sus gastos personales ,tiene un hijo de veintidós años al cual ayuda es sus estudios universitarios su sueño a futuro es hacer crecer mas sus negocio para poder costear los estudios de su hijo y además le gustaría comprarse una casa , la solicitante invertirá el dinero en comprar mercadería por cambio de estación como son chompas pantalones y otros tiene buenas referencias personales es por ello que se propone el crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Lidia Maritza García T. sells women’s clothing in the Polvos Azules (Blue Powders) Shopping Center.  She has had her business since May 2010 and, through it, has generated income to cover her personal expenses.  She has a 22 year old son whom she helps and who studies at university. 

Her dream is to make her business grow in order to be able to pay for her son’s university fees.  In addition, she would like to buy a house. She will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise for the change of season such as sweaters and pants.  She has good personal references, and that’s why she has applied for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for the changing season

loans.name: Alejandra Cristina

texts.es: Alejandra Cristina tiene 31 años, por lo que tiene 3 hijos que están a su cargo. La señora se dedica a una pulpería, principalmente golosinas, pan, detergentes, refrescos naturales, galletas entre otros productos. Este es el primer financiamiento que realiza, pues siempre está pensando en mejorar los ingresos de su familia. Pues los inicio con ahorros propios, para comenzar su actividad. Con este crédito comprara golosinas, refrescos, galletas y detergentes. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda variada que en donde ofrezca muchas cosas.
texts.en: Alejandra Cristina is 31 years old and has three children. She owns a small grocery store, selling candy, bread, laundry detergent, soda, and cookies, among other things. She started her business with her own savings. Alejandra Cristina has been looking for a way to increase her family's income. This is her first loan, and she will use it to buy candy, soda, cookies, and laundry detergent. Her goal is to stock a greater variety of products in her store.

loans.use: To purchase candy, soda, cookies, and laundry detergent.

loans.name: Amado

texts.es: Don Amado I., es una persona casada, tiene 34 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos, 2 de los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de artículos de consumo diario, como también a la elaboración de canastas de plástico, lleva 15 años de tener una tienda, inició vendiendo cosméticos, quiere ver su tienda bien surtido y con muchos clientes. Decide acudir a ASDIR para solicitar un préstamos que servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo para la tienda, le servirá para comprar mas mercadería: azucar, sopas instántaneas, arroz, frijol, incaparina, jabón y entre otros productos mas. Espera mejorar su negocio y su condición de vida.
texts.en: Amado I. is married, 34 and never had the opportunity to study.  He now has 5 children, 2 of which are students.  He works selling basic goods  and has run his own store for 15 years; he and also makes plastic baskets.  Amado started by selling cosmetics, and wants to continue to grow his business to see sales and his client base increase. He seeks a loan with ASDIR to buy inventory of basic foodstuffs such as: sugar, soup mixes, rice, beans, soap and other products. Amado looks forward to improving his business and quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his store

loans.name: Claribel

texts.es:
La señora Claribel Gómez Pérez, vive en el barrio de san fráncico, ella  es casada con el señor Gabriel Ángel Sánchez Jiménez, con quien procreo  tres hijos: Gabriela Lizbeth de quince años, Brianda Itzel  de de siete años y las mas pequeña es kely claribel de once meses de edad.

    Ella se dedica a la venta de cosmético  de la marca  avon, en donde lleva seis meses,  y nos cometa que  se inspiro en esta actividad para apoyar asu esposo con los ingresos de su hogar y así tener como sacar adelante a su pequeña  familia.


    Cometa que para dedicarse a este pequeño negocio la animo a una vecina quien tambien se dedica a  distribuir  los productos de avon,   y la invito  que  se asocien  y trabajen juntas así tener como obener sus propio dinero.

  Lo que mas desea es que con esta actividad lo tener sus propios a  horros para que  con ello tenga su  propio negocio y  así  apoyar a sus hijos que están estudiando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claribel Gómez Pérez lives in the San Francisco neighborhood.  She’s married to Mr. Gabriel Ángel Sánchez Jiménez with whom she had three children: Gabriela Lizbeth, 15, Brianda Itzel, 7 and the youngest, Kely Claribel, 11 months.

She has been selling Avon brand cosmetics for the last six months and she comments to us that she was inspired to go into this business in order to help her husband meet household expenses and be able to raise their small family.

She comments that a neighbor who also sells Avon products encouraged her to go into this small business.  She invited her to be her partner and to work together to have a way to earn their own money.

What she’d like to accomplish the most with this activity is to have her own savings to set up a business of her own and support her children who are studying.

loans.use: to buy Avon brand cosmetics to resell in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel

texts.es:
Rosa es una señora de 45 años de edad, es viuda y vive con sus 3 hijos en casa propia que esta ubicada en el caserío El Papayo del Algarrobo en el distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. Rosa asume hoy en día todos los gastos de l hogar y es por eso que es una mujer muy trabajadora.

La actividad que ella desarrolla es la agricultura. Cuenta con terreno agrícola en el que actualmente tiene limón y mango en producción así como maíz.  Además del cultivo mencionado, Rosa se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y de pavos que luego comercializa en el mercado local. Rosa recibe el apoyo de uno de sus hijos que trabaja en labores agrícolas también. Ambos se apoyan en las actividades que realizan y existe una buena relación familiar. 

Rosa solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de limón y en la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus ovinos y pavos para  así poderlos vender a un mejor precio y seguir creciendo en su actividad. 
Rosa tiene muchos deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida y este préstamo le permitirá aumentar sus ventas, para hacerlo.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 45 years old, a widow, and she lives with her 3 children in a house of their own. It is located in the community of El Papayo del Agarrobo in the district of Tambogrande, Piura. Rosa assumes responsibility of all of the household expenses which is why she is a very hardworking woman.

Her business activity is agriculture. She has a plot of farm land where she cultivates lemons, mangoes, and corn. In addition to the mentioned cultivations, Rosa also raises sheep and poultry. She resells them at a local market. Rosa receives support by one of her children who also works in agriculture. They help each other in their activities and they enjoy a good family relationship.

Rosa requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1200 nuevos soles which will be used to purchase fertilizers for her lemon plantation. She will also purchase balanced feed to raise her sheep and poultry to be able to sell them at a better price and to keep developing her business. Rosa has many dreams of improving their life. This loan will help her increase her sales and to reach her goal.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her lemon plantation.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
