Mantienen cosméticos y ropa de venta en la casa también, un día a la semana viaja a los departamentos para ofrecer sus productos, en donde horas muy temprana toma el bus, para poder regresar el mismo día a la capital. Sus planes es invertir en vitrinas en donde pueda exhibir su cosmético y lograr la captación de clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
Tamara is a young woman who is 21 years of age. She lives with her mother who has always supported her. Like many women, she is a single mother of two children and works hard so that they do not lack anything to eat. Tamara was in the business of selling food, but her sales have fallen in the past several months. She decided to sell clothing and cosmetics. Tamara started traveling to other departments to find new customers. She achieved her goal and was able to obtain good sales.

Tamara also maintains an inventory of cosmetics and clothing in her home. One day a week, she travels to other departments to offer her products. In the early hours, she gets on a bus and returns the same day to her home in the capital. Her plan is to invest in display cabinets so that she can exhibit her cosmetics and attract new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase display cases, cosmetics, and clothing

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo C. is from the village of Brgy. Curifang, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 53 years old, married, and has 5 adult-aged children. Reynaldo owns and operates a business providing recycling services. The main source of income for the business comes from hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Reynaldo has been involved in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Reynaldo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynaldo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase used bottles and newspapers to sell. Reynaldo is requesting a new loan, his fourth, of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional waste and junk material to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional waste and junk material to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.es: Elma tiene 59 años, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive con sus hijos pero son ya mayores de edad, por lo cual debe velar por si misma. A lo largo de los años se ha dedicado a diferentes oficios para poder sacar adelante a su familia, actualmente ya sin responsabilidades, se dedica a trabajos temporales y sin mucho esfuerzo, en verano vendía refrescos como la chicha morada y en invierno vende café, siendo estas bebidas ofrecidas en el exterior de su casa o de manera ambulante. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo porque genera sus propios ingresos y de manera cómoda y tranquila, esperando en un futuro mejorar su negocio poniendo un snack, pero sabe que le falta presupuesto, pero espera que sus hijos puedan ayudarla a concretar ese sueño. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere comprar vasos descartables que utilizará para la venta de café, algunos muebles para brindar mayor comodidad a su clientela.
texts.en:
Elma, 59, is a very hardworking woman who lives with her children, but they are now adults so she is now responsible only for herself. Over the years she has had different occupations so that she could help her family to get ahead. Now, without family responsibilities, she works part-time and does not have to work as hard. In the summer she sells drinks such as chicha morada (a corn-based beverage), and in the winter she sells coffee. She sells these drinks from the outside of her house and also on the street. She likes this work very much because she can generate her own income in a manner that is calm and tranquil. In the future she hopes to improve her business by adding snacks, but she knows that she lacks the resources to do so. She hopes that her children can help her to make this happen. This is her first loan with MFP, and she pledges to be very punctual with all of her payments. With the loan that she requests, she wants to buy disposable cups that she will use to sell coffee, and some furniture to provide greater comfort for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy disposable cups and furniture to provide better comfort for her customers

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
On top of being a vibrant entrepreneur, Joyce is married to a fire service personnel member and together they have three kids from age 6-11 years. Currently, all her kids are pursuing education at primary and junior high school levels. It is one of Joyce’s dreams to support her kids through university education.

Joyce has been selling groceries like candies, evaporated milk, canned foods, rice, cooking oil, toiletries, etc. for the past three years. Petty trading like sale of groceries is widespread in Ghana because it is easy to start. It usually begins with table-top selling and then grows to become a kiosk and eventually becomes a supermarket. Joyce plans to invest the loan in purchase of groceries in bulk to meet the demand.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy assorted clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Flordemie

texts.en:
Flordemie D. is from the village of Tigbao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 26 years old, married and has 2 children. To make a living, Flordemie owns & operates a general store, selling daily food in the local community. Flordemie has been engaged in her business for 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities. At present, Flordemie has joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

Flordemie is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This is the 1st loan taken out by Flordemie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 
      

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 
       
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy products.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen K. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut paste at the market and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell. Hellen is 36 years old and is married, with a husband who is a business man. She has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

loans.use: To stock tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is a resident of Multan, which is the famous city of Pakistan for its sweetmeat and warm weather. She is 45 years old and financially supports her family by doing embroidery works. She lives in a three room brick house with her family. She has been living in it for the last ten years. Her husband is a loader by trade. He uses his donkey cart to load different items and to deliver it to designated places.

She is the mother of two daughters and a son. Her son also helps her in her embroidery business, while her daughters are too young to attend to school. He learned the art of embroidery from her and now he not only helps her in completing the larger orders on time, but also helps her to deliver the dresses to the concerned persons.

Zarina has applied for a loan from Asasah for her embroidery business With the loan amount she will expand her business by buying embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread and clothes in bulk.

This is the first time she has applied for a loan from any MFI. She hopes that her decision will be fruitful for her business.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery materials in bulk.

loans.name: Nouhou

texts.fr: nouhou exerce comme activités génératrices de revenu le commerce de portables et des accessoires de téléphones portables. il s'approvisionne à lomé, plus précisément au quartier commercial de dékon où ce commerce est très développé. il fait ce commerce depuis 2004 et sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. il a besoin de s'approvisionner en nouvelles gammes de téléphones portables de même que les accessoires, il sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat d'une vingtaine de nouveaux portables, de même qu'une variété d'accessoires de téléphones portables.
texts.en:
Nouhou makes his living selling mobile telephones and accessories. He sources his goods from the business quarter of Dékon in Lomé, where this type of business is very developed. He has been involved in this industry since 2004 and he has a large and varied customer base. He needs to offer a larger range of mobile telephones and accessories, and so is seekieng a loan from WAGES in order to purchase around 20 new phones as well as a variety of accessories.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of mobile telephones and accessories

loans.name: Hazel Grace

texts.en: Hazel Grace G. is from the village of Pagahan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 21 years old and is single. Hazel Grace owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling firewood in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Hazel Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more firewood to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Hazel Grace plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Isabel Cristina G. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 43 años quien se dedica al comercio de nacatamales, comida típica a base de cerdo, masa, especies, papa, arroz etc. que se comercializa por lo general los fines de semana. Ella en un principio destazaba pero como vio que era mucho esfuerzo para ella decidió mejor comprar la carne para realizar dicho producto.

G. comercializa sus nacatamales en Tipitapa ya que hay mayor concurrencia y sueña en poner una pequeña venta. Ella  tiene cinco hijos de los cuales uno de ellos está a su cargo y es quien le ayuda en sus tiempos libre en el negocio.
texts.en:
Isabel Cristina is a hardworking, dedicated and entrepreneurial woman. She is 43 years old and sells "nacatamales", a local food made with pork, dough, spices, potatoes, rice and others (similar to a tamale). She normally sells them on weekends. At first she butchered the meat but it took a lot of effort si she decided to purchase it instead to prepare the product. Isabel sells her "nacatamales" in Tipitaba since there is more competition. She dreams of opening a small shop. She has five children. One of them is under her care and helps her with the business in his free time.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: "Nacatamales" (salty food similar to a tamale) production

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma J. is from the village of Brgy. Villaros, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 34 years old. Gemma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma operates a motorcycle transport business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle transport services. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Gemma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the third loan taken out by Gemma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice Nakitto is 18 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is married and has no children. Alice has a garment shop business which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Alice hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Alice hopes to expand her business. Alice is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning how to save.

loans.use: clothes

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es: Doña Maria Sapón, es una señora casada,tiene 52 años, tiene 8 hijos, 1 varon y 7 mujeres, se dedica a la artesanía, enmadejado de hilo asimismo se dedica a la venta y reparación de maquinas de costura,con estos trabajos ha logrado sostener a su familia, ya que tien el ingreso mensual que necesita para sufragar las gastos familiares, con el proposito de ampliar su capital, ha decidido solicitar un préstamo y asi poder comprar mas materia prima enb este caso hilo para seguir produciendo mas, espera que por medio de dicho préstamo logre trabajar mas y a la vez verder mas y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Sapón, 52, is married and has 8 children, one boy and 7 girls.  She is a weaver and also repairs and sells sewing machines.  These jobs have made it possible for her to support her family since they produce monthly income she needs to meet family expenses.

To expand her capital she decided to request a loan to buy more raw materials, in this case thread, to continue producing more.  She hopes the loan will allow her to work more leading to more sales and obtaining increased income.

loans.use: To buy thread.

loans.name: Bruno

texts.es:
Bruno  solicito 1000 $us,  trabaja como chofer asalariado en transporte urbano en la ciudad de El Alto;  es soltero y vive en la zona Estrellas de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo empleara en la construcción de un muro perimetral en un terreno que es de su propiedad. Es   el primer  crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Bruno requested $1000 USD.  He works as a driver employed in urban transport in the city of El Alto.  He is single and lives in the neighborhood Estrellas in El Alto.

He will use the loan to construct a perimeter wall on land that he owns.  This is his first loan with IMPRO as well as with Kiva.

loans.use: To build a wall on land that he owns.

loans.name: Beatrice Jemutai

texts.en:
Beatrice Jemutai K. is a hardworking lady of 42, married to Albert Koech who is a business man, and together they have three children aged 19, 15 and 10. She has been farming for about four years and she earns a monthly income of Kshs.15,000.

She learned about KADET LTD through a friend and she has no history with any other MFI. She is applying  for her third loan of Kshs. 25,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy stock of poultry feeds and more poultry so that she may have more eggs to sell to her customers. She plans to use the profits from the expanded business to start pig farming which is also very marketable in the area.

Beatrice hopes to grow her business, become the leading local investor, and to see her children realize their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To buy stock of poultry feeds and poultry.

loans.name: Sena Veronique

texts.fr: Véronique est mariée et a 4 enfants en charge. Elle a déjà remboursé plusieurs crédits a travers cette activité. En effet, elle fait la vente de tissus et compte  2 ans d’expérience.   Elle achète ses tissus au grand marché de Lomé et revend ensuite au marché local d’adakpamé.  Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter de nouveaux lots de tissus.
texts.en:
Véronique is married and has four children to support. 

Through her business activity, she has already repaid several loans. She has two years' experience selling fabrics.  She buys her fabrics at the big market in Lomé and then resells them at the local Adakpamé market. 

Véronique is requesting a loan to buy new bolts of fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Señor De Antahuaylla Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SEÑOR DE ANTAHUAYLLA”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, provincia de Quispicanchis, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Leandra Matilde; La socia tiene 51 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos, y la socia se dedica a la a y venta de leche y yogurt desde el año 2004, la socia elabora yogurt, queso y vende leche ella tiene sus vaquitas que le dan leche y con ella derivados, la socia trabaja repartiendo leche fresca diaria  las vecinas y a las clientas, la socia también reparte yogur y de vez en cuando hace queso y quesillo para consumo y venta si alguna de sus clientas le hace pedido. La soca solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de envases para la leche y para el yogurt.

La socia valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Leandra Matilde is a member of the “SEÑOR DE ANTAHUAYLLA” community bank which is located in Andahuaylillas district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Leandra Matilde is 51 years old.  She is married and has 2 children.  Leandra Matilde's business is selling milk and yoghurt.  She has been in this business since 2004.  She makes yoghurt and cheese and sells milk.  She has her own cows who provide her with milk and, through this milk, other dairy products.  She delivers fresh milk daily to her neighbors and customers.  She also delivers yoghurt and sometimes makes cheese and 'quesillo' (a soft cheese) for consumption and sale if any of her customers make an order.  She is requesting this loan to buy containers for her milk and yoghurt.

Leandra Matilde appreciates the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To invest in buying containers for her milk and yoghurt

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi E. sells charcoal at Abura. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. Esi has been selling charcoal for ten years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of charcoal for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim T., 26 years old, owns a small shop in Siem Reap where she sells merchandise for people who come to buy things in the market. She typically makes around $3 profit each day to meet her family needs. Yim T. has been married for a few years, but she has only one baby. 

She has a life partner in her husband, who is a fisherman in and around the Tunle Sap River, which is the best place to catch fish. After they have finished fishing, he takes the fish to sell at the local fish market. Unfortunately, her existing boat has broken down during the fishing process. Because of this, Yim T. has decided to apply for a Kiva loan for supporting her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase a new boat to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Kattia

texts.es:
Kattia es socia del Banco comunal Mornita Huamanga, tiene 20 años y es soltera. Se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas. Kattia vende ropa para damas y atiende pedidos, que le hacen sus amigas y familiares, aprendió de este negocio de su madrina, que se dedica también a la venta de ropa. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías.
Kattia ingresó a Finca Perú, por la invitación de una amiga y está 3 ciclos le gusta por el apoyo que le dieron para comenzar a trabajar y sobre todo pudo ahorrar y con eso se compró su computadora, ahora ahorrará para obtener su titulo profesional en computación e informática. Su sueño es poder abrir una tienda de ropas propia
texts.en:
Kattia is a member of the Communal Bank “Mornita Huamanga”. She is 20 years old and single. Kattia sells women’s clothing and accepts orders from her friends and relatives. She learned this business from her godmother, who also sells clothes to earn a living. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of merchandise.

Kattia joined FINCA Peru after being invited by a friend. She has participated in three loan cycles and has enjoyed the support that was given to her so that she could begin working. Above all, she was able to accumulate some savings to purchase a computer. Now she is saving so that she can earn a degree in Computer Science and Information Systems. Her dream is to open her own clothing store.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
Mariatu K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mariatu was born in Waterloo,a small town near Freetown. She is married to a gardener and the couple has three children who are attending primary school. For twenty-three years now, Mariatu has been selling palm-oil, pepper, garden eggs (similar to eggplant), etc. 

This is the first loan that Mariatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Mariatu will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to expand her business. She will buy palm-oil, pepper, garden eggs and more at wholesale prices to add to her current stock. 

(Also included in the left of the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh, handing over the loan to the borrowers).

loans.use: To buy palm-oil, pepper, garden eggs(eggplant), etc. at wholesale prices

loans.name: Simon

texts.es: El señor Simón, con el dinero del préstamo construirá un muro de contención al vecino ya que en época de lluvias sufre de filtraciones que debilitan la estructura de su vivienda, su esposa es costurera, su principal fuente de ingreso es de albañil en construcciones privadas; vive en casa propia  ubicada en la zona San Juan Alto Tembladerani de La Paz. Está casado y tiene 8 hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Simon is married and has eight children. They live in their own house located in the area of San Juan Alto. His wife is a seamstress. His income comes from plumbing jobs in private constructions.

Mr. Simon will utilize the money from the loan to build a retaining wall by his neighbor’s property because during the raining season there is leakage that weakens the structure of his home.

loans.use: to build a retaining wall in his house.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 45 years old, married, and has 3 children, aged 12, 11 and 3.  She has a rice farming business which has been running for 6 years. She sells her harvest to the market. Teresita also makes "halo-halo" (a shaved ice mixed with milk and fruits) which she sells to her neighborhood.

Teresita's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Loma Buenavista Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Loma Buenavista, los podemos encontrar en la comunidad de Rosa del Clavario, una comunidad chica y tambien alejada, se encuentra en las faldas de un cerro grande y con una vista hermosa para toda la comunidad. Las 9 personas que integran el grupo viven cerca uno del otro son vecinos y se conocen desde hace muchos años, una integrante del grupo nos cuenta su historia sobre el credito que pidio, ella se llama Maria Cristina y nos platica lo siguiente: *Tengo una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, no vendo mucho porqué la luz no me llega al negocio y cuando empieza a obscuerecer ya tengo que cerrar porque no se ve nada, tambien quiero meter una vitrina para comprar carnes frias como, jamon, salchichas, crema y queso, pero no lo puedo hacer porque no tengo luz, el prestamo me va ayudar mucho porque tendria mas ingresos y en lugar de bajar en mi negocio voy a subir, yo espero que la tienda siga adelante y tengamos mas de lo que tenemos ahora, por ahora no tenemos muchas ganancias pero pienso ir metiendo mas mercancia para vender mucho mejor, tengo una niña pequeña todavia no va a la escuela, tengo 2 años de casada y vivo en casa de mi suegra, mi esposo trabaja como empleado en la cabecera del municipio.*
Ella y los demás integrantes del grupo dan las gracias a FRAC y KIVA por brindarles su confianza y apoyo.
texts.en:
This group is called Loma Buenavista and it is located in Rosa del Clavario community.  This is a small, remote community which is located on the side of a large hill which affords a beautiful view over the whole community.

The nine members of this group live near one another.  They are neighbors and have known each other for many years.  One of the members of the group tells us her story about the loan that she has requested.  The lady's name is Maria Cristina and she tells us the following: "I own a small grocery store.  I don't sell much because my business doesn't have electricity and so when it starts to get dark I have to close because you can't see anything.  I would like to install a display case so that I can buy cold cuts such as ham and sausages, and also cream and cheese, but I can't because I don't have any electricity.  This loan will help me a lot because I will make more income and instead of going backwards in my business, I will move forwards.  I hope to move ahead with my store and I hope that we will earn more than we do right now.  Right now we don't make much profit but I am planning to gradually add more merchandise so that I can make better sales.  I have a young daughter who doesn't go to school yet.  I have been married for 2 years and I live in my mother-in-law's home.  My husband is an office worker in the town's administrative center".

Maria Cristina and the other members of her group would like to thank FRAC and KIVA for placing their trust in them and supporting them.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store such as soft drinks, cookies and cold cuts

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary, reside en San Miguel se dedica a la venta de tortillas, pan dulce y elabora bolsos, vive con su madre y un sobrino, ella comercializa tortillas, vende pan y también elabora bolsos artesanales, todo para ayudar a su madre y poder mantener el hogar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, pan dulce y materia prima para la elaboración de bolsos como hilo, ciper, broches y más, esta compra le ayudara a tener mercadería en abundancia para confeccionar pedidos y así tener mayor estabilidad con el negocio.
Ella espera que al tener estos tres productos a la venta, disminuya el riesgo por la baja rentabilidad de alguno, y garantiza trabajo para largo plazo.
texts.en:
Mary lives in San Miguel and works selling tortillas [flatbreads], pastries and handmade bags.  She lives with her mother and a nephew and works to help them and maintain the home.

She is currently seeking a loan for the purchase of corn, wood, fresh bread and raw materials for making handbags such as thread, zippers, pins etc.  This purchase would allow her to have plenty of merchandise to complete sales orders and make her business more stable.

She hopes that having these 3 items for sale [tortillas, pastries and bags],will reduce the risk of low sales and guarantee work in the long term.

loans.use: to purchase corn, wood, sweet bread, thread, zippers, brooches and more.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es: El Sr.  Leandro tiene 53 años de edad, es casado con la Sra. Neida, tiene cuatro hijos y todos mayores de edad e independientes, vive por la zona de la Mutualista hace 20 años que se vino de Camiri, en ese entonces empezó su negocio con una venta chiquitita ahí mismo donde vive; luego fue creciendo a lo que ahora es una tienda mucho mas completa y surtida. El crédito que se le dio al señor es para la reparación de su vehículo que es con el cual va y compra su mercadería. El Sr. quedo muy entusiasmado con la rapidez con la que se le otorgo el crédito, es una persona buena y trabajadora, agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Leandro is 53 years old and married to Neida.  They have four children who are all grown up and live independently.  Leandro lives in the Mutualista zone.  He came to the city from Camiri 20 years ago.  He started his business from a very small sales location in his home.  His business gradually grew into what it is now: a much bigger and better stocked store.

The loan that Leandro has been given will be used to repair the vehicle which he uses to go and buy his merchandise.  Leandro was delighted by the speed with which he was granted his loan.  He is a good, hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have provided.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 17 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Sharon has a clothing sales business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Sharon has requested a loan of 450,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Sharon hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Sharon is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her job skills such as tailoring.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 57 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chompas, ella vende chompas en forma independiente y lo lleva al distrito de Apurímac y también se dedica a la venta de golosinas, ella vende en la puerta de colegio de la ciudad de Cusco, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m,y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de chompas y venta de golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lana para hacer las chompas y golosinas como caramelos, chupetes y galletas.
                                                         
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the “YAHUAR MAQUI” Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

The borrower is 57 years old. She is a widow and has 7 children. She alternates her daily chores with her sweaters selling activity. She works independently, taking her sweaters to the Apurímac district. On top of this she also sells snacks at the gates of a school in Cusco. She works form 7 am to 32 pm, and thanks to these activities she succeeded in providing for her children. She would like to increase and improve her sweaters and snack selling activities. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy wool to knit the sweaters and snacks such as candy, lollipops and cookies.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayments of her dues.

loans.use: To buy wool and snacks such as candy, lollipops and cookies.

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana is 25 years old and is a married woman with a 1-year-old child. Her husband works as a farmer and as a driver.

Jeana is a farmer. She helps her husband till their land, which is located in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She said they have been growing rice for 5 years. They also own a carabao (water buffalo) that helps in tilling their land.

This loan will be used to pay for labor and to purchase fertilizers. In the future, Jeana hopes to have a better life.

loans.use: pay for labor and purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a charcoal and firewood selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business, as during rainy season the availability of charcoal is lower than the demand. She dreams of becoming the leading supplier of charcoal in the future.

With the 20,000 Kshs loan, she plans to purchase sacks of charcoal and bundles of firewood for sale. Mwanamisi joined Yehu because of its favorable loaning procedures.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel Antonio es un señor de 40 años de edad quien vive con su esposa y dos hijos uno de diez y el otro de once años de edad, en una pequeña comunidad llamada la Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la pina; siendo estas  comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales. Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos anos generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.
El se dedica a la agricultura. El su producto a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad.
Actualmente Miguel está solicitando un microcrédito de₡460.000 (cuatrocientos sesenta mil colones), para la siembra de yuca uno de los mas deliciosos tubérculos en el país. 
Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa crezca más, para poder atender a mas clientes y ofrecerles mejores productos a la hora de la cosecha. Todo esto ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
 Miguel es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con el espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Miguel Antonio is a 40-year-old gentleman who lives with his wife and two children, ages 10 and 11.  They reside in a small community called Trinchera de Pital, which is located in Alajuela Province.  The main business activities in the area are livestock breeding and agriculture, particularly pineapple cultivation.  Most of the products are sold primarily to international markets.  For this reason, community development has increased in recent years as the increased growth in the demand for goods and services has resulted in more job opportunities.  

Miguel is a farmer.  His neighbors in the community are satisfied with the quality of his products.  At the moment, Miguel is requesting a microloan of 460,000 CRC for growing cassava, one of the most delicious tubers that are produced in Costa Rica.  With this investment, he hopes that his micro-enterprise will grow so that he can serve more customers and offer better products at harvest time.  All of these factors will help improve his living conditions.  

Miguel is a member of the Successful Women’s Communal Credit Enterprise of Trinchera de Pital, one of the 110 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica.  This will be his second loan and he hopes to continue growing on a personal and financial level.  In addition, Miguel is an active participant in his local credit organization.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for growing cassava.

loans.name: Time

texts.en:
Time is a widowed woman with four children, all of whom are adults. She lives in a house that she owns. It has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a shoes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is theft because of insecurity in her area of operation. She dreams of selling more shoes in the future.

With the KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of shoes to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 46 years old and married. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines together with her spouse and three dependents. Farming is the commoner's means of income which she belongs too. She has been weeding, plowing and planting for the past four years of her life 'til the present time but is enjoying the job, despite its difficulties. Viriginia normally receives PHP 8,000 a month from all sources of income.

Virginia currently joined GDMPC  to have access to financial services offered by the organization and to be socially recognized. She is known for good credibility as per communal background. Her first loan application of PHP 5,000 has been approved. The purpose of borrowing is to buy insecticides/pesticides for the farm to prevent hazardous creatures that could hinder the plants' growth. Virginia is hopeful to obtain adequate income from this additional investment and gets the chance of attaining her plan of growing productive crops so she can earn more.

loans.use: To buy insecticides/pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is a married woman from the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She is engaged in farming. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Jenalyn works hard to support her husband in providing for their family and sending their children to school.

Jenalyn has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes that this loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Meah

texts.en:
Meach (in the photo) is 48 years old, and her husband, Thay, is 60 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have five children: four sons and one daughter. Two of the children are garment workers, one has full-time employment, one is a weaver and another one attends school. 

Meach and her husband sell nets and finished silk and cotton products. They buy them from the weavers in the village and transport them to sell in other provinces away from their house.  

The couple faces some problems and spends lots of money for traveling costs because they have to transport nets and silk and cotton products and a bicycle via taxi. When they arrive in the provinces, they use the bicycle to carry nets and silk and cotton products for sale. 

Facing this, Meach is asking for her first loan of $1,000 in order to buy a motorbike. She will use the motorbike to carry nets and silk and cotton products to sell in provinces directly, not via taxi anymore.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to carry nets and finished silk and cotton products for sale.

loans.name: 0407012-Thành Xuân -Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hóa Group

texts.en:
Duyên is 47 years old and is married with 4 children. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 0407012 Thành Xuân Hoằng Trường solidarity group. With her 3 dependents, she lives and works in Hoằng Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Mrs. Duyên operates a food stall selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that affects her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase tools to catch fish.

In 2010, Duyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and has since successfully repaid 2 loans from them. With her business profit, Duyên hopes for her business to do well, to buy more land, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase tools to catch fish

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 37 years old and married. She has three children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 19 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Erlinda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Leonora has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Leonora has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Leonora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Barir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 55 years old, married, and has five children.

Barir has been the owner of a painting and calligraphy shop since 1990. He has more than 20 years of experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a loan of $3000 in order to purchase a billboard printing machine. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a billboard printing machine.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is married with five healthy adult-aged children. She is 45 years of age and resides at San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Francisca is in agriculture, planting and harvesting rice to earn a living. Rice nowadays will not grow well without fertilizer and pesticides that are needed to kill the insects that will harm the rice. She has been in this business for about ten years and the income generated every month doing this type of activity is 14,762 PHP.

Francisca joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative to request funds to purchase fertilizers. She is requesting a loan in the amount of Php 30,000. This money is intend to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, she plans to add another rice field to increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase rice fertilizers for good growth.

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Elsa Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señorita Elsa es socia del banco comunal Más que Vencedoras, vive en la hermosa ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que se caracteriza por la belleza de sus iglesias, paisajes, la cultura y tradiciones de su gente quienes son personas amables, gentiles y cálidas. 

La Señorita. Elsa tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.
 
Ella es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulantemente, trabaja de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo y lleva en este negocio 5 años. En su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa y pollos para continuar con sus negocios.
 
Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señorita Elsa is a member of the communal bank "Más que Vencedoras" (more than victorious). She lives in the beautiful city of Azogues, which is renowned for the beauty of its churches, its landscapes, its culture and its popular traditions. Its residents are nice, gentle and warm-hearted people.

Elsa, aged 29, is single and lives with her parents with whom she shares household expenses. They don't have their own house, therefore they live in the house of a relative.

Elsa is a merchant. She sells clothes in the street, working from Monday to Friday without fixed hours. She has been in this activity for five years. At home she farms chickens.

She will invest her loan in clothes and chickens to continue her businesses. Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy clothes and chickens.

loans.name: Okambo Y.d.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Okambo Y.D.G Group in Western Kenya! Pamela is the facilitator of the Okambo Y.D.G group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Pamela  takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Pamela had a good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Pamela was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Pamela  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Pamela will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Okambo Y.D.G group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Pamela with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes  lives in Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, two of whom are in school. Agnes has had a pub for 5 years, and she works 6 days out of every week Agnes has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more buy more crates of beer, soda and jerycans of local gin. The main business challenge(s) for Agnes include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are seeing her business grow big and start selling wholesale, and also to own a fully stocked pub. Agnes lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer, soda and jerycans of local gin

loans.name: Dios Proveera 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Yovany is a member of the group called Dios Proveera 1, 2 & 3 ("God Will Provide"). This group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, a city formed by the sugar cane industry (the city's main economic activity) and by luxury tourism with high scale resorts. Yovany is one of many women whose husband or other family member depends on work in the sugarcane industry. They live in a Batey, a rural area where most of the sugar cane workers live.

Yovany is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her retail business. She will buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics (like perfume, body lotion, etc.) Profits will be used to reinvest in her business. She wants to make big sales this Christmas and continue saving for her goals of having a permanent place for her business and to buy a home.

She currently makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, etc. for resale

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 36 years old, married to Penninah, and has children.  He has been in the motorcycle transport business for the last nine years with a monthly income of KES 15,000.

Thomas is requesting a fourth loan with KADET for KES 100,000 to purchase a dairy cow and feeds.  With the anticipated profits he plans to expand his business and repay his loan.

His hope is to fully venture into dairy farming and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. For the past three years, Lilibeth has operated a 'sari-sari' (variety) store, buying and selling canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

 Lilibeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell (groceries, snacks, drinks)

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance sells second-hand clothes in Abura, Cape Coast. She has been in this business for some years. She is divorced with six children. She is a middle school leaver. Her income is mostly used to pay her children’s school fees, and for food and utility bills. 

Constance will use her loan to buy more clothes in order to expand her business thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. Her new profits from the expanded business will be used to assist in paying her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
For one year, Rolando has thrived in the demolition business. He is the proud owner of Juarez Demolition. Through his success with his clients and word of mouth recommendations, Rolando’s business has grown. 

“I have been saving for years to get my business off and running,” Rolando said. “This has been such an amazing year.”

Rolando spends his days tearing down buildings and other structures. With more than five years of experience in the business, he has invested in tools, equipment, and through using his owns savings, the start-up expenses. 

“I am doing this for my wife and three kids,” he said. “I want to show them that with hard work, you can achieve your dreams.”

He came to Accion Texas Inc., for a $5,450 loan to purchase a new Bobcat truck to help maximize his business potential. In addition to adding another machine to his garage, he plans on using it as a backup in case one of his trucks happens to need repairs. 

Rolando is hopeful for his future in the demolition industry and looks forward to many more successful years with his business. 

“Without the help of Accion, I would not be able to grow my business,” Rolando said. “I am excited about where my business is headed.”

loans.use: to pay for a new Bobcat truck

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: It was hard for Yasmeen  to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. Yasmeen  is 52 years old, married woman. She is a mother of 6 children.  Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. Yasmeen  has gained great confidence in the business as she has learnt how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Christine would like to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is 30 years old and is the mother of six children. She has eight years experience in the dairy business. She is requesting a loan of $175 to buy another cow in order to produce more yogurt, cheese, and butter to sell in the baazar. This will increase her income and help her to better take care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and livestock feed

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en: Aydin M. always dreamed of being the owner of his own business. And his dream came true when he opened his food store in 2000. Aydin is married and has three children. His profit is just enough to cover his family's needs, but to broaden the store he needs more funds. To achieve his goal, he borrowed $1200 USD loan  and he plans to use this new loan from Aqroinvest CU to make his store even bigger and better.

loans.use: Mr. Mehdiyev would like to broaden his food store.

loans.name: Chunga Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a husband and father of five children. Health problems have rendered him not strong enough to cultivate crops which are the main economic activity in his community. As a result, he has resorted to rearing animals and producing honey which is less strenuous in his estimation. Due to inadequate capital, he could not raise enough revenue to meet  the needs of his family. Motivated by other GHAPE members in his community, he joined the program and received loans of $40 and $130 in 2005 and 2006 respectively. The profit he got from the loans was used to pay tuition for his children. Given the high demand of his products, there is need for expansion.

Given a loan of $200, Emmanuel plans to repair his pig sty, buy more bee hives and feed for his pigs. His community will benefit from this in that there will be more honey, pork, and manure at their disposal for a better standard of living.

He plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loans.use: Rearing of pigs, goats and production of honey

loans.name: Alasgar

texts.en: Mr. Alasgar is a low income person which makes him vulnerable. He is 41, married with two children, and lives in Sumgayit city in the north-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Alasgar has owned and operated a small food market in the local bazaar of Sumgayit town for the past five years. The business is stable because Alasgar has collected many customers during time he runs this shop. But he would like to make an investment in his business to diversify the assortment of goods, increase their turnover, and therefore increase his income so he can provide all the necessities of life for his children. Some commercial banks demand collateral to give to Alasgar credit, but Alasgar has nothing to mortgage; that's why he applied to Normicro Sumqayit, which disburses credit free of collateral for his $800 loan. This credit could let him to buy and sell a larger amount of goods and to develop his business.

loans.use: To sell a larger amount of goods and to develop his business

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in south western Azerbaijan. She is 48 years old, married and has three children. She sells fruits and vegetables in the Beylagan city market. Farida has ten years experience at this business. She wants to buy more varieties of goods. Farida needs a $700 loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Lanly

texts.es:
Mrs. Lanly belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Valientes” (“Brave Women”), and lives in the San Martín section of the province of Huallaga. She dedicates herself to the sale of agrochemical products (fertilizers, herbicides, etc.).

Thanks to the support of her husband who is a veterinarian, as well as to her own efforts, she has grown her business and now has many regular customers.

With the loan of 1,200 soles to be repaid over a term of six months, she will buy more merchandise at wholesale for a variety of uses, as well as a small display case in which to showcase her products.

Mrs. Lanly is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and two children. She works hard every day, exemplifying for friends and family how to achieve one’s goals through hard work and self-sacrifice.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lanly pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Valientes, vive en la región San Martín, provincia Huallaga , distrito Saposoa y se dedica a la venta de agroquímicos. Gracias al apoyo de su esposo que es veterinario y también al esfuerzo de la señora incrementó su negocio y tiene muchos clientes ya que cuando empezó no eran conocidos, pero ahora sí y venden durante todo el día. Con el préstamo de S/.1,200.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará mas productos agroquímicos al por mayor en cajas y galones para diversos uso y una pequeña vitrina para exhibir sus productos. La señora Lanly tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Trabaja diariamente demostrando ejemplo de abnegación y esfuerzo a sus hijos y amigos y cumplir así con las metas que tiene.

loans.use: Purchase of agrochemical products (fertilizers, herbicides, etc.) and a small display case.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience O. has 7 children, She is 43 years old. She sells over-the-counter drugs and cold drinks. She has been in her business for the past 8 years. She hails from Lagos State, Nigeria. She needs a loan in the amount of $450 to enable her to buy more medical drugs and more drinks to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To buy medical drugs and also drinks for sale

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en:
Tinh and her husband Dung have a small grocery store at their home. They sell a wide variety of items in their grocery store, including vegetables, candy, and household tools. Much of their income goes towards raising their young three year old daughter. Last time they had received $75 from Kiva for their business and earned between 300,000 - 450,000 VND per month. They paid all their loan back and now they would like to continue their partnership with Kiva by requesting to borrow 1,200,000 VND.


.

loans.use: To increase grocery store stock

loans.name: Honimoy

texts.ru:
Honimoy B. lives in Yavan. She is 48 years old, married with six children and is a housewife. She also keeps and raises a few calves for sale. In addition to the calves Honimoy would like to buy a dairy cow to provide fresh milk for her family and to sell whatever is extra. This would help her earn some money. She is hoping to borrow $1025 to buy a cow and she plans to repay her loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Бадалова Хонимой Проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 48 лет. Она замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Домохозяйка. Имеет небольшое хозяйство, где разводит бычков. Но Хонимой хочет купить дойную корову для того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью свежим молоком , а если будет лишнее сможет продавать его и зарабатывать этим деньги.Но для этого ей необходимо получить кредит в размере 1025 долларов США. Погасить кредит клиентка сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola S. is 31 years old, she is married with 5 children, and she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, a trade she learned from her mother. She needs the loan of $525 to buy more provisions for sale. She is really grateful to Kiva in anticipation of the loan; this can be seen from her expression when she was visited.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Q. Thi Duong, 47 years old, joined the Fun in 2003. Prior to joining, her family’s main income was from farming and working the fields; after joining the Fund, she planned with her husband to open a restaurant. Their restaurant has a large variety of dishes with reasonable prices. They are open all day; in the morning they only serve hot soups like porridge and beef noodle, and in the afternoon they serve rice dishes and other small plates. With this good service, the restaurant receives many customers. She has 3 children, 2 of which are grown, and 1 still in school. Her family’s finances are now very stable. In this round of funding her family is requesting 14,000,000 VND. Their average income is 3,500,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị Quyết 47 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003, những năm về trước nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị chủ yếu tập chung vào nông nghiệp, khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị được vay vốn, chi đã bàn bạc cùng chồng mở quán ăn, Quán ăn của gia đình chị với nhiều món ăn đa dạng giá cả hợp lý, phục vụ cả ngày, buổi sáng chị bán các đồ ăn sáng như cháo, phở, buổi trưa gia đình chị bán hàng cơm và các đồ nhậu. Với những điểm như vậy nên khách hàng đến quán ăn nhà chị rất đông, chị có 3 con, 2 con lớn đã trưởng thành, 1 con đang đi học kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn.Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 14.000.000đ. Thu nhập bình quân. 3.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: La Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. La Thi T., 48 years old, has two children who are still going to school. In 1999, she joined the TYM Fund. At first, she invested in breeding animals but the profit was not high. Therefore, she later invested the borrowed money in general store. Her store is full of merchandises such as candies, fruits…Besides, she also sells fertilizer to assist local people with agricultural activity. Being helped by her husband and her children, she does not have too many difficulties in her businesses. This time, she wants to borrow 900 USD to invest more in the general store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lã Thị Thành năm nay 48 tuổi.Gia đình chị có 2 con đang tuổi đi học.Năm 1999 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương. Vòng vốn đầu chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi song hiệu quả dự án đem lại cho gia đình không cao. Vì vậy các vòng vốn sau chị đã đầu tư vào buôn bán hàng tạp hoá. Cửa hàng nhà chị hiện kinh doanh rất nhiều mặt hàng như bánh kẹo, hoa quả...Ngoài ra để phục vụ nhu cầu sản xuất nông nghiệp tại địa phương gia đình chị còn kinh doanh thêm phân đạm. Do nhận được sự hỗ trợ từ chồng và các con nên công việc kinh doanh của chị đang gặp nhiều thuận lợi và ngày càng phát triển. Vòng cốn tới chị monmg muốn được vay thêm 15.000.000đ để đầu tư vào cửa hàng tạp hoá của gia đình. Thu nậhp 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Investment in general store

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Lim Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sok L. is the Village Bank President in Thkol Village in Kandal Province. This village bank consists of twenty-four people. Mrs. Sok L. was born in 1963 and she is now a fruit seller in the local market in the village. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Sok L. wants to expand her business. Therefore she decided to ask for a loan to buy more kinds of fruit to meet her customers' demand. Her husband, Mr. Chhun Mech, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar or palm wine.  He also assists in his wife's business when he has free time. Mrs. Sok L. has six children, two of whom are workers who make palm sugar for middlemen. They can make a small income to support their family. The remaining four children are attending high school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more kinds of fruit to meet her customers demand.

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokun L., 29, and her husband, Mr. Pak Bo, 32, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2001 and have two children; one son and one daughter. All of them are in the local school.

Mrs. Sokun has been a silk weaver for fifteen years, a skill she learned from her mother. She is also teaching her husband to become a silk weaver. Besides weaving, he is also a construction worker. The couple sells their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh.

Sokun is requesting a loan of 400 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Lucero Del Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Lucero del Amanecer esta ubicado en L. comunidad D. L. Mejorada en el distrito D. Mariscal Cáceres en Huancavelica. Esta comunidad, ubicada al margen derecho del Río Mantaro, entre 2600 y 3600 D. altitud, tiene un clima cálido, cuenta con acceso a las ciudades D. Huancavelica y Huancayo por vía férrea y por carretera. Su actividad principal es L. agricultura ( cereales, papas, habas, verduras), L. ganadería (ovinos, vacunos y animales menores), comercio y turismo.

Teresa A., es casada tiene 8 hijos, inició su negocio hace 8 años con un pequeño capital, pero por problemas D. salud perdió todo, volvió a empezar vendiendo comida e implementando una tienda que actualmente todavía L. tiene. Con los prestamos que recibe incrementa su mercadería y ahora no solo venD. en su tienda sino en un puestito que tiene en un colegio. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos profesionales, sobre todo los 4 últimos, pues los mayores son casados y no tuvo medios para hacerles estudiar.

Paulina S., es casada tiene 5 hijos, empezó a trabajar con FINCA hace 6 meses donD. invirtió su primer préstamo en L. compra D. cuyes y gallinas, antes no vendía nada porque nadie le prestaba dinero, ahora compra y venD. animales menores. ElL. manifiesta que ha logrado mejorar sus ingresos, ahora ya no tiene problemas con L. comida diaria, su sueño es ahorrar para comprarse un terreno pues vive con su suegra.

Saturnina F., es casada tiene 4 hijos, antes solo se dedicaba a lavar ropa, ahora venD. anticuchos y frituras. Antes tenia problemas con su esposo, pues le gustaba mucho el licor, ahora él esta trabajando pues e como elL. ha ido superándose. Con sus prestamos logró comprar una anticuchera, ahora gana mas que antes y tiene mejores ingresos para sus hijos. Saturnina ahorra para que sus hijos vivan felices sin que les falte nada, sobre todo en los estudios.
texts.en:
The Lucero del Amanecer Bank is located in the community of L. Mejorada in the district of Mariscal Cáceres in Huancavelica. Situated on the right bank of the Mantaro River, at an altituD. of between 2600 and 3600, the community has a mild climate and can be accessed from the towns of Huancavelica and Huancayo by both rail and road. Farming (cereal crops, potatoes, beans, vegetables); animal husbandry (sheep, cattle, and young animals); as well as commerce and tourism are the main activities. Teresa A. is married and has eight children. She began her business 8 years ago with a small amount of capital, but because of health problems, she lost everything. She began selling meals and opened a small store that she still runs. With the loan that she receives, she plans to increase her stock. Now she not only sells from her store but also from a stall that she has in a school. Her dream is to see her children become professionals, especially her four youngest children as the older ones are married and she does not have the means to have them study. Paulina S. is married and has five children. She started work with FINCA six months ago when she invested her first loan in the purchase of guinea pigs and chickens. Beforehand she could not sell anything because no one would lend her money, whereas now she buys and sells young animals. She has succeeded in increasing her income and now has no problems putting bread on the table. Her dream is to save enough to buy a plot of land so she can live there with her mother-in-law. Saturnina F. is married and has four children. In the past she used to wash clothes for a living, but now she sells anticuchos (type of kebab) and fried foods. She used to have problems with her husband because he drank too much, but now he has work, and so she has been able to overcome her difficulties. With the loan she has managed to buy a kebab stand, and now she earns more than before and has more money to spend on her children. Saturnina’s plan is to save money so that her children can lead happy lives and lack for nothing—especially where their education is concerned.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Bank Lucero del Amanecer needs 5100 soles so that its 13 members can invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en: Problems and money shortages never defeated Mavlyuda, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and continue to improve her situation. Mavlyuda is an extremely hardworking and energetic woman. She is 50 years old. She is divorced and the loving mother of two children. She began her business to keep herself busy and active when she found herself sad and depressed due to her separation, and also in order to have an independent income. For more than 6 years, she has operated a store where she sells women’s clothing. As a rule she travels to the neighboring town to get new garments at very cheap prices. Her store is well known, and people love to visit because it's clean, tidy, and run by someone who is very kind and thoughtful. Mavlyuda hopes that her store will keep growing so that she can maintain a comfortable life for her family, especially for her children. To make that possible, she has applied for a new loan that she will use to buy more clothing to sell. Mavlyuda requests 2500 Somoni ($750) for a term of 9 months. She promises to repay the loan promptly, as she has with previous loans.

loans.use: To buy new clothes to sell

loans.name: Jiguisèmè Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement Jiguisèmè (composé de 6 femmes 5 mariées et 1célibataire avec en moyenne 3 enfants et une moyenne d’âge de 19 ans) est crée à travers une association de leur village (Association Badeya de Bougoula Hameau) situé à environ 3km de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). Ce groupement composé des soeurs et cousines a pour activités génératrices de revenus l’achat et la vente des condiments, légumes, riz et tissus.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clièntele qui ne cesse d’augmenter, ce groupe decida d’integrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son 4ème cycle du prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe). Tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Les femmes du groupe sollicitent ce prêt pour pouvoir acheter; 40 sacs de riz et un importants stock de condiments (2 sacs d’oignon, 2 sacs d’aubergine, 1 sacs de gombo, 5 paquets de cubes maggie, 5 boîtes de concentré tomate, etc.) La ville Sikasso et ses environs sont les principales sources d’approvisionnement des femmes de ce groupe. Les marchandises sont achiminées à Bougoula Hameau les jours de foire pour être vendues au comptant, à la fois en gros et détail à une clientèle composée très généralement des femmes et surtout des foraines. Les marchandises sont vendues au comptant et à crédit soit au marché local, soit à la maison à une clientèle locale feminine.
Elles  envisagent réaliser chacune  un bénéfice moyen de 60.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utiliser pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir  aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités respectives.
texts.en:
The group Jiguisèmè (composed of six women, of whom five are married and one is unmarried and who average 19 years of age and three children) was created through an association in their village (Association Badeya de Bougoula Hameau) located about 3 km from the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). This group of sisters and cousins works to earn an income by trading in condiments, vegetables, rice, and cloth.

To satisfy their ever-increasing customer base, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, with which they are on their fourth solidarity loan cycle (group loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

These women are requesting this loan to buy 40 sacks of rice and a sizable stock of condiments (2 sacks of onions, 2 of eggplant, 1 of okra, 5 packets of Maggie bouillon cubes, 5 cans of tomato paste, etc.). Sikasso and the surrounding areas are the main source of supplies for them. The goods are taken to Bougoula Hameau on market days to be sold in cash and at the wholesale and retail levels, both. Their customers are generally composed of women and especially market vendors. Sales are made either at the local market or out of homes, cash or credit accepted.

They each envision realizing an average profit of 60,000 francs CFA per month that will be used to pay the loan interest, to support the family, and to invest the rest into their respective businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments, vegetables, rice, and cloth

loans.name: Alveena Yunas Group

texts.en:
Alveena baji is a 44-year-old married lady and resides in a place called Kot Radha Kishan which is 24 km from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She has been living in this place for the past 15 years. She is an uneducated lady. Her husband's name is Y. and he is a driver, driving a horse cart which he uses to bring people from one place to another, charging a fare.

Alveena baji is the mother of four kids: one son and three daughters. Her son is a daily wage laborer. Her daughters stay at home and do household work and take care of the family. Alveena baji belongs to the milk-selling profession. She has a buffalo at her house and from her, she gets milk which she sells to milk shops. She has successfully repaid four loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her milk-selling business.

Alveena baji is the group leader for some more women. Shakeela baji and Noreen baji each want a loan to buy bricks to re-sell. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy land on contract to grow vegetables. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy chairs and tools for her family's barbershop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her milk-selling business

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.en:
Abdusalom K. is married and lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He works as a taxi driver. He loves being self-employed and managing his own time. Abdusalom has a nice car and offers taxi services around his region. He is a workaholic and is always ready to work non-stop, even on the weekend.

Abdusalom has been in this business for 3 years. Today he is planning to replace his old tires with new ones and also wants to do some repairs on his car. For this reason he is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni with a term of 12 months. This will generate additional profit as he finds more customers. This business is a crucial segment of his life since it is Abdusalom's opportunity to support his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: repair work on his taxi

loans.name: Yuryi's Group

texts.en:
Yuryi is a married father with a 5-year-old. His family lives in Tavryisk. Yuryi offers ceremonial services and sells ceremonial inventory in his home town. He has been in this business for 4 years. His turnover capital is about 13,000 Grivnas and net profit exceeds 3,000 Grivnas a month. One of the specific characteristics of his business is high turn-around of inventory.

Yuryi is very focused and determined. He is grateful for the loans he has received from “Nadiya Ukraine” which have helped the expansion of his business. Today, Yuryi is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnas to purchase additional raw materials to manufacture funeral wreaths, e.g. sham flowers, wire and ribbons. The loan will be beneficial for Yuryi’s business by keeping it competitive and promoting further growth so that it will continue to provide necessary income for him and his family.
