loans.use: Ceremonial inventory and services

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 36 year old Naomi D. from Mwanza.  She is married. She is also responsible for supporting two orphan dependents. Naomi has been running a poultry business since 2008. D. has a Poultry/kuku business. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially among SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. She works at the business for 4 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Naomi currently earns about 160USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy chicks to raise and resell. In the future, she plans to expand her business. D. thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more chicks raise and resell

loans.name: Mari

texts.en:
Mari M. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and currently has no children. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver. She is a trader.

Mari trades in yam. She buys tubers of yams from the north, where she claims the cost is economical, and she sells them in the local market in Mampong. She says that most of her customers are food vendors. She also distributes to retailers.

Mari has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy more tubers of yams so she can supply more customers. She hopes to expand her business and maximize her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy tubers of yam

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! Bertha S. from Dar es Salaam is 39 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of 1½ and 22. Bertha has been running a shop since 2002. She owns a small duka, or neighborhood shop, in the city, where she sells common household and grocery items. She works 13-16 hours a day, 6 days a week, with the help of her husband.

Bertha currently earns about 100 USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more stock for her shop. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Bertha thanks you for your support!

Sero Lease and Finance Ltd. (SELFINA) is pioneering micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization supports the economic empowerment of women through leasing and leaseback micro-financing.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and limited access to basic resources and services for low-income women. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her business.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de Los Ángeles M. es una señora que ha salido adelante a pesar de ser madre soltera, ella  mantuvo a sus hijos y ahora cada quien tiene su familia solo le queda uno el cual también aporta con los gastos familiares. La señora desea remodelar su baño e instalar al puerta por dentro de su vivienda como  también  quiere arreglar el techo por que es de lamina y en tiempo de frió es muy helado al momento de  salir teme a tomar alguna enfermedad ya que su mama también vive con ella y ya es grande de edad y necesita mas cuidados.
texts.en:
Maria De Los Angeles is a woman who has moved forward in spite of being a single mother. She raised her children and now each has their own family. Only one remains who helps her with family expenses. Maria wants to remodel her bathroom and install a door in her house and fix the roof because. Unfortunately, in cold weather, the door freezes open and she is afraid that the cold will cause sickness. Her mother, who is of old age, lives with her and she needs to be careful because of her.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Arreglar baño

loans.name: Elberta

texts.es:
Elberta es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Elberta es casada, tiene 53 años y 8 hijos, Elberta tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad en donde vende comida típica, como caldos y segundos, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Elberta necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, papa y leña.
Elberta sueña con construir una tienda para tener una pollería y una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Elberta is a member of Communal Bank Triunfo. She is married, 53 years old, and has 8 children. Elberta has a stand in the city's central market where she sells typical food, such as soups and meals, which she makes each day. She needs a loan of 2400 soles that she will use to purchase rice, oil, potatoes and firewood. Elberta dreams of building a store where she can sell chickens and general merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, oil, potatoes, and firewood.

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
Elman S. is an ordinary man in the district of Agsu in Azerbaijan. He is a very responsible person who, since his youth, has been running a livestock farm with the goal of supporting his family, his wife and three children.

Elman needs to purchase calves to raise them and maximize his profits by selling their milk and meat. Once he has these products from his flock he sells them in his neighborhood and in this manner he is able to support his family. For this reason, Elman is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Iheancho

texts.en:
C. sells sarongs, which can be used to make native wear and also tied around the waist by men and women. She also trades seasonal fruit as they become available. 

C. has been in business for the past seven years, and she is requesting a loan of N100,000 (US$675) to purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma P. and her family live in the village of Rang-Ay at the mountainous municipality of San Agustin, Isabela. She is married to Elendrie and blessed with four children.

In order to support her family, Lerma raises hogs. Wanting to sustain the business, she is asking for support form Kiva. Knowing that Kiva lenders have soft heart for the needy, she decided to request a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos that she will use to purchase one piglet as well as feeds for her hogs. She is hoping that her request will be granted.

loans.use: To buy a piglet and hog feed

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is the mother of three children and is a fish monger in Alabukam where she lives and operates her business. She will use this loan to purchase flour and fish, as well as to cover transportation and rent costs.   
 
This is Mercy’s third loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2007. Mercy trusts her business will be a successful one because she thinks she has a good site at which she operates her business. Her customer base is also consistent and Mercy is skillful in her activities. 

Like most entrepreneurial mothers, Mercy plans to use the profits from the loans to pay for her children’s school fees. The profits will also go towards purchasing food and clothing for the family. Mercy enjoys being a GHAPE member and likes the group of entrepreneurs she works with. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of fish and flour

loans.name: Adeshola

texts.en:
Adeshola is 33 years old and married with two children. She has a shop where she sells children’s wear and baby items. Before, she hawked from place to place but could sell only what she could carry. After joining LAPO, she was able to open a shop.

Adeshola opens her shop every day of the week from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. except on Sundays. Her biggest priority is feeding the children and making sure their school fees are paid. Adeshola is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more children’s wear and baby items to sell. This, she said, will enable her to meet the demand of her customers. She says thank you to Kiva and LAPO micro-finance.

loans.use: To purchase more children’s wear and baby items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of dairy cows

loans.name: Sata

texts.fr:
Madame Sata S. est une femme mariée qui est mère de  neuf enfants. Elle  vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans une famille nucléaire à Hérémakono,  un village situé à 25  kilomètres de Bamako (la capitale du Mali) relevant de Koulikoro deuxième région administrative de la république de Mali.
Madame Sata S. intégra le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance de Soro Yiriwaso il y a de cela quatre ans.
Après six prêts de groupe et un prêt individuel tous remboursés sans aucune difficulté, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel avec lequel elle désire s’approvisionner en ustensiles de cuisine pour les revendre en ambulant. 
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako une fois par mois et  compte avoir avec ce prêt, six douzaines de qualités différentes et espère  réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 55. 000 FCFA qui sera destiné à la prise en charge des dépenses familiales et au remboursement de ses échéances.
Elle ambitionne, avec l’appui de Soro Yiriwaso et de son partenaire Kiva, effectuer des voyages sur la république de Guinée Conakry où se trouvent actuellement les meilleures qualités d’articles qu’elle vend et pour mieux servir sa clientèle croissante.
texts.en:
Ms. Sata S. is a married woman who is the mother of nine children.  She lives with her husband and children in a nuclear family in Hérémakono, a village located 25 km from Bamako (the capital of Mali) which is part of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  Ms. Sata S. joined the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago.  After six group loans and an individual loan, all repaid without a problem, she is now on her second individual loan, which she would like to use to supply herself with kitchen utensils for reselling door-to-door. She stocks up in Bamako once a month and plans on using this loan to obtain six dozen of different quality and hopes to realize an average monthly profits of 55,000 francs CFA.  The profits will be for meeting family expenses and for making loan payments.  Her ambition, with the support of Soro Yiriwaso and its partner Kiva, is to take trips to Conakry, Republic of Guinée, where the highest quality goods she sells are currently found.  She can then better serve her growing customer base.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 38 años, está casada, vive su esposo y sus 6 hijos, en su casa propia. Desde niña anhelaba tener una tienda y hace 6 meses logró implementar su bodega en un espacio de su casa,  pero ella siente que es más útil en los trabajos agrícolas por muy pesados que sean, los cuales realiza junto a su esposo. Pero por ello no deja de abrir a las 6 de la mañana su establecimiento y atiende a sus clientes alegremente hasta las 9 de la mañana, que es cuando se dirige a sus chacras y cuando llegan sus hijos del colegio atienden la tienda por las tardes. Alejandrina nota que poco a poco viene ganando más clientela, pues donde se encuentra ubicada no tiene competencia, por ello tiene en mente surtir su bodega hasta que tenga gran variedad de productos y así sea más atractiva para sus vecinos.
Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y ella se siente muy comprometida con su banco comunal, así como en el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos comestibles para su tienda.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 38 years old and married. She lives with her husband and six children in their own home. Since she was a girl, she longed to have her own store; six months ago, she succeeded in establishing a grocery store in a space in her house. Still, she feels that the agricultural jobs she works on with her husband are more useful, even though they can be very difficult. Because she must tend her farms in the morning, she is unable to open her business at 6 a.m. and cheerfully attend to her clientele until 9 a.m. Her children help tend the store when they return home from school in the afternoons. Alejandrina notes that she is winning over more clientele little by little; where she is located, she has no competition. She would like to stock her store with a large variety of products and by doing so become more attractive to her neighbors. This is her fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP and she feels very devoted to her communal bank with respect to making punctual loan payments. With the funds she is seeking, she will buy more food products for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity sells foodstuffs and sandals in her stall. She is 34 years old and married with three children. She has sold out of all the foodstuffs in her stall and she wants to purchase more to sell. She hopes for a loan of 150,000 naira to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Esmeraldas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Esmeraldas” Esta representado por la señora Nora Ana y conformado por 14 miembros los cuales van cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando puntualidad y sobre todo ganas D. trabajar para sacar adelante a sus familias. Cada una D. las socias tiene su propio negocio D. venta D. diferentes productos como venta D. refrigerio, venta D. joyas, perfumes, cotillón y el servicio D. sus profesiones como policías, profesoras y chóferes. El comercio en este grupo es muy variado, su nivel D. ventas es muy bueno, teniendo buena rentabilidad y capacidad D. pago a pesar D. existir bastante competencia.  El crédito esta destinado al incremento D. su capital, esperan mejorar sus ventas  y el crédito sera invertido en la compra D. más mercadería que será utilizado para generar mayores ganancia para poder otorgarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida y un futuro mas prometedor a sus hijos que son su razón para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Esmeraldas" (Emeralds) group, represented by Nora Ana, consists of 14 members who are in their third lending cycle demonstrating punctuality and, above all, a willingness to work to see their families get ahead. Each of the members has her own business consisting of sales of various items like: refreshments, jewelry, perfumes, party planning. Some offer professional services such as: policemen, teachers and drivers. Commerce in this group is varied and their sales levels are good so they are able to earn good profits and repay their loans despite competition. The funding will be used to buy merchandise which will increase their profits so that their families can have a better quality of life and a more promising future for their children, who are their reason to persevere.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Sulamai

texts.en: Sulamai M. is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Papa Sataua 1. She is married and has four school-aged children. Sulamai owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taamu (a large root vegetable like taro) for sale. Sulamai has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 300 WST a month. In 2008, Sulamai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase land on which to raise additional crops. Sulamai is now requesting a new loan of 1,450 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida P. is from the village of Dabubu Grande. She is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Florida owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $125 whenever she sells her animals.

In 2009, Florida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Florida is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional revenue to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es una mujer de 49 años, vive con su esposo (Víctor), de 51 años, y con 4 de sus 6 hijos: Josué de 19, Juana de 17, Eloy de 14 y Emerson de 12 años. Sus hijos mayores estudian en la capital en busca de un futuro mejor.

Ella se dedica a la laboriosa actividad de la agricultura, siembra papa de muy buena calidad, además de olluco con la ayuda de su esposo. Juntos siembran, vigilan las tierras, les dan el tratamiento adecuado y luego ven la recompensa en su cosecha que siempre es muy productiva, lo que les permite vender todo y obtener dinero para mantener a sus hijos.
Pero Teofila no solo se dedica a la siembra, sino también cría carneros y vende la carne de éstos a muy buen precio, este negocio la tiene muy entusiasmada y lo quiere ampliar para convertirse en una gran comerciante de carne de carnero.
Como una mujer emprendedora no tiene miedo a empezar nuevos negocios y está dispuesta a seguir soñando, trazarse metas que sabe algún día se harán realidad con esfuerzo constante.

Es el sétimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura de ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos, ya que no quiere quedar mal ni con la financiera, ni con sus compañeros integrantes de su banco comunal, que al igual que ella son personas muy trabajadoras. El dinero que ahora solicita lo usará para la compra de más semilla de papa para aumentar su producción; también adquirirá más carneros para seguir creciendo en la venta de la carne que hasta hoy le ha dado buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Teofila is 49 years old and lives with her husband Victor, who is 51, and four of their six children: Josué (age 19), Juana (age 17), Eloy (age 14), and Emerson (age 12). The older children are studying in the capital so that they can pursue a better future.

Teofila works hard at farming, growing high quality crops of potatoes and ulluco with the help of her husband. Working together, they keep watch over their land, provide it with proper treatment, and reap the reward of a very productive harvest. Selling their entire harvest allows them to earn income to support their children.

In addition to farming, Teofila also raises sheep and sells the meat at a good price. She is very excited about this business and wants to expand it to the point of becoming a well-known vendor of mutton. As a female entrepreneur, Teofila is not afraid of starting new businesses and always continue to dream. She establishes goals for herself because she knows that she can reach them someday with consistent effort.

This is her seventh loan with MFP. Teofila is careful to be responsible and punctual with her payments because she does not want to create problems with her finances or with the other members of her Communal Bank, who are hardworking people like her. She will use the money to buy more potato seedling to increase her production. In addition, she will acquire more sheep to increase her mutton sales which have been successful so far.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potato seedlings & sheep

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet sells drinks and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to be a major drink distributor in the future. Juliet needs a loan amount of 160,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. 

She lives in Benin City. She is 29 years old and married with 2 children. Her husband is a businessman. She is a LAPO client. (Lift above poverty organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa). She hopes to experience an increase in her business. She says a big thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: Née en 1970 à Avrankou, commune située à quelques kilomètres de Porto-Novo, D. Célestine est mariée à AGBOENOU Gabriel. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit au quartier Djassin, dans le troisième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Célestine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins et venir en aide à son mari, Célestine vend depuis une dizaine d'année, de la banane et de la patate douce au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo.  Célestine vend également, mais de façon secondaire la farine de manioc (communément appelé gari). Célestine s'approvisionne à Yoko au Bénin. Célestine a obtenu deux fois de crédits à ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Célestine voudrait augmenter son fonds de roulement et agrandir son activité pour mieux attirer la clientèle et réaliser plus de bénéfices. C'est dans cette intention que Célestine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Avrankou, a community located a few kilometers from Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Ms. D. Célestine is married to Mr. AGBOENOU Gabriel. The couple has four children to support, of whom three are their own. Only some of the children are in school. The family lives in the Djassin quarter, in the 3rd district of the city of Porto-Novo. The couple jointly ensures that family expenses are covered. Célestine did not attend school. To meet her needs and to help her husband out, she has been selling bananas and sweet potatoes for ten years at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo. She sells cassava flour (commonly called gari) although secondarily. She stocks up in Yoko in Benin. Célestine has twice obtained ALIDé loans and has repaid them both. She would like to increase her working capital and to expand her business, so as to do better in attracting customers and to make more profit. With this in mind, she's requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bunches of bananas and sacks of cassava flour

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. Betty is 32 years old and is married to a clerk. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a saloon. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Leak Heng Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eleven people make up a a village bank loan.  They all live in Tep Archun village in Kandal province. Mrs. Srey Leak H. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members who will each use their loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Srey Leak H. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice for supporting her family.  Her husband, Mr. Phearam Chhen, is a construction laborer. The family has a problem because their house is too old to live in. Therefore, in order to improve the family living conditions, Mrs. Srey Leak H. is asking for a loan to buy timber to construct her house. This couple does not children.

loans.use: To buy timber.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 49 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el caserío San Bernardino, una zona rural del distrito D. Túcume, en la provincia D. Lambayeque, ubicado a 45 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la confección D. pantalones en drill y poliéster desD. hace mas D. 10 años. Este negocio ha sido D. mucha ayuda a la economía familiar durante todo este tiempo, ya que su esposo trabaja como agricultor y los ingresos que percibía no eran suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares. Con este negocio ella y su familia ha salido adelante. Actualmente sus hijos ya estan independizados y ello la llena D. orgullo.

Ella trabaja en base a pedidos, trabaja junto a otros vecinos con un comerciante mayorista que les compra los pantalones que confeccionan para manufacturarlos y venderlos en diversos puntos del país. Actualmente ella tiene muchos pedidos y comparte responsabilidades con dos D. sus hijas que se dedican a la misma actividad.

Francisca se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra D. una maquina D. coser industrial con la cual su labor se haga mas facil y eficiente.

Ella es una mujer bastante laboriosa y muy creativa, realiza su trabajo con la mayor responsabilidad y calidad posibles. Su mayor anhelo es poder implementar un taller junto a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 49-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in the San Bernardino settlement, a rural area in the Túcume district of the Lambayeque province, located some 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been making polyester and drill cotton pants for over 10 years. This business has been of great help to the family income throughout all this time because her husband works in agriculture and does not earn enough money to cover all the family expenses. With this business, she and her family have been able to get ahead. Her children are now independent, which fills her with priD..

She and some of her neighbors work (by special order) with a wholesaler who buys the merchandise that they make and later sells it throughout the country. She currently has many orders to fill, and she shares the load with two of her daughters who also make pants.

Francisca is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000.00 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa for the very first time. She will use this loan to purchase an industrial sewing machine, which will help her work faster and more efficiently.

She is a very hardworking and creative person who works responsibly and produces the highest quality products. Her greatest wish is to be able to set up a sewing workshop alongsiD. her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia K. is a happily married woman with three children. She has received a senior-high education. Afia sells garden eggs and various types of spices in Jukwa, which she has been doing for about three years now. Her husband is a farmer.  

Afia uses the income she gets from the sale of garden eggs to help her husband in taking care of the family. Afia will use the loan she is going to get to purchase additional bags of garden eggs to resell to those who cook in large quantities. With the new earnings from her expanded business, Afia plans to save to build a shop at the marketplace to sell in.

This picture was taken on a market day (a day set aside for the market women to display all their goods and sell them at a reduced price.) A lot of people do their buying on this day.

loans.use: To purchase additional bags of garden eggs to resell to those who cook in large quantities

loans.name: Vandi

texts.en:
Vandi M. is a footballer and also a trader who sells phone cards, e-vouchers, drinks and pure water at Kpadahun Road by the Bo clock tower.

He is married to a hair dresser with a child who is in primary school.  He buys the items wholesale and supplies to his customers within Bo and surrounding areas.

He is always at his business place after his morning exercise and is so committed to his business. He is seeking a loan so that he can purchase large quantities of stock in order to increase his profit margin and then use the proceeds from the loan to acquire a piece of land and take proper care of his home.

loans.use: To buy phone cards and drinks

loans.name: Edioselyn

texts.en:
Edioselyn L., 42 years old, is a pig grower from Banga, South Cotabato. She started her business in 1998 and likes what she’s doing because she is able to earn income from this endeavor.

Edioselyn has three children and her eldest child is 11 years old. She works so hard to support their education. That is why today, she would like to establish her business.

Edioselyn would like to request a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy piglets and feed so that she will be able to raise more pigs for a better income.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Freddy Daniel

texts.es:
Freddy tiene un negocio de servicio para triciclos y también vende cerdos.  El empezó criando cerdo.  Los dejaba parir, vendía la mitad y con esa ganancia le daba de comer a la otra mitad.  De esto le salió buena ganancia y luego se compro un triciclo.

Freddy ha tenido prestamos en el pasado y los ha usado para criar mas cerdos y sacar suficiente ganancia para el compro de otro triciclo.  Gracias a los préstamos, Freddy tiene mejores ingresos y tiene ayuda para sostener su familia.

Freddy tiene 24 años de edad.  El esta casado y tiene un hijo.  Su meta es mejorar su casa y la condición de vida para su familia.  También quiere llegar a tener unos seis triciclos y hacer una media granja para criar cerdos en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Freddy has a business of providing tricycle service. He also sells pigs. He started breeding pigs. He let them give birth, and then sold half of them. With this income he gave food to the other half. This produced good earnings, and he then bought a tricycle. Freddy has had loans in the past. He has used them to breed more pigs and to get enough income to buy another tricycle. Thanks to the loans, Freddy has better earnings. He also has help to support his family. Freddy is 24, married, and has one child. His goal is to improve his house and his family’s living conditions. He also wants to have six tricycles and make an average size farm in order to breed the pigs in better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a tricycle

loans.name: Janett Del Socorro

texts.es: Janett del Socorro tiene 44 años, este no es el primer financiamiento de ella. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Por lo que siempre ha sido una mujer luchadora y emprendedora,  ella decidió realizar mejoras a su vivienda. Empezó Poco a poco incrementando los productos que vendía, así continuo hasta ahora que tiene una variedad de productos que ofrecer.  El brindar a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan le hace sentir muy bien y obtener nuevos clientes. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, vestidos y ropa interior.
texts.en:
Janett del Socoro is 44 years old. This is not her first funding. Her business is selling clothes. As she has always been a fighter and an entrepreneur, she has decided to make home improvements. She gradually began to increase the products that she sold, and continued until now to offer a variety of products. The offer to her clients is to make them feel good and gain new customers. The loan is for the purchase of pants, shirts, dresses and underwear.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Eugenia M. G., es trabajadora de la escuela José Montealegre, se desempeña como maestra de primaria, es casada con tres hijos de los cuales solo uno depende de ella, su esposo es comerciante y trabaja por cuenta propia.

Ella lleva ya 4 créditos con ceprodel los cuales le han ayudado para desarrollarse económicamente y ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Maria Eugenia Martinez G. works at the Jose Montealegre school, where she is a primary teacher. She is married with three children, of whom only one depends on her. Her husband is a merchant and works for himself. She has now had 4 loans with Ceprodel, which have helped her to develop economically and she has proven herself to be a very responsible person with her obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of materials (zinc, blocks and cement)

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en: Emilda C. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba. She is 39 years old, married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Emilda makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Emilda has been engaged in her business for more than 16 years and earns approximately 4,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2010, Emilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emilda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients to make products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Emilda from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additonal goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 39-year-old single man living with his parents. He is the main income provider for his family. He has 20 years of experience working as a mechanic and has run his own car repair shop since 2008. This man is very supportive of his parents and always tries to take care of them. He is specialized in repairing car bodies. Today, he is requesting $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional tools for his business. The tools are necessary to expand his business and handle more clients. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: to purchase tools

loans.name: Choxbajan Group

texts.es: Doña Aura es casada, solo curso el cuarto grado primaria, tiene cuatro hijos de diferentes edades tres hombres y una mujer, el mayor de diez años y la mas pequeña de dos años, el esposo se dedica al comercio (Vendedor Ambulante) y ella colabora con algunos gastos familiares, y de educación ya que tres de sus hijos asisten a la escuela, ella se dedica a la Elaboración de canastas y que cuenta con gran experiencia, porque este ha sido su trabajo desde que era niña. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos de superación personal y familiar y la ayuda de algunas vecinas, organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina MUJERES DE CHOXBAJAN, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes y también lleva el nombre del paraje ya que son originarias del mismo lugar. El grupo cuenta con 11 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, la crianza de animales, elaboración de canastas, venta de artículos de consumo diario.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de materia prima, así generar más ingresos y de esa forma colaborar con el desarrollo de sus familias. Ya que una de las dificultades ha sido la falta del capital, pero ha salido adelante y espera que su producción sea más grande y genere mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Aura is married and completed elementary school only through the fourth grade. She has four children of different ages, three sons and a daughter. The oldest is ten years old and the youngest is two years old. Her husband works as a traveling merchant and she helps with some of the family expenses, such as paying for the schooling of three of her children. Aura earns her living making baskets and has plenty of experience because she has done this type of work since she was a girl. Having enthusiasm, the desire to succeed personally and in her family life, and with the help of some neighbors, Aura was able to organize a group in order to request a loan.

This Communal Bank is called “Mujeres de Choxbajan” (Women of Choxbajan), a name that was chosen by all of the members since it contains the name of their hometown. The group consists of eleven women who are involved in different business activities such as raising animals, manufacturing baskets, and selling daily consumer products. This loan will be used to buy materials so that they can generate more income to help the development of their families. One of their difficulties has been the lack of capital, but now they can get ahead and expect to expand production as well as generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy materials

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen M. is 45 years old, married, and the father of nine children. His children are between sixteen years and three years of age. Stephen sells charcoal and firewood in Mombasa. His business is 10 years old. It has been doing well. Stephen's wife Christina runs a green grocer that supplements the family income.
This is Stephen's first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to purchase stock of charcoal for sale. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to boost his wife's grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase stock of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Banco del Desarrollo”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Rodolfo; el tiene 40 años de edad y es soltero; el socio estudia ingeniería electrónica en la universidad andina del Cusco desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m, el socio quiere concluir su carrera profesional para trabajar en una empresa. El socio solicita el préstamo para construir su casa, comprara materiales como cemento y yeso.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rodolfo belongs to the Banco del Desarrollo communal bank, located in the Wanchaq district which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

Rodolfo is 40 years old and single. He studies electronic engineering at the Universidad Andina del Cusco (Andean University of Cusco) from 7am to 1pm. He wants to finish his degree program so that he can work for a business. Rodolfo is requesting the loan to build his house – he will purchase materials such as cement and plaster.

He is grateful to everyone who is making this dream possible and promises to make his payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as cement and plaster to build his house.

loans.name: Marilou Saluta Group

texts.en:
Marilou S. is 47 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Pan-ay, part of the municipality of Clarin in Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Marilou is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marilou is a farmer who plants and harvests rice for sale. She has been in business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2008 Marilou joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to grow. Marilou is requesting a new loan, her sixth from PMPC, of 14,900 PHP that will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Tulwanirewamu Community Group 1-Kampala

texts.en:
S. Hellen, 50, is now seven years into her farming business in Naluvule-Kampala. She makes 252,000 shillings a month in profit. She also runs a retail shop. 

The combined profits from her two businesses helps her provide better for her kids. She credits her husband for giving her some of the start-up capital back then when she was more inclined to small-scale subsistence agriculture. 

With this loan, Hellen, who belongs to Tulwanirewamu group-Kampala and who is also a mother of eight, says she is going to buy more stock for her retail enterprise and she also expects to improve her farming business with manure purchases.

loans.use: The purchase of more stock for her retail shop and manure for her farms

loans.name: Zoila Aurora

texts.es:
Zoila Aurora A. M. tiene 33 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar.   Tiene 5 hijos.

Zoila pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Zoila  se dedica a la agricultura por varios años,  siembra maíz y papa, además tiene animales de cría y ganado para luego vender,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar vehiculo.
Le gusta  jugar el fútbol.
texts.en:
Zoila Aurora A. M. is 33 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province. She has five children.

Zoila is a member of the Guantucoto Communal Bank, which is located a half hour from Guaranda. This group engages in farming and ranching, especially corn and potato production in the mountainous areas as well as in the coastal region where rice is grown. The Communal Bank has 25 members.

Zoila has been farming for several years, growing potatoes and corn. She also raises and sells livestock animals. Zoila buys her supplies in Guaranda and sells at the wholesale market in the same city.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing corn and potatoes. With the help of this loan, she will have the financial resources to acquire necessities for her family. The challenges she faces include pests and diseases that can impact her crops. Her dream is to buy a vehicle.

Zoila enjoys playing soccer.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for growing potatoes & corn

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 39 años de edad, es separada y cuenta con tres hijos a su cargo, reside en el caserío La Clake, una zona rural del distrito de Reque, conformado por pobladores muy humildes que usualmente se dedican  a la agricultura y a la ganadería, cuenta con electricidad, sin embargo se valen de un pozo para agenciarse de agua. La zona se encuentra situada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, especialmente a la ganadería, ella cuenta con dos vacas, de las cuales comercializa la leche que producen diariamente entre sus vecinos y en el mercado del distrito. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso por lo que siempre trata de mantener su negocio de la mejor forma, brindando una buena alimentación y cuidados a sus vacas.

Santos desea ampliar su negocio incursionando en la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, por ello ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

Santos es una mujer bastante responsable y que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
Santos is 39 years old, separated, and has three children.  She lives in the village of La Clake, a rural area in the Reque district, which is made up of humble people who usually work in agriculture and livestock.  It has electricity, but still relies on a well for their water supply.  It is located a half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She works in agriculture, especially with livestock.  She has two cows, and she sells the milk they produce to her neighbors and at the market in her district.  This is her primary source of income, so she tries to maintain her business at a high level by giving her cows good food and care.

Santos would like to expand her business into raising and selling small animals, so she decided to ask for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edypme Alternativa to achieve her goal.

Santos is a responsible woman who has a drive to get ahead.  People that know her think highly of her and respect her.

loans.use: Purchase animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 54 años, enviudo hace muchos años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 3 hijos y su nieto Fabricio. Hace más de 12 años viene dedicándose a la venta de ropa y vasijas de plástico, ya que su principal prioridad era sacar adelante a sus hijos y lo logró. Hoy en día, sus hijos  son hombres de bien y la apoyan cubriendo los gastos de la casa. Además ya no derrocha muchas energías como antes, cargando sus bolsos pesados bajo el hombro, ahora solo atiende los pedidos que le hicieran sus clientes, así tiene más horas libres para cuidar de su nieto, quien es su adoración. Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es que le genera ganancias que le ayudan a cubrir los gastos que necesita para su hogar. En adelante, anhela tener su negocio en su propia casa, de ese modo puede tener un vida mucho más tranquila. Es su 17avo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará prendas de vestir para el verano, de esa manera podrá incrementar su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Gladys is 54, widowed for many years, and lives in her own house with her 3 children and her grandson Fabricio.  For more than 12 years she has dedicated herself to selling clothes and plastic glasses, and her principal goal has been to advance her children.  She has succeeded.  Today, her sons are grown men and they help her cover household expenses.  Moreover, she no longer expends as much energy as before lugging heavy bags hanging from her shoulders.  Now, she just has to attend to the orders of her customers.  Thus, she has more free hours to care for her grandchild, who is her pride and joy.

What she likes best about her business is that it generates earnings that help to cover the costs  of necessities for her home.  In the future, she hopes to have her business in her own home so that she can have a much more tranquil life.

This is her 17th loan with MFP, and she knows that if she pays on time, she will have access to others with greater confidence, and without creating complications for her communal group.  With this loan, she will buy summer clothing and, in this manner, increment her stock of products.

loans.use: TO BUY SUMMER CLOTHES TO SELL

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Señora Delia Epifania A. C. que vive en la cuidad de Villarrica. Encantadas aceptaron conformar el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras nombrando al Comité Las Triunfadoras.
      La  mayoría de las integrantes se dedican a la elaboración de productos  alimenticios, como empanadas, sandwich, milanesas, y una parte se dedica a la reventa de mercaderías como remeras, camisas, pantalones, short, buzos, camisillas, lencerías.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Delia quien tiene una despensa y se dedica a la atención de la misma, se encuentra satisfecha ya que le ayuda con los gastos de la casa y así ella no necesita nada para la alimentación. 
Para esta época que llega desea estar prepara  con todas las mercaderías y para ello solicita el préstamo y comprar entre otras cosa vinos, sidras, gaseosas, golosinas, dulces, enlatados, embutidos, aceites. 
    Las Señoras agradecen a Kiva y a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo ofrecido porque gracias a eso lograron mejorar sus ingresos y  de esta manera sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group was formed with the efforts of Mrs. Delia Epifania Aramendia C.. She lives in the city of Villarrica. The members came together the group joined Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras under the name of Las Triunfadoras.

The majority of the members sell prepared foods, such as meat pies, sandwiches, meat patties. Some of the members have retail businesses from where they sell jackets, shirts, slacks, shorts, tank tops, undergarments, and lingerie.  

Delia is one of the members and she has a convenience store that she manages herself. She is very happy with the business because she is able to contribute towards the household expenses and she doesn’t need any support to buy the groceries. 

Especially for this time of year she wants to be ready with all the merchandise she will need, and to this end she requests a loan. She will purchase, among other things, wines, cidre, soft drinks, snacks, sweets, canned goods, and cooking oil. 

The women in this group convey their thanks to Kiva and Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner) for the support they have offered. It is thanks to this support that they have improved their incomes and consequently, their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, drinks, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 53 años, vive con su hijo en la casa de un familiar. Desde hace 7 años y medio vende comida en su mismo domicilio, por lo que tuvo que acondicionar un pequeño espacio dentro de su casa para ejercer este negocio. Su hijo es su gran apoyo, ya que él se encarga de ayudar en la atención de la clientela, mientras ella se esfuerza de preparar a tiempo el pedido de su comensal. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo, es su sentido de esfuerzo que pone cada día, asó como los nuevas que se propone llegar y una de ellas es vender todo la comida que prepara durante el día, ya que sus ganancias depende de lo que venda. Casi siempre lo logra, es por eso que esta muy contenta y se proyecta para el futuro ampliar su restaurante y que tengas todas la comodidades para sus asiduos clientes. Es su crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes no perecibles para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Gladys is 53 years old.  She lives with her son in a family member's house.  For seven and a half years, she has been selling meals in her own home.  She remodeled a small space in her home so that she could carry out her business there.  Gladys' son is a great support since he takes care of helping to serve her customers while she works hard to prepare her customers' orders on time.  What she likes about her business is the sense of hard work that she puts in every day.  She also likes to sell all the food that she prepares during the day since her profits depend on what she sells.  She almost always manages to sell everything and this makes her very happy.  In the future, she plans to expand her restaurant and to ensure that it has all the comforts her regular customers need.

This is Glady's second loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being part of her community bank because all the members are people that she knows.  They are all responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  Gladys would like to thank all the people who will help to fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying non-perishable ingredients for making her meals.

loans.use: To buy non-perishable products for preparing more meals

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua K. is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been through junior high school. Ekua sells cooking utensils at Abura. Eku assists her husband in providing for the basic needs of the family. The loan will be added to her initial capital to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to build a shop.

loans.use: add to her initial capital to expand her business

loans.name: Edwin Amilcar

texts.es:
El señor Edwin R. labora en el Municipio de Masaya, desde hace 3 años. Es el responsable de llevar el sustento a su familia compuesta por sus cuatro hijos menores.

Con el crédito solicitado, logrará pagar una motocicleta el cual le es de mucha utilidad para su movilización a su trabajo y al igual para realizar los mandados del hogar y llevar a sus niños a la escuela en dicho medio de transporte.

Espera que su crédito le sea otorgado y así aprovecharlo al máximo en conjunto de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. R. P. works in the Masaya municipality in the Masaya department.  He has worked for three years for a company called ENACAL.  He works as a well operator.  He pays for the family expenses with this income.  His family is comprised of his life partner and his four minor children.

He now needs to pay the balance on a motorcycle that he got on credit from United Motors.  That is why he came to the CEPRODEL offices to request a loan.  The loan is to pay the balance he mentioned.

It should be noted that this vehicle is very important to him.  Before going to work he takes his children to the learning center.  He feels that it is safer to take them himself instead of sending them with another person or alone.

loans.use: Pay for Motorcycle

loans.name: Manuela Isabel

texts.es:
Manuela es una pequeña comerciante, de venta de tortillas, siendo su medio de trabajo por cinco años, iniciando con dinero propio que su esposo dio, el cual labora en servicios de seguridad.
Quien vendía tortilla era familia de mi esposo, luego ella no sigue por inconvenientes, en donde comienza a palmear con poco dinero, y lograr mantener la clientela lo que ha venido aumentando de producción con préstamos que Afodenic ha dado en cuatro ciclos, en donde aumentado el nivel de ventas, ha hecho pequeñas mejora  a su vivienda.
Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento hará un bajarete en frente logrando amortiguar la colar y donde podrá estar en mejores condiciones de trabajo, comprara materiales de construcción como: laminas de zinc, cuartones de madera, clavos, entre otros materiales para hacer la obra.
texts.en:
Manuela's business is selling tortillas.  She has been in this line of work for five years.  She started out with her own money that she got from her husband who works as a security guard.

"It was a member of my husband's family who used to sell tortillas but then she had problems and couldn't continue".  Manuela began hand making her tortillas with little money but she managed to keep her customers and increase her production with loans that she received from Afodenic over the course of four loan cycles.  Her sales levels have increased and she has made some small improvements to her home.

Manuela will use this loan to build a porch out the front of her home to take the edge off the heat and so that she can have better working conditions.  She will buy building supplies such as corrugated metal sheets, wooden boards, nails and other materials she needs to carry out the work.

loans.use: To buy building supplies such as corrugated metal sheets, wooden boards, nails and other materials

loans.name: Salud Y Vida Group

texts.es:
El grupo Salud y Vida está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Juana Aracely H. desde hace 16 años inicio su pulpería con una pequeña mesa la cual dice conserva como reliquia. Ella decidió tener su negocio propio para poder dedicarles más tiempo a sus hijos.
La otras integrantes son Mireya O. M. quien vende ropa desde loa edad de 13 años primero le ayudaba a su madre  y desde hace 30 años vende de manera independiente y Marbelly Gómez tiene una pequeña venta.
texts.en:
The 'Salud y Vida' (Health and Life) group is made up of three hard-working women.  One of them is Juana Aracely H..  16 years ago, Juana set up a grocery store with just a small table that she tells us she still keeps as a reminder of that time.  She decided to set up her own business so that she could spend more time looking after her children.

The second member of the group is Mireya O. M. who has been selling clothes since she was 13 years old.  She started out helping her mother and has now been working for herself for the past 30 years.  The third member is Marbelly Gómez who has a small sales business.

loans.use: To buy basic grains

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.en: Zoraida is a 41-year-old single woman who supports her family through direct selling of plastic home products and operating a sari-sari store. She lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. Zoraida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Zoraida has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000 to purchase more stock to sell both for her home products business and for the sari-sari store so that she can continue to save up for her future security and to support her household expenses. Zoraida is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more home products to sell

loans.name: Tawopaneh Group

texts.en:
Adama I. K., 34, is married to a teacher, and the couple has five children. Adama has been a businesswoman for ten years now, selling fish, rice, vegetable oil, margerine, salt, etc. She is also the leader of the Tawopaneh Group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone.

The Tawopaneh Group is comprised of five local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of 2,500,000 SLL, with 500,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

With the help of this loan, Adama will buy fish, rice, vegetable oil, margerine, salt, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy fish, rice, vegetable oil, margerine, salt, etc.in bulk for her business

loans.name: Nuevas Amigas De Mercedes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVAS AMIGAS DE MERCEDES” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Claudina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Importación de relojes, costura de ropa, ayudante de albañil, artesanía en algodón, venta de CD’s, inicio de negocio, Tejido de máquinas, venta de chamarras.

La señora Claudina,  indica que es la primera ves que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de los promotores. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de chatarra que viene realizando hace un año atrás; este negocio lo aprendió de su amiga.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de chatarra (que servirá para incrementar su capital), posteriormente lo venderá en su casa, todos los días de 8:00 a 18:00. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene seis hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la salud.
texts.en:
The “NUEVAS AMIGAS DE MERCEDES” (Mercedes' New Friends) community bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada regional office.  The group has nine members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Claudina.  The businesses that the group's members carry out are varied and include: importing watches, sewing clothes, working as an assistant builder, making cotton handicrafts, selling CDs, starting up a new business, machine knitting and selling jackets.

Claudina tells us that this is the first time that she has been part of one of Pro Mujer's community banks.  She joined through an invitation from the promoters.  Claudina currently has a business selling scrap metal which she has had for one year.  She learned the business from her friend.

The loan that Claudina is currently taking out will be used to buy scrap metal (which will increase her capital).  She will then sell the scrap from her home every day from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  This work allows Claudina to make money to support her family as best she can.  She lives with her partner and has six children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, es comerciante de ropa y medicinas, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 6 y 4 años, él trabaja en lo propio y sin un horario fijo.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de medicinas, vitaminas, analgésicos, antibióticos, entre otros medicamentos, esta inversión fortalecerá el negocio y ayudara a brindar un mejor servicio a los clientes.
El aspira ampliar la línea de productos, mejorar la clientela y estar en buenas condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
Mario lives in San Rafael Oriente, San Miguel Department.  He is a clothes and medicine merchant.  He lives with his wife and two children who are 6 and 4 years of age.  He works for himself and does not have a fixed work schedule.

He is asking for a loan to buy medicines, vitamins, analgesics and antibiotics, among other medicines.  This investment will strengthen the business and help him provide better customer service.

He hopes to expand the line of products, to improve his clientele and to be in good condition with his family.

loans.use: to buy medicines, vitamines, analgesics and antibiotics.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Carlos René

texts.es: Carlos René, de 50 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposa. Cada día se levanta muy temprano para poder atender su negocio, el cual consiste en la venta de frutas y verduras en un puesto que posee en el mercado regional de la ciudad en que vive. Es un lugar muy concurrido y en especial el puesto de Don Carlos ya que siempre mantiene verduras y frutas frescas, además, los clientes lo prefieren por ser un hombre honesto y amable ya que su prioridad son las personas que demandan sus productos. El sueña con tener un puesto abastecido de las diferentes frutas y verduras pero no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para realizar su sueño. Debido a esto Don Carlos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito para invertir en su negocio y poder comprar variedad de frutas como: sandias, melones, bananas, cocos, manzanas, etc. Así como variedad de verduras: papas, yuca, güisquiles, zanahorias, chiles, etc. Con la fe puesta en Dios que de esta manera logrará obtener mejores ingresos que le permitirán tener y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos René, 50, lives in his own home along with his wife. Every day he gets up very early to be able to staff his business which consists of selling fruits and vegetables in a stall he has in a regional market in the city where he lives. It is an area that receives a lot of business, and especially Don Carlos's stall, as he always keeps fresh produce and, in addition, his customers prefer him for being an honest and pleasant man since his priority is the people who demand his products. 

He dreams of keeping a stall that is well-stocked with the different fruits and vegetables but he does not have the necessary economic resources to fulfill his dream. Because of this, Don Carlos has made the decision to seek this loan to invest in his business and be able to buy a variety of fruits such as watermelon, other melons, bananas, coconuts, apples, etc., as well as a variety of vegetables: potatoes, yucca, chayotes, carrots, chile peppers, etc. With faith in God he hopes by this means he will bring in better earnings which will allow him to have and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits such as watermelon, other melons, bananas, coconuts, apples etc. as well as a variety of vegetables: potatoes, yucca, chayotes, carrots, chile peppers etc.

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en:
Barbra is 16 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Barbra has a tailoring business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Barbra has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials for making clothes. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Barbra hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Barbra is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her more skills, such as how to account for her money and how to save it.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es:
Artemio es un hombre trabajador de 52 años de edad que vive con su esposa y dos hijos en una comunidad humilde y pequeña en vías de desarrollo cuyos pobladores son comerciantes o se dedican a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 20 minutos del distrito de Mórrpe en Lambayeque.

Artemio tiene 10 años de experiencia en su trabajo, él se dedica al comercio de verduras de manera ambulatoria o en su propio domicilio. Artemio cuenta con sembríos propios y con clientela fija, que son comerciantes chiclayanos, él tiene muchos deseos de superarse y es por ello que desea invertir en su negocio.

Artemio solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar lenteja de palo y maíz que actualmente se encuentran en temporada de cosechas por su zona. Esto le permitirá aumentar su mercadería y por lo tanto su producción

Artemio es una persona muy conocida en la zona debido a la labor que realiza. Este se ha propuesto acopiar maíz para luego venderlo a un mejor precio. Artemio quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y este préstamo le ayudaría a hacerlo.

Artemio ya ha trabajo con nuestra entidad y goza de un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Artemio is a hard-working man, 52 years old, who lives with his wife and two children in a small and humble community which is still developing. Its inhabitants work as merchants, raise animals or work in agriculture. The community is located 20 minutes from the district of Mórrpe in Lambayeque.

Artemio has 10 years of experience with his work. He works selling vegetables as a mobile vendor or from his own home. Artemio has his own crops and has steady customers who are merchants from Chiclayo. He has a great desire to get ahead in life, and for this reason, he wants to invest in his business. 

Artemio is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 Peruvian new soles, in order to buy lentils and corn, which are currently being harvested in his area. This will allow him to expand his stock of merchandise and thus his turnover. 

Artemio is a person who is very well-known in his area because of the work he does. He has decided to store corn so that he can sell it later at a better price. Artemio would like to improve his quality of life, and this loan will help him to do so. 

Artemio has worked with this financial institution in the past and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy lentils and corn which are currently in production.

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en: Ophelia is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Ophelia has a retail shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy stock of used clothing. Ophelia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future,Ophelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing.

loans.name: Kabayirwe

texts.en: Kabayirwe is a 49-year-old married woman with seven children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Kabayirwe has been selling soda for two years. She got the initial capital to start her current business by farming. She has challenges in terms of limited funds to supply her increasing customer base. Her dream is to own a soda depot. Kabayirwe is requesting this loan facility to buy soda for resale.

loans.use: to buy soda for resale.

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Unidas lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Masaya. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Lidia quien tiene una tortillería y vende chiverías desde hace desde hace 7 años. Este negocio lo inicio con un quintal de maíz medio flete de leña (la mitad de una carreta de leña) y un comal; ahora ella utiliza cuatro quintales.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Juana   quien vende ropa y cosméticos desde hace 2 años y Vilma  de 52 años se dedica al destace de cerdo y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The “Unidas” (Together) group is composed of three hard working, enterprising women from Masaya.  The group coordinator is Lidia who has a tortilla shop and she’s also been selling snacks for the last 7 years.  She started the business with just a quintal of corn, half a wagonload of firewood and one griddle.  Now, she consumes four quintals.

The other group members are Juana who has sold clothes and cosmetics for the last two years and Vilma, 52, who butchers pigs and sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, powdered lime, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children who are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase bags of beans for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to businesses.

loans.use: to purchase bags of beans for resale

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 42 years old and lives in Manamong Aloran. He is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Manuel has a business selling canned goods, soft drinks, milk, sugar, etc. He earns about PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. Manuel has  requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more merchandise for his  snacks business.

Manuel has been a member of PMPC for three years.  Manuel would like to thank PMPC because PMPC helps him to add his capital of his sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for his  snacks business.

loans.name: Las 5 Rosas Group

texts.es:
El joven Everfein vive en una localidad muy bonita, en donde las personas cosechan plántanos y  la  naranja. El es soltero y desea seguir estudiando.

    El solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ganados para luego venderlo en la misma región, en donde lleva apenas cinco meses  y   ve que le está dando resultado.
   
    Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó, ya que su papa tambien se dedica a lo mismo  y decidió trabajar con él  pero con su propio dinero.

    Lo que más desea es que así como está iniciando  día con día aumente más su ganancia y poder trabajar con el préstamo para a horrar y continuar estudiando.
 
    Las personas que integran en el grupo son: las señora Angelina, quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra de trastes de peltre y platico, así también está la señora Silveria  quien se dedica a la elaboración de pan y solicito el  prestar para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes y por último se integra la señora Benita quien  invertirá el préstamo en la compra de pollos de rancho para luego venderlo.
texts.en:
Young Everfein lives in a very pretty village where people grow bananas and oranges.  He is single and would like to continue with his studies.

Everfein requested this loan to invest in buying livestock which he will later sell in his region.  He has been in his business for just five months and he can see that it is providing good results.

Everfein's became interested in this business as his father is in the same business.  He decided to work alongside his father but with his own money.  What he would most like is to keep increasing his profits day by day and be able to work with his loan so that he can save and continue with his studies.
